loans.name: Gea

texts.en:
Gea previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase bulk quantities of fabric, thread, and other items needed in her business. Her earnings helped to educate her children and meet personal, house hold, and business expenses.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy fabric, cloth, thread and other items.  She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Gea hopes to have workers soon and dreams that her family will be in good health. She meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business  and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase  fabric, cloth, thread and other items needed in her business.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to buy paint, screens, and shirts as well as clothing and other items for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy paint, screens, and shirts as well as clothing and other items for her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Arlene dreams to be more successful and have more customers. She hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week where she finds strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for paint, screens, and shirts as well as clothing and other items for her business.

loans.name: Fe Amie

texts.en:
Fe Amie works hard to support her family. Fe Amie is married and has had a fishing business in the Philippines for 5 years.

She requests 3,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fishing nets and gasoline for her fishing business.

In the future, Fe Amie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and gasoline for her fishing business.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over four years, Chizi has operated an open air food business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the 15,000 KES, Chizi wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is single with three school-going kids. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her kids as she is the breadwinner. 

She has operated a clothes selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces the major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting KES 40,000.  She wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
José es un hombre de 39 años, es acompañado y tiene dos hijos, uno de los hijos ya no vive con él porque se acompaño. José es un hombre tranquilo que trabaja en la albañilería y fue su padre el que le enseño a trabajar en esa actividad,  lo hace desde hace unos seis años, él solamente estudio hasta quinto grado ya que su familia no contaba con los recursos suficiente para ponerlo a estudiar.

Antes de dedicarse a la albañilería, él se dedicaba a la agricultura en la siembra de granos básicos. El crédito que esta solicitando,  es para comprar una pulidora y un compresor, herramientas que le hacen falta, para desarrollar mejor su trabajo ya que lo hace todos los días de siete de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde, con el crédito le ayudara a fortalecer mas su actividad para obtener mejores ingresos para su familia y su sueños es construir una casa mejor para que su hijo tenga un buen lugar donde vivir mejor.
texts.en:
José is 39 years old, married, and has two children.  One of his children does not live with him because they are married.  José is a calm man who works in construction.  He learned this work from his father and has been doing it for six years.  He only attended school through fifth grade since his family did not have money to send him to school.  Before working in construction, he worked as a farmer planting basic grains.  

He is requesting this loan to purchase a polishing machine and a compressor, which are tools that he is missing so that he can improve his work.  He works every day from 7:00am until 4:00pm.  The loan will help him strengthen his business and earn more income for his family.  His dream is to build a better house so that his son will have a better place to live.

loans.use: to purchase a polishing machine and a compressor.

loans.name: Bladimir Velasquez

texts.es: Bladimir es un padre de familia responsable que se preocupa por el bienestar de sus hijos, junto a su esposa se dedica a trabajar en su pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, solicita este crédito para invertir en el negocio con mas productos del interés de su clientela, Bladimir espera ir creciendo poco a poco y poner una carnicería para incrementar así las ventas de esta manera garantizar a sus hijos un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Bladimir is a responsible head of his family who worries about the well-being of his children.  Together with his wife, he works at a grocery store located in his home.

He is requesting this loan to invest in the business by purchasing more products that will interest his customers.  Bladimir hopes to continue growing his business little by little.  He wants to open a butcher shop to increase his sales and guarantee a better future for his children.

loans.use: to purchase soda, basic grains, meat, chicken, vegetables, cereal, and canned goods.

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold is a kind and hardworking 45-year-old man. He is married and has two children. He lives with his family in a rural village. He is involved in his own business to provide an income. He has grown agricultural crops, planted rice, and gardened for several years. He gathers his harvest, takes it to a large market and sells it there. He was previously involved in organized farming and then decided to sells his own harvest. 

Arnold earns a good income from his business and spends it to meet family needs. He wants to expand his rice-growing business but does not have enough of his own money to purchase rice seeds. This is why Arnold  wants to obtain a loan to buy seeds for sowing. He hopes very much for a positive result and thanks ASKI/KIVA in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy seeds for sowing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep for her farm.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a 52-year-old married woman with 4 children. She describes herself as hopeful. 

She operates a retail business to sell cereal. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are small scale. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation costs. She will use 20,000 KES to buy cereal. Her business goal is to excel within 5 years. 

This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy cereal.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 27-year-old married woman with 3 children. She describes herself as determined. 

She operates a tailoring business to make clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are small scale. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as rental costs. She will use 20,000 KES to buy thread, fabric and other tailoring materials. Her business goal is to excel within 5 years. 

This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric and other tailoring materials.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is a 39-year-old married woman with 3 children. She describes herself as confident. 

She operates a retail business to sell shoes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a conducive environment and her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low income. 

She will use 20,000 KES to restock shoes. Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. 

This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to restock shoes.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalina is married and she works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by making and selling dried fish in the Philippines. She earns additional income raising livestock. Magdalina requests 37,000 PHP through NWTF  to buy additional ingredients for her dried fish  business.

Magdalina has sustained her business activities through her past twenty-three loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her dried fish business.

loans.name: Inocente Antonila

texts.es:
Las mujeres de la ciudad León se caracterizan por ser emprendedoras, fuertes y  seguras. Antolina de 55 años es un ejemplo de ello. Ella es originaria de León y  desde hace seis años abrió una pequeña miscelánea con un capital que fue fruto de sus ahorros. Con su esfuerzo ha logrado  que su negocio tenga aceptación ante un público consumidor que cada día busca  más variedad.
Al ver que aumentaba la demanda de otros productos, Antolina solicitó un préstamo de apoyo integral en KIVA para satisfacer las  necesidades de sus clientes. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de shampoo, sardinas, jugos y galletas, que son los preferidos entre los consumidores, incluyendo los granos básicos(arroz, frijoles, maiz, azucar). De esta manera sus ganancias aumentarán  para beneficio de su familia y  negocio.
texts.en:
The women in the city of León are known for being entrepreneurial, strong and secure.  Antolina is 55 years old and she is an example of this.  She is a native of León and six years ago, she opened a small general store using her savings.  Through her effort, she has been able to ensure that her business is accepted by consumers that are searching for more variety everyday.

After seeking that the demand for other products was increasing, Antolina sought a loan from Kiva to meet the needs of her customers.  She will use the loan to purchase shampoo, sardines, juices and cookies, which are her customers' favored items, as well as basic grains (rice, beans, corn, sugar).  This way, she will be able to increase her earnings in order to benefit her family and her business.

loans.use: purchase shampoo, sardines, juices and cookies, which are her customers' favored items, as well as basic grains (rice, beans, corn, sugar)

loans.name: Sonny Boy

texts.en:
Sonny Boy previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that he used to buy medicines needed in his business. His earnings  helped to  educate his children and meet personal, household, and business expenses.
 
He would like to apply for another 8,000 PHP loan to buy medicine needed in his business as more items to sell will result in better profits. His profits from business will definitely help him meet his daily needs and his children's education expenses. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Sonny Boy hopes to have more customers and dreams that his family will always have good health. He meets with his co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of his work.  He also draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God that he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase medicine needed in his business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 48-year-old married woman with 3 children between the ages of 10 and 25. She describes herself as goal oriented and flexible. 

She operates a bakery to cook bread and cakes. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a business friendly area and her primary customers are regular customers.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be high distribution costs. She will use 10,000 KES to buy wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil and other ingredients to make bread and cakes. 

Her business goal is to own a big bakery within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a sustainable business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, sugar, cooking oil and other ingredients to make bread and cakes.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories and for the maintenance of their jeepney unit. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household and business expenditures. She also makes and sells doormats for additional income.
 
She would like to apply for another loan, this time for 50,000 PHP, to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their jeepney. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and her child's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Erlinda hopes to have an additional jeepney and dreams that her family is always in good health. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of her jeepney.

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura is divorced and blessed with seven children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Zuhura cooks food for sale at the market and sells to town dwellers and passersby. She dreams of establishing a café business in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase food ingredients such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies wholesale (sugar, Milo, coffee, herbal teas, disposable cups, stir-sticks, serviettes, etc.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana belongs to a poor family and lives with her spouse and three children in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a blacksmith and he manufactures iron accessories for doors and windows. He provides door-to-door services to weld the broken accessories.

His current stock is low and due to increases in iron’s prices, he is unable to buy welding materials such as welding rods and soldering rods.

Therefore, Shabana requests a loan from BRAC who is an active field partner of Kiva, so that her husband would be able to buy these items.
  
Shabana thanks Kiva and their field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy welding material for a manufacturing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase cement, sand, galvanized sheet metal and wood to repair the roof and replaster the walls of her home.

loans.name: Oscar Marcelo

texts.es: El joven Oscar tiene 25 años y es Soltero,  estudia la carrera  de técnico superior en administración de empresas en un instituto muy reconocido  de  la Ciudad de La Paz,  trabaja para pagar sus estudios El joven Oscar trabaja como chofer asalariado, es de ahí que tiene un ingreso extra,  este es su primer crédito con la institución y  el joven Oscar va a usar este préstamo para  la compra de libros y material de escritorio ya que esto le ayudara a realizar sus trabajos,  Oscar enfrenta retos en su estudios que son Su trabajo no le permite dedicarse completamente a sus  estudio, pero el joven tiene ganas de continuar y seguir adelante, su deseo cuando termine sus estudios es Quiere ejercer su profesión, mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia y con el tiempo poder tener una licenciatura en su área.
texts.en:
Oscar is 25 years old and is single.  He is studying business administration in a very well known institution in the city of La Paz.  He works as a salaried chauffeur to pay for his education.  

This is his first loan with the institution, and Oscar will use the loan to purchase books and school supplies, which will help him to do his work.  Oscar faces challenges in his education.  His job does not allow him to dedicate himself completely to his studies, but the young man has a desire to continue and get ahead.  His wish is to practice his profession upon completing his education, so that he can improve his and his family's quality of life, and in time earn a degree in his field.

loans.use: purchase books and school supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flooring bricks, cement, and sand, and to pay for the labor to pave the floor of her home.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a married woman; she has one child. She describes herself to be courageous. 

Naomi operates a retail business where she sells secondhand clothes, and she has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a competitive place, and she has all types of customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital to buy more stock of clothes. 

She will use the Kes 90,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. 

Her business goal is to have a reliable business within five years. 

She hopes that in the future her family will benefit from the business. She will plow the anticipated profits back into the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Kibet

texts.en:
Kibet is a 28-year-old, single man. He describes himself as "creative." He operates a farm, where he grows tea for selling. He has been involved in this business for four years. His primary customers are small-scale. He says his biggest business challenge is insufficient capital.

He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy a larger stock of tea leaves to resell. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable business. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to buy tea seedlings to plant.

loans.use: to buy a stock of tea leaves to sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a 37-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 5 years to 15 years. She describes herself to be visionary. 

She operates a retail business where she sells basins, school uniforms, utensils and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in the seasons. 

She will use the KES 120,000 loan to buy more stock of utensils for resale. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

Her business goal is to be the best in the business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will raise the living standards of her family. 

This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 80,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of utensils for resale.

loans.name: Luciah

texts.en:
Luciah is a 29-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. 

She operates a retail business where she sells kale, tomatoes and fruits. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a competitive place, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes and fruits. 

Her business goal is to own a big shop within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock of items she sells.

loans.use: buy more stock of tomatoes and fruits.

loans.name: Jonasita

texts.en:
Jonasita is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jonasita is 39 years old, and has two children who are in school.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. Jonasita has been in this business for four years.

She requested a PHP 14,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

In the future, Jonasita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Meet Teresa, a farmer living in Kisii area of South Nyanza Kenya, which is a very rich area for growing bananas and sugar cane. She is married and has five children, all of school-going age.

She has been doing farming for the past 18 years. Her primary sources of income are milk, bananas and sugarcane. In farming, she enjoys mixed farming the most, but her biggest challenge is lack of enough capital.

Teresa chose Juhudi Kilimo because they help small people like her to access loans to improve her life, and they offer low interest rates on their loans. Through this dairy loan, there will be improvement in her income and hence, enable her to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for nine years now.

Asuncion requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle business.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is a married woman and has been blessed with nine kids, three of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

Mariamu operates a fish selling business, which has been operational for over 20 years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. Mariamu dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fish to sell. 

She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish to sell

loans.name: Martha Nelly

texts.es:
Martha, a sus 55 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho empeño y dedicación, ya que es cabeza de hogar desde que se separó de su esposo hace muchos años.
Durante 14 años de su vida productiva, se ha dedicado a trabajar como comerciante independiente, vendiendo ropa infantil en un pequeño puesto ubicado en el centro de la ciudad, allí trabaja sola todos los días de 9 am a 6 pm y así logra generar los recursos para solventar los gastos familiares.
El crédito solicitado será destinado a la compra de surtido al por mayor de ropa infantil (camisetas, pantalones, chaquetas), esto le permitirá ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes y así aumentar las ventas e ingresos.
Martha manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando arduamente para tener una estabilidad económica que le permita disfrutar mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar, y tener una vejez digna  y tranquila.
texts.en:
Martha is 55 years old, and is the mother of three children, who she has gotten ahead with a lot of effort and dedication.  She is now the head of the household as she separated from her husband many years ago.  During 14 years of her career, she has worked as an independent businesswoman, selling children's clothing in a small outpost located in the center of the city.  There, she works alone everyday from 9am to 6pm, which allows her to earn an income to cover her family's expenses.  

The requested loan will be used to purchase an assortment of children's clothing in bulk (shirts, pants, jackets).  This will allow her to offer a greater variety to her customers, and therefore increase her sales and earnings.  Martha states that her greatest desire is to continue to work hard so that she can have financial stability that will allow her to enjoy better living conditions and wellness, and to spend her old age with dignity and tranquility.

loans.use: purchase an assortment of children's clothing in bulk (shirts, pants, jackets)

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman and has eight children. She lives at a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years, she has operated an open-air food stall business. Her potential customers are market dwellers and neighbors. 

With the KES 40,000, she wants to purchase sacks of beans, cooking oil, wheat flour and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, cooking oil, wheat flour and rice.

loans.name: Mlongo

texts.en:
Mlongo is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, and salt for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, and salt for resale

loans.name: Ancizar Wilson

texts.es:
Ancizar es un hombre pujante y trabajador de 36 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su compañera sentimental y sus dos hijos de 10 y 5 años, quienes se han convertido en su principal motivación para salir adelante.
Desde hace 18 años trabaja de manera independiente, vende productos de aseo y mercancía por encargo como ropa y calzado; adicionalmente comenzó un pequeño negocio de venta de jugos y alimentos fritos, en el que recibe el apoyo de su esposa, se encuentra ubicado en el centro de la ciudad, trabajan de 7 am a 6 pm y así logra complementar los ingresos para solventar los gastos básicos del hogar.
Con el ánimo de fortalecer y acreditar su negocio, invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de 3 licuadoras y un exprimidor de naranjas semi industrial, pues desea ampliarse y montar el negocio en un pequeño local, así podrá aumentar su capacidad instalada y estará en la capacidad de satisfacer la demanda de sus productos.
Ancizar manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es tener un negocio grande y reconocido en el sector, en el que pueda ofrecer gran diversidad de productos y mejorar la estabilidad económica del hogar, para dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y educación.
texts.en:
Ancizar is a vigrous and hard-working 36 year old. He lives with his common-law wife and two children 5 and 10 years old. They are his principal motivation to get ahead. For 18 years he has worked independently selling cleaning products and merchandise on order like clothing and shoes. Also he has started a small business selling juices and fried foods. His wife helps him. It is located in the center of the city. He works from 7am until 6 pm and through this he pays his household expenses.

With the aim of strengthening his business he will use the loan to buy 3 blenders and a semi-industrial orange juicer. He wants to expand and place his business in a small stand. Then he can expand his capacity and be able to satisfy the demand for his product.

Ancizar says that his main dream is to have a large well-known business where he can offer a variety of products. He wants to stabilize his household finances so he can provide his children with a higher standard of living and education.

loans.use: to investing in his juicing business

loans.name: Nicolas Tolentino

texts.es: Nicolas tiene 64 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hijo de 17 años de edad. Nicolas es un hombre trabajador, responsable y visionario. Nicolas se dedica a la prestación de servicios de transporte desde hace tres años por lo que muchas personas le tienen confianza y lo buscan por el servicio. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un pequeño cuarto el cual por falta de recursos económicos no ha logrado terminar. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo y hierro. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Nicolas is 64 years old and lives in his own house with his 17-year-old son.  Nicolas is a hard-working, responsible and visionary man. For the past three years he has been providing transportation services and many people rely on him and seek out his service. 

He is asking FUSAI for this loan so he can build a small room which he has been unable to complete due to lack of funds. He will use the money to buy cement, sand, bricks, and iron. He hopes that he can count on this financing so that he will be able to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, and iron to build a room.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to construct a good cereals store

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es: El señor Oscar tiene 32 años, él se dedica a la venta de variedad de ropa, el señor Oscar vende sus prendas de vestir en su tienda que se encuentra en la zona 12 de Octubre, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el señor Oscar va a usar este préstamo para compra de ropa al por mayor  por cambio de temporada y así surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su mercadería, el señor Oscar enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando  mercadería y así de esta manera genera más ingresos económicos, se siente feliz ya agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan para crecer en su actividad, mejorara sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Señor Oscar is 32 years old.  He works selling a variety of clothing.  Señor Oscar sells these outfits in his store, located in the Twelfth of October neighborhood.  

This loan is his first from this institution.  Señor Oscar is going to use this loan to buy clothing in bulk for the change of seasons and thus stock his business.  His reason for asking for this loan is to increase his merchandise.  

Señor Oscar faces challenges in his business such as competition, and he is going to use his profits to keep buying merchandise.  In this way, he can generate a larger income.  

He is happy and grateful for the opportunity that they are giving him to grow his business, improve his income, and therefore his quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Inga

texts.en:
Inga is a 29-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia. Her husband is an artisan, and gets orders to renovate houses and generate income. Inga runs a bakery and gets a monthly income. 

She decided to start an additional business and increase the family income. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of $3,000. With the received credit and the savings that the family has, they will purchase a small flat to rent out and get additional monthly income. 

Inga's husband will renovate the flat himself, and they will be able to rent it at a good price. The family awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a flat to rent out.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock up on second-hand inventory items

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a gravestone-making business in the Philippines. Jessica has been in this business for four years, and she earns additional income from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF. She will use this amount to purchase materials for her work, like paints and stones. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her gravestone-making business, like paints and stones

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheeting and wood to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: David

texts.es: El Señor  David tiene 24 años,  él se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir, tiene su taller en la zona de Gran Poder,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Señor  David  va a usar este préstamo para compra de una máquina de coser recta doble aguja, para la confección de chamarras, su razón para solicitar es que tiene muchos pedidos para esta época,  el Señor  David  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar la calidad de sus prendas de vestir,  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando Máquinas de coser para la realización de su trabajo y equipar su taller, el Señor  David  es una persona con ganas de seguir adelante se siente feliz por esta oportunidad que le brindan para mejorar su negocio y por ende sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: David is 24 years old and works making garments. He has his workshop in the area of Gran Poder. This loan is his first loan cycle within the institution. David will use this loan to buy a sewing machine with double needle to sew jackets. The reason of his request is that he has many orders at this time of the year. David faces challenges in his business such as to improve the quality of his clothing items. He is going to use the benefits to keep on buying sewing machines to complete his work and equip his workshop. David is a person who wants to advance, and feels happy with this opportunity given to him to improve his business, and therefore his financial income.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine with double needle

loans.name: Mengnora

texts.en: Mengnora is a kind woman. She is 45 years old. She is married and has five children. Her husband works in a local market and has a small salary. Mengnora has been busy with her own business, for more than 10 years. She began business, growing agricultural products, 10 years ago. She grows crops in a 0.4 hectare plot of land. In January 2014 she began an additional business, animal husbandry. Mengnora feeds cows. Now, her business is going well and she is going to develop this business further. She is asking for a loan of 3,500 Somoni to buy cattle. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
Cresencia is a 56-year-old, hard-working woman. She lives in the village of Bayabo, in the Tumauini. She works hard on the family-owned vineyard, and also rents a plot of agricultural land. However, the income isn't stable and her business needs some investment for further development. After several unsuccessful borrowing attempts, Cresencia applied for a loan from ASKI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and rice seed to grow. Her request was approved within the framework of the Start-Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses.

With the requested money, she will cultivate the land, plant rice and sell it. She will be able to generate more income and make a better life for her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and rice seed to grow.

loans.name: Takky Ligueye Group

texts.fr: Le  groupe de crédit Takku Ligueye regroupe dix  femmes qui font parti d’une association de développement. Leur  activité consiste à faire  du commerce de divers produits : achats et vente de chaussures, habits prêt a porter, parfum, bijoux etc.  Leur présidente, madame Rokhaya  fait du commerce depuis plus de 3 ans. Elle est mariée et responsable de famille car elle participe à la dépense quotidienne du foyer  en appuyant son époux pour  le payement des frais de scolarité des  enfants .Rokhaya demande ce montant pour renforcer son fond de commerce et satisfaire sa demande. Elle commence sa journée jà 8h pour la terminer à 16h. Avec l’épargne qu’elle réussi à mettre de coté, elle envisage dans l’avenir d’ouvrir un magasin. A l’avenir, elle souhaite grâce aux crédits de l’institution renforcer d’avantage son activité et diversifier ses marchandises.
texts.en: The Takku Ligueye loan group is composes of 10 women belonging to a business improvement association. They work as vendors selling various products: shows, ready-to-wear clothing, perfume, jewelry etc. Their leader, Mrs. Rokhaya, has been a vendor for over three years. She is married and has family responsibilities. She contributes to the household budget by helping her husband cover the costs of their children’s schooling. Rokhaya is applying for this loan in order to bolster her work capital and meet customer demand. She starts her day at 8 AM and ends at 4 PM. With her savings that she was able to put aside, she plans to open a store some day. In the future, thanks to her loan, she would like to grow her business and diversify her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy various items for resale.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en: Mwaka appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She is requesting a loan to purchase sweets, cooking oil, wheat flour, and maize flour for resale. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, cooking oil, wheat flour, and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
As a married parent of one children, Cheryl works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Cheryl is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional bundle of fishing net and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

Cheryl has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of fishing net and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Mwanamkasi

texts.en:
Mwanamkasi appreciates the previous loan that helped her to purchase rice, sugar, maize flour, wheat flour and cooking oil for her business,

Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of KES 20,000 to buy soap, rice, bread, maize flour, and wheat flour for sale. She thanks Yehu and Kiva at large for the support.

loans.use: to buy soap, rice, bread, maize flour, and wheat flour for sale.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Todas las piezas que elabora Guadalupe Rivera están llenas de sorpresas, diversión y entusiasmo. Su trabajo consiste en elaborar vistosas piñatas, que son el alma de la fiesta en cada evento. Cuenta con catorce años de experiencia en este oficio, llevándola a tener una amplia clientela, que la prefiere por su creatividad y detalles que aplica en las piñatas que ofrece. 
Gracias al primer crédito otorgado por KIVA, aumentaron sus ventas, ya que pudo abastecer a  nuevos clientes quedadon satisfechos por el trabajo que con tanto afán y amor realiza día tras día. Guadalupe espera seguir contando con el apoyo de esta institución,  es por eso que solicitó otro préstamo para la compra de nuevos materiales(papel blanco y de colores, cuerda, y ollas de barro) para la elaboracion de sus piñatas. Su propósito es continuar innovando en sus piezas, y  por supuesto,  mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
All the pieces that Guadalupe Rivera creates are full of surprises, fun, and excitement.  Her work consists of creating attractive piñatas, which are the soul of the party for any event.  She has fourteen years of experience in this line of work, bringing her to the point of having a wide customer base who prefer her work due to the creativity and details that she adds to the piñatas she offers.

Thanks to her first loan with Kiva, her sales increased, because she was able to supply new customers who were left satisfied with handiwork done with so much zeal and love day after day.  Guadalupe hopes to keep counting on the support of this institution.  It is because of this that she asked for another loan to buy new materials (white and colored paper, cording, and clay pots) for the creation of her piñatas.  Her goal is to keep innovating in her handiwork and, of course, to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy new materials (white and colored paper, cording, clay pots) to make piñatas

loans.name: David Alejandro

texts.es:
David es un joven emprendedor y activo de 18 años de edad, estudiante universitario y comerciante independiente.
Actualmente se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una perfumería que inició hace aproximadamente 1 año, en la que ofrece fragancias femeninas y masculinas, así logra generar los recursos suficientes para aportar a la economía de su hogar y para solventar los gastos de sus estudios.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de una vitrina y surtido de fragancias, así tendrá más variedad disponible para ofrecer a sus clientes y satisfacer los diversos gustos, ocasionando así un incremento en las ventas y en los ingresos que percibe por su labor.
David manifiesta que su mayor sueño es poder graduarse y ser un profesional íntegro y exitoso, además quiere obtener otro local para abrir una sucursal de su negocio y así generar una estabilidad económica favorable para disfrutar un mejor nivel de vida y bienestar en compañía de su familia.
texts.en:
David is a young entrepreneur and active 18-year-old college student and independent businessman. He is currently has his own company, a perfume store that he started about 1 year ago, where he sells male and female fragrances. With this, he makes sufficient income to contribute to his household and to cover the costs of his studies. 

The loan requested will be invested to purchase of a display case and an assortment of fragrances, so he will have a bigger variety to offer his customers to meet their varying tastes, thus increasing sales and income. David says that his biggest dream is to graduate and become an upstanding and successful professional. He also wants to get another storefront to open a branch of his business and make a good and stable income, to enjoy a better standard of living, and well-being for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy a display case and an assortment of fragrances

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is the age of 30, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has to do hard work to feed her family. She is the mother of three children. To manage her household expenses, and to help her husband, she started a small tailoring business in her home with the help of a low capital investment. She wants to buy a new Juki sewing machine so that she can enhance the beauty of her products and increase the speed of sewing clothes.

Therefore, Sajida has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so she can buy new Juki machine. She wants to generate some savings so that she can arrange the marriage of her children in future. 

Sajida thanks to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy Juki machine for sewing clothing.

loans.name: Gloria Alexandra

texts.es:
Ella es Gloria Alexnadra en este momento se encuentra cursando 3 semestre de Auxiliar En Salud Oral, esta en el proceso de practicas en el cual se siente muy contenta, ya que ha aprendido bastantes cosas y con esto puede tener una mejor experiencia laboral en el campo que se encuentra estudiando. 
Ella obtuvo el convenio de kiva el semestre pasado y le sirvió bastante porque se pudo economizar un dinero que le sirvió para el pago de otros gastos que tenia en ese momento, en esta ocacion ella solicita de nuevo el convenio de kiva, ya que se ha visto demasiado escasa de dinero para  poder cancelar el valor de las cuotas en el valor normal de campo alto, es por eso que ella necesita del convenio este semestre ya que esta finalizando la carrera y seria un apoyo grande para ella.
texts.en:
This is Gloria Alexandra.  Right now she is completing her third semester in Oral Health Aide.  She is doing her internship, where she is very happy because she has learned so many things and with this she can gain more work experience in the field that she is studying.

She received a Kiva loan last semester and it served her well because she could save money to pay for other expenses that she had at that point.  Now she is asking for a new Kiva loan, because she sees herself as too short of funds to be able to pay the fees at Campo Alto’s normal price.  It is because of this that she needs a loan this semester; she is finishing her studies and it would be a great help to her.

loans.use: to pay for one semester's registration fees

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Don Miguel es zapatero, desde hace muchos años viene trabajando en esta profesión, repara y realiza zapatos ortopédicos, su mayor sueño en la vida es poder realizar zapatos comerciales para vender y mejorar sus ingresos, por el cual no descarta la oportunidad en un futuro, actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar materia prima y continuar con su labor diaria para mantener a sus necesidades y las de su esposa.
texts.en:
Don Miguel is a cobbler.  He has been working in this field for many years.  He creates and repairs orthopedic shoes.  His biggest dream in life is to be able to make commercial shoes to sell and improve his income.  Because of this, he doesn’t rule out any opportunity for the future.  

Right now he is asking ro a loan to buy supplies and continue with his daily work to provide for his needs and those of his wife.

loans.use: to buy leather, glue, tacks, and oilcloth for orthopedic shoes

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es: Dominga, actualmente se dedica a su labor de costura, por este medio de ingresos mantiene las necesidades de sus hijos, principalmente la alimentación y educación con el apoyo de su esposo quien es maestro de obras. Dominga solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción y levantar una parte del muro perimetral y poner un portón en su vivienda, esto para mejorar la infraestructura y brindar seguridad a sus hijos.
texts.en: Dominga currently makes a living as a dressmaker. Through this work she earns enough to pay for necessities - mainly food and schooling - for her children with the help of her builder husband. Dominga is applying for this loan in order to buy building materials to build a wall around her house and to install a large door in her home. This will improve the home and offer her children more security.

loans.use: to buy iron, bricks, cement, sand and a large door.

loans.name: Valeria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Virgen De Monserrate.
En este lugar vive la señora Valeria, tiene 20 años de edad, es casada y está en su 9 mes de embarazo  por lo cual está muy emocionada. Su esposo es mecánico.
Doña Valeria es una joven  mujer que le gusta trabajar y con sus ganancias ayudarle a su marido con los gastos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes, deja a crédito  y cobra cada quince días. Tiene dos años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual está comprando todo lo necesario para su bebé.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Lleva cuatro ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque así ella se ayuda en su negocio. Sus sueños es tener a su bebé.
texts.en:
In Manabí's capital city of Portoviejo - known for many years as "The City of the Real Tamarinds" - the members of the "Virgen de Monserrate" loan group meet every fortnight.

And it is her that 20-year-old Valeria lives. She is married and nine months pregnant, and so very excited. Valeria's husband is a mechanic.

Valeria is a young woman who likes to work and, with her profits, help her husband with household costs. Valeria makes a living selling all kinds of clothes door-to-door. She also sells from her home where her customers come to see her. She sells on credit, collecting payments every fortnight. Valeria has been doing this work for two years and, with it, she has been buying everything that she needs for her baby.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, shirts and children's clothes. Valeria has been with the loan group for four loan cycles and she likes it because it helps with her business. She dreams of giving birth to her baby.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, shirts and children's clothes.

loans.name: Gladys Jacinta

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Virgen De Monserrate.
En este lugar vive la señora Gladys, tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
Doña Gladys es una muy buena madre y ama casa que se dedica a la cría de pollos y chanchos, ella compra los pollos y chanchos cuando aun están pequeños y luego los mantiene por espacio de dos a tres meses a los pollos y a los chanchos un poco más de tiempo y luego cuando están listos los entrega a comerciantes, su marido por su parte se dedica a la agricultura ellos tienen cultivos de cacao y en época invernal maíz y maní, actualmente están en trabajaos de limpieza de los cultivos razón por lo cual necesitan de urgencia el crédito. 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar alimentos tanto para pollos y chanchos así como también para pagar la mano de obra por el trabajo en la limpieza de los cultivos. Está desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta ya que con los créditos ha podido salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener buena salud ella y los suyos.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, there is a group called "Virgen of Monserrate Credit Group" that meets every two weeks.  Gladys lives in this city and is part of that group.  She is 59 years old, is married, and has four children who are older and live independently.  Her husband works in agriculture.  

Gladys is a very good mother and housewife and she works raising chickens and pigs. When the animals are ready for sale she offers them to merchants.  Her husband works in agriculture and they have cacao crops as well as winter corn and peanuts.  Currently they are working on preparing for planting and that is why they have need of credit. 

This loan will be used to buy feed for the chickens and pigs as well as for paying for laborers who will help prepare the fields for planting. Gladys has been with the communal bank and the credit group described above since its inception.  Her dream is to have good health for herself and her loved ones.

loans.use: To buy feed for chickens and pigs and to pay laborers to help prepare fields for planting.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a buy-and-sell fruits business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of fruits to sell.

Virginia has been in this business for ten years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Andrea Carolina

texts.es:
Ella es Andrea Carolina, apenas es una bachiller del 2013 de un colegio publico de Bogotá, por problemas económicos ahora vive  con unos familiares, alejada de la madre y los hermanos, queriendo ser un apoyo y no una carga para la familia decide estudiar y salir adelante obteniendo un titulo que a futuro le ayude con ingresos económicos, con el fin de ayudar a la familia.
Ademas de eso Andrea esta interesada en continuar con los estudios y no quedarse con solo el titulo de bachiller, pues ella esta consciente que hoy en día no vale de nada un bachiller y no genera mucho ingreso económico y eso no es todo, ademas de eso ella le tiene una cierta admiración a personas que con pocos recursos hoy en día son todos unos profesionales en los estudios o trabajos, es por eso que ella no quiere ser la excepción y  ahora pide la ayuda para obtener un convenio con kiva, cuyo fin sea respaldarla económicamente  para que ella pueda invertir ese dinero en otros gastos que le exige la carrera. Ella escogió esta profesión porque se le hace muy fácil socializar con personas que por cualquier razón necesiten del tipo de conocimiento y ayuda, también porque a ella le  gusta todo el tema de la belleza corporal, la belleza exterior y cree que esta profesión le ayuda a las personas a creer en si mismas y a darles una oportunidad para que la sociedad también crea en ellas.
texts.en:
This is Andrea Carolina who has just completed high school at a public school in Bogota. Due to financial reasons she is now living with some relatives apart from her mother and siblings. In an effort to support her family and not be a burden, she has decided to continue studying so she can earn a degree and have a better income in the future. 

She realizes that graduating high school is not sufficient to earn a good income and she greatly admires those, who with limited resources, have been able to become professionals in school or at work. She wants to be like them and is asking for help from Kiva to provide financial support.  She will use the money to pay for her school expenses. She has selected this profession because it is a good way to socialize with people who for whatever reason need this type of assistance, and because she likes the whole field of beauty. She believes that this profession helps people believe in themselves and allows society to believe in them as well.

loans.use: to pay for one semester's tuition.

loans.name: Marlonita

texts.en:
Marlonita is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a bamboo-weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more stocks of bamboo to weave for her bamboo-weaving business.

Marlonita has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from buy-and-sell charcoal.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of bamboo to weave.

loans.name: Rahim

texts.en:
Rahim was born in the year 1977. He and his wife have been married for 12 years and they have two children. Both of them are going to school. Rasim’s family are IDPs (internally displaced person) from Fizuli city. For over 21 years they have been living in Fuzuli region. 

Previously Rahim took a loan for his agriculture business. But in this business his income isn’t enough. Today he has started a new business. He rents an area and uses a small part of it as a café. A while ago Rahim applied to Komak company for a loan in an amount of 1,550 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) to buy products and plates for the café. He is thankful for the loan to the Kiva organization and all lenders.

loans.use: to buy products and plates for his café.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
Nora es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, ella está estudiando la carrera de Kinesiología y fisioterapia, y por medio de esta profesión podrá ayuda a las personas que necesiten atención.
Comenta que se está esforzando bastante por poder ser una buena estudiante, y el día de mañana ser una excelente profesional.
Pide este préstamo para pagar otras sus cuotas sin atraso de su universidad,  para poder tener la tranquilidad de estudiar para poder recibirse sin problema,  por lo cual está muy agradecida por
texts.en:
Nora is from the city of Carapeguá and is studying kinesiology and physiotherapy. Through this profession she will be able to help those who need it.

Nora tells is that she is putting in quite a lot of effort in order to be a good student and, in the future, a great professional.

Nora is applying for this loan in order to pay university tuition fees on time so as to study without worries. She is very grateful for this loan

loans.use: to pay more university fees.

loans.name: Blasia

texts.es:
Blasia está estudiando Licenciatura en administración Agropecuaria  comenta que tiene el apoyo de sus padres y hermanos que para iniciar su carrera corrieron con las cuentas.
Blasia desde que ingresó a la facultad se destaca por sus buenas calificaciones y por ser una excelente alumna, muy aplicada.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder pagar su tesis, ya que tiene muchos gastos y quiere poder cubrirlos.
texts.en:
Blasia is studying for a Bachelor's in Agricultural Administration. She says the has the support of her parents and siblings, who paid the bills for her to start her career.

Since joining the faculty, Blanca has been noted for her good grades and for being an excellent student, very applied.

She is asking for this loan to be able to pay for her thesis, as she has many expenses and would like to be able to cover them.

loans.use: to pay thesis expenses.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 32-year-old, married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as being focused. 

Lilian operates a retail business where she sells duvets and bed sheets. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a vibrant place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. 

Lilian will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of duvets. Her business goal is to own a boutique within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will build a house. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). Her previous loan was successfully repaid. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of duvets.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 28-year-old, married man from Jenin City. He lives with his wife and one small daughter. He works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a very low income. Naseem would like to improve the family's living conditions, so he would like to take a BA degree and find a better job in the future. 

Naseem took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to pay the university installments of his first semester. By taking this loan, Naseem will be able to start his study in the university. 

Naseem appears in the photo.

loans.use: to pay the university installments of his first semester.

loans.name: Huruma Group

texts.en:
Grace, who is in her early twenties, is married and has one daughter who is still young. For three years now, Grace has been engaged in poultry, where she purchases local chickens from villages. She also raises ducks for sale. She conducts her business activities from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This is Grace's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan, which she paid back successfully, to restock her business with more chickens from the village. Grace managed to earn extra income, which she used to buy DVD music player, plow back into her business, and cover part of her home food expenses. Grace is happier with your loan support. She will use this loan to buy local chickens from the village to resell in town. In the coming years, Grace would like to sell more local chickens than she currently does.

Grace will share this loan with her loan group "Huruma," which has two members but three people in the photo. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy local chickens from the village to resell in town.

loans.name: Federico

texts.es:
Federico desea que luego de todo su sacrificio en la universidad pueda llegar a ser alguien en la vida y poder serle útil a sus padres, y tratar de recompensarles la ayuda que siempre le dieron.
Comenta que está estudiando la carrera de Veterinaria, y que su mayor sacrificio ha sido tener que dejar a su familia para poder estudiar y cumplir su meta. Su aspiración es montar su propia veterinaria.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de sus útiles de la universidad, y libros. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
After university Federico wants his sacrifice to help him to become somebody in life. He wants to be useful for his parents and to try to pay back all the help that they give him.

Federico tells us that he is studying to become a vet. His biggest sacrifice has been leaving his family in order to be able to study and achieve his goal. He goal is to have his own vet's surgery.

Federico is applying for this loan in order to buy materials and books for university. He is grateful for this opportunity that he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy university materials and books.

loans.name: Edwize

texts.en:
Edwize is a 36-year-old married female with four children; three of them go to school. 

She has a retail business, plus selling coffee for additional income. 

Edwize started this business to have a source of income, and needs money to buy soap, sugar, salt, soda and water to sell. 

She hopes to expand her business, however, lack of enough capital is a challenge she faces. 

Edwize is a hardworking woman, and appreciates the services being offered.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar, salt, soda and water to sell.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush is 55 years old and she lives in the village Tsavi in Syunik region. She lives alone: her husband took part in  Nagorno Karabakh war conflict and was seriously wounded and died . Since then Anush has brought up and taken care of their four daughters alone and with great hardship.  

Anush always managed to be employed and at the same time to be engaged in farming and agriculture. She has a specialty of accounting and for 35 years she worked at different companies and schools as an accountant. Now also, she works in her specialty simultaneously in two schools in her region. However, farming is in first place for her.

In her farm she has five sheep, 10 chickens and 10 bee hives. On her plot of land she cultivates potatoes, beans and cucumbers, and she also has fruit trees: apple, pear and plum. She sells all her farm produce once in a week at the Kapan and Kadjaran wholesale markets. 

Anush wants to get ready for spring agricultural activities and she is asking for a loan in order to buy seedlings, mulches, and also several hives and diesel fuel for land cultivation.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, layers, and also several hives and diesel fuel for land cultivation

loans.name: Zaruhi

texts.en:
Zaruhi lives in Yerevan city. She has two higher education degrees and two specialties - as an accountant and a pedagogue-historian-lawyer. Now she works in a school as a teacher of the history of Armenia. She is 45 years old and during these years she had to pass and still passes through many hardships alone and with great efforts. 

Neither Kiva lenders nor anyone else who may read this woman’s profile description can remain indifferent to her suffering and difficult life story. She lost her first child when he was just new-born baby as the result of doctors’ incompetent and incorrect actions. Her second son was born with an innate disease of renal failure. Now he is 11 years old and he is in a very weak and bad condition. He does not walk and can do nothing without his mother’s help. The care of this boy demands great costs and as Zaruhi says, there is nobody left whom she can ask for financial support. We are talking about a large amount of money. 

Her son needs an urgent kidney transplant since day-by-day he becomes weaker and looses hope. 

In Armenia such operations are done on a very low level, since the medical equipment is far from being effective and modern. For people having such a disease, dialysis somehow lightens the problem, but in our country even this is in a very low level and now Zarui and her son are in a very desperate state. 

Zaruhi does the impossible to keep alive her son with the help of very expensive medicines and injections and she is taking this loan amount for the purchase of just some part of these medicines.
 
Zaruhi dreams of a day that miraculously her son will manage to go to France and get registered for surgery and become a cheerful, active and healthy boy.

Zaruhi greatly thanks Kiva and the kind and generous lenders, and Nor Horizon and says God bless all of the children of the world, and let them all be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase some of the medicines that her son needs which will help him to struggle for his health and live.

loans.name: Kyamazima Tweyimukye Group

texts.en: Tom is a 50-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is an agriculturalist who has a tea plantation supplemented by dairy farming, a business he started in 1985 to support his family's well being. Unpredictable weather changes affect his  businesses since both require rains for better yields. He is a member of Kyamazima Tweyimukye group where members guarantee each other to get loan as they don't offer security. Tom dreams of having a permanent house for his family. He intends to use the loan to expand the tea plantation.

loans.use: to expand his tea plantation.

loans.name: Hermine

texts.en:
Hermine lives in Sevan city, Gharkunik region. This nice lady graduated from Yerevan State Pedagogical Institute Historical faculty. Hermine has 18 years of pedagogical experience and till now she works at the school as a teacher of Armenian History. Hermine is married and she has a son who is in military service in the army, and a daughter who is a student, studying at Yerevan State University, Economics, in  the faculty of Accountancy and Audit. (She studies in the paid division.) Hermine’s husband is employed; he works in a  private company.

Hermine says that they work very hard to earn more money for their family’s countless needs, but they still cannot pay for their daughter’s education.

She is asking for this loan to pay her daughter’s tuition fee for second semester.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s tuition fee for second semester

loans.name: Zalika

texts.en:
Zalika is a married with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. She has operated a beauty salon for the past three years, operating at the market where passersby and town dwellers go. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to add stock to her beauty salon, buy chemicals, and buy a blow dryer for her business. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to add stock to her beauty salon , buy chemicals and a blow dryer for her business

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos, vive con su familia, es casado, tiene dos hijos de 12 y 13 años de edad, no tiene ayuda económica del extranjero, es el pilar fundamental de su hogar el encargado de cubrir las necesidades de su familia, se dedica a la crianza y destazo de cerdos. Trabaja de lunes a sábado, en horarios de 8:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m., dicho oficio lo heredo de sus padres.
El crédito que solicita lo utilizara para comprar tres cerdos y concentrado para alimentarlos, fortalecerá el negocio y ofrecerá sus productos frescos y de calidad, espera incrementar ventas y ganancias.
Su anhelo es saldar su deuda lo más pronto posible y apoyar a sus hijos para que estudien medicina.
texts.en:
Santos, who lives with his family, is married and has two children who are 12 and 13 years old. 

He does not have outside economic help and is the fundamental pillar of his home. He is responsible for covering his family's needs, and earns his living raising and butchering pigs. He works Monday through Saturday from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m., an office he inherited from his parents.

He will use the loan he's asking for to buy three pigs and concentrate to feed them, which will strengthen his business. He will offer fresh, quality products and hopes to increase his sales and income.

His desire is to pay off his debt as soon as possible and support his children to study medicine.

loans.use: to buy three pigs and concentrate.

loans.name: Erkinchon

texts.ru:
Эркинчон добродушный и жизнерадостный мужчина в возрасте 30 лет. Он женат и имеет пока одного ребёнка. Живёт он со своей семьёй в сельском посёлке. Эркинчон живёт со своей женой в небольшом доме. Чтобы прокормить свою семью он также занимается своим бизнесом. 

Эркинчон занимается дехканством и животноводством. У него имеется земельная площадь. Из общей площади земли, некоторая часть земли составляет богарные земли, а остальная площадь это поливные земли. На этой земле Эркинчон занимается выращиванием некоторой сельхокультуры. А его жена помогает ему ухаживать и растить скот. Так как земельная площадь у них большая, они также пасут на ней своих скот. Бизнес животноводства приносит хороший доход, поэтому Эркинчон хочет расширить этот бизнес, увеличив поголовье своего скота. Для этого он обратился в Арванд, чтобы получить кредит на покупку скота. Эркинчон надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en: Erkinchon is a good-natured and cheerful 30-year old man. He is married and has one child so far. He lives with his family in a rural village. Erkinchon lives with his wife in a small house. In order to feed his family, he also operates his own business. Erkinchon farms and raises livestock. He has a plot of land. Some of it is watered by rain, and the rest is irrigated. On this land, Erkinchon grows crops. His wife helps him take care of and raise cattle. Since they have a large plot of land, they also use it for cattle grazing. The livestock business brings him a good income, so Erkinchon wants to expand the business by increasing the amount of cattle in his herd. For this, he has turned to Avrand to request a loan for the purchase of cattle. Erkinchon hopes for a positive result, and thanks Avrand in advance for the support.

loans.use: purchase of livestock

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married  woman; she lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her three kids.

She operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other charcoal operators in her area.
 
With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase 6 sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 6 sacks  of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad lives north of Bogor, about two hours from Jakarta. Ahmad manages a small shop selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credit.  Ahmad is single and lives with four persons in the family home. 

Ahmad joined Ruma one month ago because he found it interesting to sell mobile phone airtime credits.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Ahmad sees improvements in his shop.  For the last month, he earned an average of $10- 11 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  He hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends.  His goal for his business is to expand and have more new business in the future.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Romli

texts.en:
Romli runs a small stall selling snacks and mobile phone airtime credits. Romli lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta.  Romli is married and living with four people in the family home. 

Romli began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Allon

texts.en:
Allon is a new client to the institution. The 26-year-old man is married, and blessed with one child. He hails from Nyamuniga village, Buhunga sub-county, Rukungiri district. 

He operates a retail shop located in a nearby trading centre as his main source of income. He also does subsistence agriculture as his second source of income.

Allon is securing a loan of UGX. 2.500.000 to buy retail sin the long run increase his sales and profit.

His dream is to buy a plot so that he can operate from his plot, and also rent to other traders so that his profits can increase.

He appreciates Kiva and UGAFODE for the financial aid granted to him.

loans.use: To buy retail stock

loans.name: Benon

texts.en: Benon is a hardworking 50-year-old man who is happily married with 5 children. He grew up in a very humble family which had few assets and without school fees to educate him. He opted to work in the nearby ranch as a gardener to earn a living. Due to his hard work he managed to save some money and bought a piece of land in Kakiika mbarara Municipality, where he put up a banana plantation. This enabled him to make a living so that he even managed to start constructing a house, which up to now he has failed to complete. He is requesting for a loan of UGX 1,000,000 to finish his house(In set is Benon in a coat with the Ugafode credit officer).

loans.use: To finish house construction

loans.name: Sikajje

texts.en:
Sikajje cannot thank the Kiva lenders enough for the good work they are doing, and for the support they have continuously given her business. 

She has been able to expand her business, increase her profits, and educate her children. 

She needs more money to buy stock for the supermarket for daily household use items, and also to buy more cloth for making uniforms. 

She is confident this will increase her profit and sales. She is hard working and resilient.

loans.use: to buy materials for making school uniforms and also stock for the supermarket.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 46-year-old male from Ikuma, Kagadi, with five children ages 19, 17, 15, 11, 8, four of whom attend school. He is a business man who has a retail shop but he is also a farmer who grows crops like maize and beans on subsistence scale.

He has applied for a loan of UGX.300,000 to pay tuition for one of his children who is in school at a tertiary institution and he hopes to pay back using money from the retail and farming business. He has dreams of constructing a good house to shelter his family and improving his business so that he can be able to educate all his children up to university. He describes himself as honest and hardworking.

loans.use: To pay tuition for one of his children

loans.name: Diyan

texts.en:
Diyan runs a small stall that sells snacks and mobile phone airtime credits. Diyan lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Diyan is married and living with three people in the family home. As seen in the picture Diyan with her child.

Diyan began working with Ruma one month ago because she want to increase her income. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business runs, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payment transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Ferit

texts.en: Ferit needs this loan to pay for medical expenses and the rest of it to invest in agriculture.Lately, he's been experiencing heart problems and the doctor has told him to do a series of checkups at a German clinic in the capital city. Thus, he needed money for all those clinical expenses.

loans.use: to pay for a medical visit and invest in agriculture.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is married and has five children. He is a small scale agriculturalist, though he has a retail shop to supplement his income. He is usually faced with challenges of inadequate capital. Usually there are cows available for buying but because he cannot afford them, he usually misses the deal. He thinks with financial support from UGAFODE, he will be able to boost his business by buying cattle that he will keep and later sell.n This will in turn boost his financial status and standards of living.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Hanou

texts.fr:
Hanou a 42 ans. Elle vit avec son mari dans le quartier Bè.
Depuis 2009, elle a commencé la vente des condiments, céréales et des produits cosmétiques. 
Hanou suit avec attention les formations de l’équipe Assilassimé. 

Actuellement la vente ambulante des produits cosmétiques lui génère beaucoup de revenus et pour éviter les ruptures de stock, elle sollicite un microcrédit pour renouveler de parfums et de lait de beauté et aussi 4 bidons d’huile végétale.
Les bénéfices lui permettront d’augmenter ses revenus et son chiffre d’affaire.
