texts.en: Hanou is 42 years old. She lives with her husband in the Bè neighborhood. In 2009, she began selling vegetables for making sauces, grains, and cosmetic products. Hanou has followed the creation of the Assilassimé team with attention. Currently, she makes a lot of revenue through the traveling sales of cosmetic products, and to avoid stock shortages, she is asking for a microloan to renew her supply of perfumes, beauty cream and also 4 containers of vegetable oil. The profits will permit her to increase her revenues and her turnover.

loans.use: to purchase five perfumes and beauty cream and four containers of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is married with one child and her only child goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for 15 years. She has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income from a restaurant.  

Margaret works from home and sells on a retail basis seven days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land and build a house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a single mother with four children; all attend school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and running water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

She has a business selling roasted green bananas and maize. She has been in this business for 4 years. She works at the market seven days every week and sells on a retail basis. 

She has applied for 1,200,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy bulk quantities of green bananas and maize. Her major business challenges include seasonal changes and theft. 

She aspires to own a plot of land to grown bananas and to become a wholesaler. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of the low interest charged.

loans.use: To buy green bananas and maize.

loans.name: Royal Group

texts.en:
Rukia is a mother of two children who are in school. She is married and is in her early thirties.  For a period of five years now, Rukia has been managing a business selling food.  Her cafe sells chips with fried chicken and other meat fried in pieces. Rukia works from 6am to 6pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

Rukia is requesting her eighth loan from Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans (all of which were paid back successfully) to buy cooking ingredients (cooking oil, baking flour, sugar, rice, Irish potatoes, chicken and meats). She bought a nice aluminum cupboard, a place where she keeps chips after being fried, and a fridge to keep soft drinks. Rukia is doing great and is thankful to everyone who has supported her group. Rukia received increased income, which she used to buy a plot of land and build a house. She covered part of school fees and household expenses. With the loan, Rukia will open a barbershop business. In this new business,Rukia will employ somebody in full time but she will be supervising. She dreams of owning a car and improving her family life. 

Rukia will share this loan with her loan group" ROYAL GROUP" which totals four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open a barbershop business.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is forty-eight years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Rosemarie borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and earns an additional income from raising pigs.

Rosemarie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married woman with one child who is still underage. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans for her business. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of wheat flour, maize flour, and beans for her business

loans.name: Kambua

texts.en:
Kambua is married and has children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past two years, she has owned a food stall business, where she sells to her neighbours and town dwellers. 

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase more stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking oil

loans.name: Marta Mercedes

texts.es:
Marta, es casada, tiene tres hijos de 11, 10 y 6 años, hace tres años nace el negocio de venta de ropa, por iniciativa propia, poco a poco lo ha ido surtiendo, hoy en día cuenta con muchos clientes, su horario es de 8:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m., lo atiende sola.
El financiamiento lo utilizara para comprar camisas, pantalones, blusas, calcetas, chores, faldas, vestidos, etc., para prepararse con mercadería necesaria que cumpla con los gustos de los clientes en esta temporada de vacaciones que se acerca. Espera tener buenas ganancias con las que pagara las cuotas de la deuda adquirida.
Su seño es ampliar el negocio, tener una  economía más estable y que sus hijos tengan acceso a una buena educación superior.
texts.en:
Marta is married and has three children who are 11, 10 and 6 years old. Three years ago she started a business selling clothes, on her own, which has gradually has been increasing. Today she has many customers. Her work schedule is 8:00 am to 4:00 pm, and she works alone. 

She will use the loan to buy shirts, pants, blouses, socks, shorts, skirts, dresses, etc., to stock the necessary merchandise to meet the tastes of the customers in this coming vacation season. She expects to make good earnings with which she will pay back her loan. Her dream is to grow the business, to have a more stable income, and to give her children access to a good quality higher education.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, blouses, socks, shorts, skirts, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is single and has no child. She rents a house that has neither piped water or electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For over three years she has operated a tailoring business, making garments for both men and women. She cites seasonality as her major challenge. 
With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase cloth material and sewing threads for her business. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth material and sewing threads for her business.

loans.name: Emine

texts.en:
Emine is twenty-eight years old and recently married. She is very hardworking. She enjoys working often and operates a handicraft business.

Unfortunately, her business has not recently been making as much profit as it did before, so now Emine is planning to earn extra income by keeping cows to sell milk and milk products. In her village, there is a milk collection point that sells at different markets. Because Emine is very ambitious, she is ready to work harder and use the loan to purchase a cow. She hopes that the loan will improve her living conditions and generate more income so that she can expand her farm in the future and begin a family. She is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Hyrisha

texts.en: Hyrisha is a single twenty-three-year-old woman. She and her family are involved in an agricultural business and despite their lack of income, they are very happy and grateful for what they have. According to their family tradition, they work on their land to plant vegetables and then sell their produce in the market. Now Hyrisha is asking for a loan to pay the rent on the land so that she can continue to plant peppers and other vegetables to sell. The loan will help Hyrisha's family to generate income. In the future, her goal is to build a greenhouse so that she can grow even more vegetables and keep the plants alive longer. She wants to thank all of the lenders for this opportunity and promises to pay on time.

loans.use: To pay the rent on the land so that she can continue to plant peppers and other vegetables to sell

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung, who is forty-eight years old, is married with one daughter. Her husband supports the family through the income he earns from driving for hire. She runs a food stall to sell sweet bean soup. She started this business two years ago. They live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Dung intends to take a loan to repair her house and buy good quality beans to make better food for selling. The additional capital will enable her to increase her income from this business. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her house and buy better quality beans to make sweet soup for selling.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es:
Martha, no cuenta con la mercadería suficiente para surtir las demandas de sus clientes, por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo que utilizara para comprar chancletas y sandalias, para niñas, niños y adultos.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a incrementar el inventario, se mantiene trabajando, sus clientes aumentaron, su rentabilidad ha aumentado, continua apoyando en los gastos familiares.
texts.en: Martha doesn't have enough merchandise to keep up with customer demand, and so is requesting a new loan that she will use to purchase flip flops and sandals for boys, girls, and adults. The previous loan helped her increase inventory and she's gotten more customers, profitability has gone up, and she's still working and helping out with family expenses.

loans.use: To purchase flip flops and sandals for boys, girls, and adults

loans.name: Firmansyah

texts.en:
Firmansyah runs a small stall selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Firmansyah lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta.  Firmansyah is married and living with four people in the family home. 

Firmansyah began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Faten Group

texts.en:
This group is called Faten and is comprised of four women. They live in Hodeidah, Yemen. This community is hard-working and they work as much as they can in order to improve their living conditions. They took out a group loan of YER 80,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB).

Fatima is the leader of the group. She is 36 years old. She lives with her children in Hodeidah, Yemen. Her oldest child is 18 years old and the youngest child is 6 years old. She is a hard-working woman who dreams of providing her children with a better future.  

One year ago, Fatima started in her business as a door-to-door saleswoman, selling clothes and perfumes. In the beginning, she decided to help her husband in covering the expenses of their family and she earned good profits, then she decided to continue. 

Recently, Fatima wanted to strengthen her business, but she didn't have enough money. For this reason, she applied for a loan of YER 20,000 from AMB in order to purchase more women's clothes and perfumes. 

Fatima looks forward to providing her family with a lot of money. Her dream is selling the perfumes and women clothes in all the governorates (Yemen is divided into 20 governorates and one municipality).

loans.use: to purchase more women's clothes and perfumes.

loans.name: José Isabel

texts.es:
José de 45 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora que  estudio hasta cuarto grado,  debido a que su familia tuvo que emigrar no continuo estudiando, él no tiene hijos es soltero,  vive  en la casa de su tío donde se encuentra posando. 

José es albañil, comenta que tiene gran experiencia en el área de la albañilería, él dice que tiene aproximadamente 10 años de trabajar en la actividad, construye casas, pisos, muros  etc. Comenta que es un trabajo que le genera buenos ingresos económicos; es por esta razón que decidió dedicarse a esta actividad y que hoy en día tiene mucha clientela para trabajos. Él sale fuera de su casa a realizar los trabajos siempre es necesario movilizarse a otros lugares para trabajar, él aprendió el trabajo cuando trabajaba de ayudante con su tío junto a él aprendió el trabajo de albañil. José también se dedica a la agricultura en la siembra de granos básicos maíz y  fríjol. 

El préstamo lo utilizara para invertirlo en su vivienda que está construyendo,  y que le falta poco para terminar, específicamente comprara 15 pliegos de lámina y 500 tejas de barro para el techo y paredes pues era un proyecto de vida que tenia de construir su propia casa y que con la ayuda de Dios lo está logrando y también con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo.

Para el futuro José pretende mejorar su vivienda,  construirla de bloque y cementó, también casarse tener sus propios hijos con su esposa  y tener un mejor empleo que le facilite su vida y que le genere mejores ingresos económicos para su futura familia.
texts.en: Jose is 45 years old, and is a very hard-working person who attended school up to the fourth grade when he was unable to continue because his family had to emigrate. He's single and has no children, and is currently staying in his uncle's house. Jose is a mason and says he has vast experience in the field of masonry, stating that he's been doing this work for ten years and builds houses, floors, walls, etc. He says that it's a job that generates a good income, and that's why he decided to take up this line of work and he currently has lots of clients. He leaves home to do the jobs as it's always necessary to travel to other locations to work. Jose learned how to be a mason as his uncle's apprentice and also works in agriculture planting staple foods like corn and beans. He'll use the loan to invest in the house he's building, and it's almost finished. Specifically, he will buy 15 sheets of metal and 500 clay tiles for the roof and walls since building his own home has been a life goal and God willing he's accomplishing it with hard work and effort. In the future Jose plans to improve his house, using cement and cinder blocks for its construction, as well as get married and have children with his wife, and have a better job to make life easier and generate more income for his future family.

loans.use: To purchase 15 sheets of metal and 500 clay tiles for a roof, because building his own house has been one of his life goals.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos es una mujer de 60 años de edad, no sabe leer ni escribir por lo difícil de la vida y la situación económica en aquel tiempo que pasaba su familia cuando ella era pequeña no logro que sus padres la pusieran estudiar para  aprender a leer y a escribir.  Comenta Santos que se le ha complicado la vida un poco, solo por no saber leer ni escribir, ella es madre soltera de 10 hijos de los cuales todos 6 están acompañados los demás están junto a ella en su casa todavía y se dedican a los trabajos de la agricultura en la siembra de granos básicos,  en  su vivienda Santos  solo vive ella y sus cuatro hijos.


Santos se dedica a los oficios domésticos en su casa, comenta que desde la infancia se dedica a esta actividad, su mamá le enseño a aprender las actividades que se realizan en el hogar y que es tan productiva para ella, gracias a ello ha crecido a su 10 hijos, y que tiene gran experiencia en el área y siempre sigue al cuido de su nietos.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para consolidar unas deudas que tiene pendiente y que ella ya quiere salirse de esas deudas y quedarse con una sola, y la otra parte para comprar 200 tejas de barro para el techo de su casa que está un poco deteriorado y más aún que ya se acerca la temporada de lluvia a Santos le urge reparar su techo para cuando venga el invierno ya tenga arreglado el techo de su casa.

Santos desea en el futuro tener mucho bienestar para ella y su familia poder mejorar su  vivienda y tener una mejor calidad de vida junto  sus hijos y nietos que sean personas de bien en la sociedad que sigan estudiando y mucho y tengan su propio trabajo, todo esto dice que lo lograra con la ayuda de Dios y gracias al crédito solicitado y futuros  créditos que solicitara para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santos is a sixty-year-old woman. She never learned how to read or write because life was hard for her family when she was little. Due to their financial situation her parents weren't able to send her to school to learn how to read and write. Santos says illiteracy has made her life a bit more complicated. She is a single mother of ten children. Six of them live with their partners and the rest still live at home with her and work as farmers growing basic grains. Only these four children and herself live in Santos' house.

Santos works as a homemaker. She says she has been doing this ever since she was a child. Her mother taught her how to take care of her household and do all the chores, which for her is very productive. She was able to raise her ten children because she has a lot of experience and she still now takes care of her grandchildren.

She will use the loan she is requesting from CREDICAMPO to consolidate some pending debts she has. She wants to be rid of them and be left with only one debt. The rest of the loan is to buy 200 clay tile shingles for the roof of her house, which is somewhat in disrepair, particularly since the rainy season is approaching. Santos needs to repair her roof for the winter so that it is ready in time.

Santos wants lots of wellbeing for herself and her family. She wants to improve her home so that she can have a better quality of life alongside her children and grandchildren. She wants them to be upstanding citizens, stay in school, and study hard so they can have a job. She says she will achieve this with God's help and thanks to the loan she is requesting, as well as future loans she will request in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to consolidate some debts and also to buy 200 clay tile shingles for the roof of her house.

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
Peris is a farmer living in the Kisii area of South Nyanza, Kenya, with her husband and four children, who are all of school-going age. She has been doing farming for the past 18 years. Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs and a variety of crops. In farming, she enjoys crop farming because she gets a good income out of it, while her biggest challenge is climate changes.

Peris chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because the repayments are very convenient to pay, and the interest rates on their loans are low. During the training session, she learnt how she can improve her livelihood through farming.

Through this loan, she will get more milk, which will lead to more income. This will enable her to cater to her children's school fees and also her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Alexanders Jose

texts.es: el señor Alexanders, siempre cumplido con sus familia, trabaja desde hace muchos años el labora para una empresa privada ademas se dedica al cultivo de citricos como Limones, Naranjas, Mandarinas, actualmente el solicita el credito para la compra de Abonos y Fertilizantes, ya que la cosecha acaba de pasar y los arboles requieren de un optimo mantenimiento, Agredece el apoyo y confianza que Kiva en conjunto a Afodenic le han brindado.
texts.en: Alexanders has always been dedicated to his family. He has been working for many years. He is working for a private company and also grows citrus like lemons, oranges, and mandarins.  He is currently requesting this loan to buy fertilizers, because his fruit has just been harvested and the trees need to be maintained properly. He appreciates the support and trust that Kiva, in partnership with Afodenic, have given him.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El señor José  tiene 40 años tiene dos hijos  de las edades de 17 y 14 años, el tiene su taller de chapería y pintura de vehículos que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Villa Dolores, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  el señor José  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción para la refacción  de su vivienda ya que quiere brindar comodidad a su familia, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de efectivo para el terminado de la construcción de su casa para lo cual le falto par algunos detalles,  el señor José  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son continuar ampliando su actividad teniendo más clientes en el taller y  va a utilizar los beneficios en ampliar su negocio, el señor José es una persona muy trabajadora se siente muy agradecido por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: José is forty years old and has two children, ages seventeen and fourteen. He runs a body and paint auto repair shop, located in the Villa Dolores area. This loan is his first cycle within our institution. José is going to use this loan to buy construction materials to renovate his home because he wants to give his family more comfort. The reason why he is requesting the loan is because he lacks enough cash to finish building his home. He didn't have enough for some of the final details. The challanges José faces in his auto shop are to continue expanding services and increasing his customer base. He is going to use his profit to expand his business. José is a very hard worker and is very grateful for the opportunity he is being offered.

loans.use: to finish building his home

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo is 51 years old and he lives in Bayabo. His wife and three children are doing well.

Bernardo is still in the farming business and he was able to buy some calves with the previous loan. Bernardo managed to expand his farming activities with his previous loan and, right now, his monthly income is PHP 10,000 to PHP 15,000. 

He has applied for his loan of PHP 40,000 to buy fertilizer and pesticides to use on his business. 

In the future, Bernardo hopes to be an established farmer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides to use on his business.

loans.name: Alicia Esperanza

texts.es:
Alicia, está acompañada, vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos, en vista de de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, desde hace 5 años se dedica a vender frutas y verduras, sus labores son de 7:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m., hasta la fecha no representa ningún riesgo.
Invertirá en la compra de yuca, papas, pepinos, mangos, sandias, jocotes, entre otros productos que le ayuden a surtir el negocio y tener a la disposición de sus clientes lo que necesitan. Espera mejorar su estabilidad económica para cancelar la deuda adquirida y apoyar con los gastos de su hogar.
Su sueño es tener el negocio en su casa y así continuar trabajando en busca del bienestar familiar

loans.use: compra de yuca, papas, pepinos, mangos, sandias, jocotes, entre otros

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Graciela vive en departamento de Huanuco, distrito de Jose Crespo y Castillo, es madre de 2 hijos a quienes quiere mucho y por los cuales trabaja muy duro para poder salir adelante. Desde hace 5 años tiene su negocio de venta de abarrotes y útiles escolares, negocio que le ha permitido poder tener ingresos para solventar los gastos de su hogar, Graciela cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con sus clientes.

Graciela esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su gran ayuda ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio de venta de útiles escolares, como cuadernos, lapiceros, hojas bond, entre otros; ya que es temporada de colegios y de esta manera poder atender a sus clientes y poder mejorar sus ventas y con ello mejorar sus ingresos; así ella podrá seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una gran empresa distribuidora de útiles escolares”.
texts.en:
Graciela lives in a neighborhood in Huanuco, in the district of Jose Crespo y Castillo. She is a mother of two children whom she loves very much. She works very hard in order to provide for them. She has been in business for five years, selling groceries and school supplies. Her store has allowed her to earn an income to cover her household expenses. Graciela believes the reason why her business is going well is because she is very kind to her customers.

Graciela is grateful to Kiva lenders because their great help will allow her to buy merchandise for her business. She will buy school supplies like notebooks, pencils, paper, and other items. This will allow her to serve her customers better during the schoolyear and increase her sales, which in turn will increase her income. This way she will be able to keep working towards making her greatest dream become a reality, which is to have a large company distributing school supplies.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a widowed woman with four children who are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past four years, Alice has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, Alice wants to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase salt, bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar, beans, and sweets for resale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 58 and widowed. She has two adult-age children. Despite the hardships in life, she aims to improve their status of living and become financially stable in the future. She has been engaged in buying and reselling grocery items, soft drinks, and school supplies in the market for more than seven years. She aims to improve more of her business in order to increase her income. Due to insufficient capital, she wants to avail a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy more stocks of the said products to resell. Being a kind and diligent mother, she believes that she will be able to make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of grocery items, soft drinks, and school supplies to resell.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a 27-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 3 to 9 years. He describes himself to be passionate. He operates a transportation business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a good area. He describes his biggest business challenges to be high fuel prices and the difficulty of operating during the rainy season. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. He hopes that in the future, he will benefit from the business. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to acquire another motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Mwanawani

texts.en:
Mwanawani operates a clothes selling business, selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.
With the loan, she is requesting Kes 15,000 to purchase one bale of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 26-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself as honest and determined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his bicycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are of all different types. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more bicycles for hire services. This will enable him to earn more income. His business goal is to expand within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP-DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more bicycles for hire services.

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Grupo De Crédito Virgen De Monserrate.
En este lugar vive la señora María tiene 32 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y  fruto de la misma tienen un hijo de 7 años que estudia en escuela, su marido es panadero.
Doña María es una mujer que le gusta trabajar para sentirse independiente y con sus ganancias poder obtener sus cosas y darle lo mejor a su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y sandalias por catálogos, trabaja todos los días más que todo en las horas de la mañana ya que a esas horas le resulta más fácil realizar sus recorridos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y por pedidos, deja a crédito y cobra semanalmente, ella también le da parte del crédito para que su marido lo utilice en su panadería lugar en el cual también trabaja con su marido elaborando el pan. Ella lleva 5 años con su negocio el cual lo comenzó con el primer crédito que recibió del grupo. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, sandalias y víveres para elaborar el pan. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 5 años y le gusta porque así empezó su negocio. Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
Every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the Royal Tamarind trees, the members of the Virgen de Monserrate credit group meet.

This is where Señora María lives.  She is 32 years old and has a common-law relationship.  From that relationship she has a 7-year-old child who is a student in school.  Her partner is a baker.  

Doña María is a woman who likes to work in order to feel independent.  With her earnings she can get her things and give her child the best.  She works selling clothing and sandals by catalog.  She works every day, more often than not in the mornings because at that time of day it is easier to make her rounds.  Her approach is door-to-door and special orders.  She offers credit and makes collections weekly.   She has had her business for five years; she began it with the first loan that she took out with the group.  She is also giving part of her loan so that her partner can use it in his bakery, where she also works making bread. 

She is going to use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, tops, t-shirts, sandals, and ingredients for making the bread.  She has been in her credit group for five years, and she likes it because it is how she started her business.  Her dream is to give the best to her child.

loans.use: to buy pants, tops, t-shirts, sandals, and groceries.

loans.name: Duc

texts.en:
Duc is 42 years old and married. He lives with his family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife earns income as a worker at a local factory. Duc runs a shop selling household items,  food stuff, and cellphone cards to earn a living.  He started his business three years ago. He is requesting a loan to gradually expand his business by buying a larger quantity of cellphone cards to sell to his customers. 

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy cellphone cards for resale at his general store.

loans.name: Chan's Group

texts.en:
Chan lives in a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is 30 years old and married with five children. To make a living, she has been farming rice and growing pineapple. To supplement her income, she works for others for a fee. The current businesses earn her about 70,000 KHR per day to meet the family's needs.
 
Chan has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loans, which have helped her better support her family. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Nguyen

texts.en:
Nguyen, 37, is single and lives in Ho Chi Minh city. Nguyen has been running a general store to selling food, oil, sugar, beverages, and some household items in front of her house for seven years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity of food and household items to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and household items to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan, 46, is married and has a son. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a mechanic worker. She earns an income running a food stall in front of her house. 

She started this business 11 years ago. She is requesting a loan to repair her house to make a better place for her food stall.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Badri

texts.en:
Badri runs a small stall where he sells groceries and mobile phone airtime credits. He lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Badri is married and lives with four people in the family house.

Badri began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime transactions in a weekly basis.

loans.name: Jyotsna

texts.en:
Jyotsna is a 26-year-old married woman and her husband is 30 years old. Her husband is illiterate but can sign his name while she has read up to grade 8. Jyotsna is the mother of two children. She lives in a small village of Maynaguri.
 
Her husband is a farmer. For farming, lots of money is required to cultivate crops, and land is also needed. Her husband farms in some other's field and has to give a certain amount of money to the person who owns the land. It was becoming very difficult for Jyotsna to arrange the basic necessities of life because of the need to pay for use of the land. 

Jyotsna came to know about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and took a loan of INR 15,000 so that she can purchase a cow and can sell milk and milk products to the market. She hopes that she will help her husband financially to lead a smooth family like and also to extend the farming business. She also dreams to give better education to her children. 

Jyotsna is grateful and thankful to BJS and Kiva for extending the helping hand.

loans.use: To purchase cow to sell milk and milk products.

loans.name: Aloka

texts.en:
Aloka is 34 years old and married. Her husband is 56 years old. Aloka has completed her education up to grade eight and her husband is illiterate and just knows how to sign his name. Aloka is a housewife and her husband is a farmer. Aloka is blessed with two children and both of them receive an education. She lives in the small town of Dhupguri.

Aloka has taken a loan from BJS, Kiva’s partner, for INR 8,000 so they can grow more paddies in their field. For better quality rice, better fertilizer, pesticide etc are required. So with this money, they will grow better quality paddy and sell it in the market.  She dreams of purchasing a tractor in the future with the profit from her business.

Her earnest and heartiest thanks go to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Hendri

texts.en:
Hendri runs a small stall which sells  stationery and mobile phone airtime credits. Hendri lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta.  Hendri is married and lives with three people in the family house.

Hendri began working with Ruma two months ago because he wants to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business by selling mobile phone airtime credits and serving bill payments. As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as a working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is now 32 years old. He is a married man with two children, who lives in Taiz, Yemen. His oldest child is five years old and the youngest one is three years old. Because of the hard conditions in the country, most Yemeni people expatriated outside. Mohammed expatriated to Saudi Arabia many years ago, but, due to the immigrant crisis between Yemen and Saudi Arabia, most Yemeni immigrants came back home. Mohammed was one of them, but he was able to accumulate a good amount of money there. When he came from immigration, he opened a café in Taiz city. Now he earns good profits, but most of what he earns goes to the expenses of his family.  Mohammed wants to improve the activity inside his café. Unfortunately, he doesn't have enough money for that. For this reason, Mohammed applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more of goods and products for the café.
Mohammed looks forward to providing his family with a lot of money.  He hopes to increase both his clientele and income.

loans.use: To purchase more goods and products for the café

loans.name: Sushama

texts.en:
Sushama is a 23-year-old housewife from Maynaguri who lives with her husband and two children. She is illiterate, but knows how to sign her name.

Her husband has a small business of “chongas” (a holder made of iron or steel for measuring pulses and crops). He manufactures chongas and sells them in different grocery shops in the local market. There is a great demand for the chongas in their area.  

Now they want to extend their business by manufacturing more chongas. Thus, Sushama is taking the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase more iron and steel sheets for manufacturing chongas. 

Sushama hopes for the financial upgrade of her family by expanding her husband’s business. She is thanking BJS and Kiva earnestly for this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more chongas (a holder made of iron or steel for measuring pulses).

loans.name: Al- Ashbal Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Ashbal and consists of four women who are all hardworking. They live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They have taken a loan of 140,000 YER from AMB. 

Wafa is 31 years old and married with one daughter; they live in a simple house. She has a strong determination to improve her standard of living through helping her husband to improve the living standards of their family. She had a small amount of money, and she decided to invest in a simple business. Wafat started up her business two years ago, selling women’s clothes door to door. 

Recently, she wanted to improve her business, so she has requested a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more women’s clothes and resell them.

Wafa expects a boost in her income and to be able to enroll her children in a private school. Her vision is to open a makeup, cosmetics, and accessories store in her area.

loans.use: to purchase more women's clothes to resell.

loans.name: Koushala

texts.en:
Koushala is a 31-year-old married woman. She is illiterate and can only sign her name. Her poverty, ignorance and lack of knowledge have not allowed her to receive an education. Now Koushala is a mother of two children and both of them go to school. 

She has her own animal husbandry business and her husband is a farmer. She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for purchasing a cow so that she can sell milk and dairy products in her local market. Both Koushala and her husband work together and divide their work. They work long hours so that they can give a bright future to their children and their make sure their future is not affected by poverty and ignorance. This loan will give them an opportunity to make their dream come true. Now, Koushala lives in a Kaccha house (made of straw and mud), but with this loan she will try to make a Pakka house (made of bricks and cement). Koushala and her husband are successfully running their business and have taken on the market for selling milk products and vegetables. She dreams of raising cattle in the future with her business profit so that her family’s financial status will be upgraded.

Koushala is highly obliged to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for selling dairy products in her local market.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is a 28-year-old electronics accessories dealer in Mariakani, Kenya. He is a single man who has been in this business for the last ten years and has done well.

This will be his third loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the loan to expand his business, and then use the anticipated profits to repay his loan. He hopes to start a new business and expand the current one in future.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts of mobiles

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen, 23 years old, comes from Nyahururu. He is not yet married and he supports his parents.

He has been running his business of mobile money transfer i.e M pesa for the last 2 years and to enable him to get more float, he has applied for his second loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

His monthly income right now is KES 10,000 and his intention is to use the profits anticipated from his expanded business to start another similar business and to pay his loan back to VisionFund Kenya.

In the future, he hopes to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to add to his M pesa float

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of basins and utensils.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is operating a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable operators. The previous loan helped her to buy stock for her business.
With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula appreciates her previous loan that enabled her to get profits from her fish selling business.
She is requesting a loan to purchase more stock of fish and cooking oil for her business. She appreciates Kiva and Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of fish and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman. She has seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.
Umazi operates a cereal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality.
With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of maize, beans, and rice for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize, beans, and rice for resale.

loans.name: Giau

texts.en: Giau is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of food such as duck eggs and snack food products to sell from her stall. Giau's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of food such as duck eggs and snack food products to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai is 57 years old and is widowed with three children. She has been running a business of selling fish for 20 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and raise her children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.
Hai is requesting a loan to buy a larger quantity of fish so that she may expand her business. 
She hopes that through the loan she will be able to increase the turnover of her business and have money to reinvest into her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en:
Kishwar is 49, living with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her husband owns an electrician shop in which he sells electrical goods and provides services for repairing electrical components, such as ceiling fans and washing machines, and he troubleshoots the underground electrical supply. He sells electrical components as well in his shop such as bulb, switches, and sockets. 
He wants to buy new inventories for his shop but does not have amount to buy new inventory. Therefore, Kishwar has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can become empowered to buy his desired electrical goods for reselling. 
Kishwar thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy electrical goods for reselling.

loans.name: Yuliana

texts.es:
La socia Yuliana sigue trabajando en una agencia de viajes,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bie,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de agencia de viajes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar boletos turisticos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Yuliana continues to work at a travel agency. She works at her job from 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. Yuliana has been in this business for several years and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her travel agency business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy tour tickets.

Yuliana is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy tour tickets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine to raise productivity

loans.name: Xenia Patricia

texts.es:
Xenia, administra una tienda en la que ofrece mercadería de primera necesidad, en un horario de 7:00 a.m. a 6:00 p.m., esta actividad económica surge a raíz de la necesidad de salir adelante con su hijo de 6 años, es madre soltera y no tiene ayuda del extranjero.
Está solicitando un préstamo para surtir el inventario de su tienda con lo necesario para cubrir las peticiones de sus clientes y aumentar sus ventas para mejorar sus ingresos, comprara jabón, detergente, boquitas, jugos, dulces, arroz, huevos, aceite, entre otros.
Sueña con mejorar su vivienda, dar a su hijo lo mejor y seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
Xenia manages a store where she offers basic necessity merchandise. Her work schedule is from 7:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M. This business came about because she needed to help her six-year-old son get ahead. Xenia is a single mother and does not receive assistance from abroad.

She is seeking a loan in order to restock the inventory of her store with whatever she needs to fulfill her customers’ requests, increase her sales, and improve her earnings. Xenia will be buying soap, detergent, snack foods, juices, candy, rice, eggs, oil, and other products.

She dreams of improving her home, providing the best for her son, and continuing to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy soap, detergent, snack foods, juices, candy, rice, eggs, oil, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Aurelia Cristina

texts.es:
Aurelia vive en el distrito de Santiago, es mujer muy trabajadora, sobre todo porque es madre de 4 hijos a quienes quiere mucho y todo el sacrificio y esfuerzo que ella realiza es para poder ofrecerles una vida digna; Aurelia trabaja alrededor de 2 años como obrera de campo y de esta manera tiene ingresos para poder tener ingresos y solventar los gastos de su familia.

Aurelia esta agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda y de esta manera poder mejorar su calidad de vida y poder seguir adelante en busca de su gran sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Aurelia lives in the Santiago district. She is a very hard-working woman, above all because she is the mother of 4 children, whom she loves a lot, and all her sacrifices and efforts are to offer them a dignified life. Aurelia has worked for about two years as a farm worker, and in this way she has income in order to pay the family expenses.

Aurelia is grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to the help that they have offered her, she will be able to make improvements in her home and in this way be able to improve her quality of life and be able to continue advancing in search of her great dream: to finish building her home.

loans.use: to improve her home.

loans.name: Iccel Amanda

texts.es: Iccel, se dedica a la actividad comercial de pulpería en donde también vende cosméticos y un poco de ropa con el apoyo de su esposo, ambos atienden el negocio, gracias a estos ingresos mantiene los gastos de su familia y los estudios de sus hijos, espera en un futuro ir mejorando las condiciones de su hogar, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para invertir en su pulpería con productos de mayor demanda, de esta  manera podrá hacer crecer su economía, siendo este su único medio para subsistir.
texts.en:
Iccel works in the retail sector and has a general store where she also sells cosmetics and a little bit of clothing with the help of her husband. Both of them manage the business. Thanks to the income they generate, they are able to maintain their family’s expenses and pay for their children’s education. Iccel hopes in the future to improve the condition of her home.

On this occasion, she is requesting a loan so that she can invest in products that are in great demand in her store. As a result, she hopes to grow her finances since this business is the only means of supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, vegetables, dairy products, canned goods, cereals, cosmetics, clothing, and other merchandise.

loans.name: Jorge Alcides

texts.es:
Jorge es un hombre pujante y trabajador, a sus 39 años de edad se dedica a atender su propio negocio, un taller de mecánica y venta de repuestos para vehículos, aprendió el oficio mientras trabajaba como conductor de carros y camiones. Inició con la venta de repuestos de manera ambulante, los productos los llevaba en una carretilla por las diferentes calles del municipio; poco a poco fue ahorrando hasta que pudo tomar en arriendo el local donde se encuentra ubicado su negocio actualmente; de esta forma ha logrado sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos y su esposa.
El crédito solicitado es un apoyo para capitalizar su negocio, con el dinero comprará repuestos al por mayor (bujías, luces, frenos) esto le permitirá ofrecer un mejor servicio a su clientela, lo que se reflejará en el incremento de sus ventas.
Jorge sueña con acreditar bien su negocio y lograr una mayor rentabilidad, que le permita en un futuro cercano, montar una sucursal de su taller en otro municipio cercano, esto le dará una estabilidad económica favorable para dar educación a sus hijos y disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Jorge is a vigorous and hard-working man of 39. He tends his own business, a mechanics workshop, and sells spare parts for vehicles. He learned this business while he was working as a driver of cars and trucks. He began by selling spare parts as a street vendor, carrying the products in a handcart through the various streets of the town. Little by little, he saved until he was able to rent the shop where his business is now located. In this way he has managed to support his three children and his wife.

The loan he has applied for will be a help to capitalize his business. With the money, he will buy wholesale spare parts (spark plugs, lights, brakes). This will allow him to offer better service to his customers, which will be reflected in the increase in his sales.

Jorge dreams of strengthening his business and achieving a greater profitability, which will allow him in the near future to open a branch of his workshop in another nearby town. This will give him a favorable economic stability in order to give his children an education and enjoy a better quality of life with his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts wholesale (spark plugs, lights, brakes)

loans.name: Laily

texts.en:
Laily is a 37-year-old woman.  She is married and blessed with two children (one son and one daughter).  She lives with her husband and children in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. Both Laily and her husband are illiterate and just know how to sign their names. Due to poverty, they were not able to receive an education. Their children are receiving an education and are in grade 12 and grade 1.

Laily is a housewife and her husband is a land cultivator.  But he has no land, so he has to grow vegetables in a rented land.  Thus, their income is very scant. From the beginning, they have faced many problems.  He cannot give sufficient financial sustenance to his family with his small income.  Now, the educational expenses and their family expenses are growing day by day.

Then Laily came to know about Kiva’s partner, BJS and took a loan from them to purchase a cycle van.  A cycle van is a kind of transport to carry people and goods, especially in remote areas.  She hopes her husband will pull the van and earn some money by carrying goods and people. They are hopeful that their financial condition will be improved. They want to build a concrete-made house for their use.

They are thankful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle van for business purposes.

loans.name: Davison Arturo

texts.es:
Davison es un joven emprendedor de 20 años de edad, que no cuenta con los recursos económicos suficientes y por ello se gana la vida trabajando como comerciante independiente, elabora algodones de azúcar y los vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes calles del municipio donde reside, así genera los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos del hogar.
El crédito solicitado es un apoyo para capitalizar su negocio, con el dinero comprará materia prima al por mayor (azúcar, anilina vegetal, palitos de madera), esto le permitirá obtener los insumos a un menor costo, lo que se traduce en un aumento de la rentabilidad y los ingresos al vender los productos.
Davison, con su empeño, disciplina y dedicación desea sacar adelante su negocio y en un futuro quiere convertirse en un distribuidor mayorista de dulces, así podrá mejorar poco a poco su calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Davison is a young entrepreneur of 20 who does not have sufficient economic resources, and for that reason he earns a living working as an independent businessman. He makes cotton candy, and he sells it as a street vendor in the different streets of the town where he lives. Thus he generates sufficient resources to pay the household expenses.

The loan that he has applied for will be a help to capitalize his business. With the money, he will buy basic ingredients wholesale (sugar, vegetable dye, and little wooden sticks). This will allow him to obtain the ingredients at a lower cost, which translates into an increase in profitability and in his income from selling his products.

Davison, with his effort, discipline, and dedication, wants to advance in his business, and in the future he wants to become a wholesale distributor of sweets. Thus little by little he will be able to improve his quality of life and his well-being.

loans.use: to buy basic ingredients wholesale (sugar, vegetable dye, little wooden sticks)

loans.name: Majina

texts.en:
Majina is married and the mother of three sons.  All of them are students. One of them goes to college and the other two are in grade 11 and grade 6, respectively .They are from the small village of Altagram in the district of Jalpaiguri. Majina lives in their kachha house (mud, straw and bamboo made) with her children and husband Jainal.  Both Majina and her husband completed their primary education.

Majina’s husband has been in the farming business for the last 15 years.  He learned from his father and now he has extensive experience in this field. He grows potatoes, onions, garlic etc. and sells the produce to the local markets.  But to maintain a family of five members, including the educational expenses of their children, his income is not sufficient. He wants to cultivate eggplant on his farmland, but due to the lack of capital, he faces a hindrance to fulfill his desire. They have chosen this vegetable because it is widely used in national dishes.

Majina has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to help her husband to start cultivation of eggplant. The loan will help her to grow her business and to overcome their financial hurdles.  It will give her family financial stability and help her children with their higher education.

She aspires to build a concrete-made house with the additional income that will be generated from this business.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for cultivation.

loans.name: Shabana's Group

texts.en:
Shabana, a member of Shabana's Group, is the age of 28, mother of five children, living with her children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is taking a loan for her husband’s business that involves the sale and purchase of vehicles' tires. Through this business, her husband generates income for his family.

He wants to buy more vehicles’ tires to grow his business, but he does not have a sufficient amount of money to buy more tires. Therefore, Shabana contacted Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, and presented her humble request for taking a loan. 

Shabana seems very happy after taking this loan. She thanks Kiva and hopes that the lenders will take an active part to support her.

loans.use: to buy tires for her husband's business.

loans.name: Geeta

texts.en:
Geeta, 30, is an ideal entrepreneur who is married and the mother of two children. Her daughter is studying and her son is working. Geeta lives in Bagmari, Deoghar, a highly populated rustic town. In this part of the block, villages are very scattered so in every village there exists just one or two grocery shops. Geeta always looked for an opportunity to grow and opened a grocery shop. 

Geeta wants to expand her grocery shop now due to the increase in demands. Hence, she is seeking a loan of INR 10,000. With the loan, she will buy in bulk rice, wheat, sugar, grains, etc. She believes that the supply and demand will allow her to have more customers if only she can sell more items. She hopes this will improve her monthly income as her current earnings are not sufficient to run the household.

Geeta hopes to save enough for her daughter’s education and marriage.

loans.use: to buy rice, wheat, sugar and grains in bulk

loans.name: Rajiya

texts.en:
Rajiya is 20 years old, married and lives in Parandih village in the Devipur block, Deoghar in Jharkhand. She has one son and two daughters. Her husband works as a repairman for cycles, motorcycles and tractors. He has become an expert and known by many in the area for his expertise. Rajiya borrowed money from MESP to start a poultry shop where she buys hens from firms and sells them to local residents. She invested a part of the money to open a repair shop for her husband next to her poultry shop. She earns around Rs 100 – 150 from the poultry and he earns around Rs 200 – 250 per day.

River Ajoy cuts the village from Deoghar and in the past there was no road as well. Four years ago, a bridge was constructed and subsequently a road was constructed, which has resulted in better economic and trading activities as many shops have opened up on either side.
  
Rajiya’s husband couldn’t get any formal education and due to family pressure, he was put to work early in life because of poverty. Their desire is to provide a good education (private schools) to their children as the government school in the area is below average. Thus, she wants to borrow Rs 10,000 to buy more tools and peripherals for the cycle and motorcycle shop, to improve their earning and realize their dream of a better education for their kids.

loans.use: to buy more tools and peripherals for the cycle & motorcycle shop

loans.name: Shukla

texts.en:
Shukla is from the village of Baroghoria in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is 39 years old, married and a mother of two children (one son and one daughter).  She is a housewife and studied up to grade nine.  Both her children are students and read in grades nine and three.  Her husband Suresh, 43, has an education up to grade seven and is involved in land cultivation.

They own a plot of land where Shukla's husband grows vegetables, especially green vegetables. This agribusiness is the only means of earning for the family. Unfortunately, the income is too low to maintain the family well. So they have decided to cultivate potatoes on their farmland.

Shukla has now applied for this loan from BJS to be able to enlarge her husband’s farming business and gather more income for living.  The requested loan will be a huge help for Shukla to purchase potato seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for the land.  She hopes this new business will ensure her financial stability and that she will be successful in giving a better lifestyle to her family as well as a better education to her children so they can be established in life.

She dreams of purchasing a tractor in the future with the additional profit to be earned in the future.

She is thankful for both the lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for farming.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Racheal is a married woman. She has two children. She operates a retail business where she sells cosmetics and other beauty products. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be poor transport. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of cosmetics and other beauty products. Her business goal is to be an importer within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable family. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.  Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of cosmetics and other beauty products

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a married woman with five children. She describes herself as motivated. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows which produce milk for sale. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy animal feed and other farm inputs. Her business goal is to own a big business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will live a happy life. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and other farm inputs

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
This is Hadija. Her previous loan was a big help with her business. She was able to add more stock in her fruits and vegetable stall. She has been in this business for years now, and it keeps on growing. 

Besides the fruits and vegetable business, Hadija operates a kiosk shop.

She would like to apply for a loan to buy more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar for her business. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Alicia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell firewood business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell vegetables. Alicia is borrowing PHP 16,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional firewood to sell for her buy-and-sell firewood business.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional firewood to sell.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a very hard-working and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy shop items such as wheat flour, milk, eggs, detergent, maize flour and sugar for resale. She is grateful for the new support she has received.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, milk, eggs, detergent, maize flour and sugar for resale

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida  is a 45-year-old married women, and she is a responsible mother of two children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for twenty years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. Her husband needs to perform maintenance on his Taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good .  It incurs more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to pay for the maintenance. Therefore, Zahida has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan, Zahida's  husband can afford the maintenance cost easily, which will lead to better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Zahida also plans to build savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Zahida is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Vinita

texts.en:
Vinita is an enterprising woman who lives in Bagmari village, Deoghar district, in Jharkhand. She is married and the mother of two daughters and two sons. She works at ICDS Center (preschool) and earns INR 1,000 per month. Both her daughters are married. With her husband’s help, Vinita constructed a small house in their village. 

Vinita’s husband is a barber and has been in this business for the past 15 years. He has constructed a building beside Deoghar - Giridih state highway. The building has his salon and two more rooms to rent out. He makes an average of INR 150 per day from the salon.

Since the shop is located on the main road, Vinita hopes to have better and modern equipment, and cosmetics. This will improve her husband’s earnings; hence, she is requesting a loan of INR 10,000.

Vinita hopes to save enough to construct two more rooms wherein her sons could start their own independent businesses.

loans.use: to buy modern equipment and cosmetics.

loans.name: Power Puff Girls Group

texts.en:
The four sweet ladies appearing in the picture are enthusiastic, young women who have decided to leave their country and overcome their hard life conditions to improve the living of their beloved families. Being hardworking housekeepers with low incomes, the four ladies decided together to apply for their fifth loan cycle as members of the Power Puff Group, which has a good loan repayment history.

Gilda is the featured borrower of the Power Puff Girls Group.  She is a 45-year-old married mother of one child.  In fact, she doesn’t work as a housekeeper anymore, but rather established her own vegetable selling business.  Her loan proceeds will be invested in increasing her business merchandise with special, seasonal products to attract new customers and to increase her business income to make sure that her beloved family will have a better living.

Gilda is the first lady on the left.  As for the other group members, Lynatte is the lady with yellow top second from the left, Roda is the first lady on the right with the black top, and Nurhaina is the second lady from the right.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special, seasonal products to attract new customers, and to increase her business income to make sure that her beloved family will have a better living.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widowed woman with four children in school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. 

For the past three years, she has operated a kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned price fluctuation as her major challenge. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase salt, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar and beans for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase salt, milk, soft drinks, rice, sugar and beans for resale.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a hardworking entrepreneur, who has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear products in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock like shirts, shorts, slippers, etc. to sell in her ready-to-wear business.  Editha has been in this business for two years, and earns more income from farming sugar cane.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like shirts, shorts, slippers, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
This is Selina. She previously accessed a loan that she used to stock her grocery store. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures.

Selina would like to start farming by buying seeds and ploughing her land.  She is requesting a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her farming business.  She appreciates Kiva for its financial support. 

 She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her farming business.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over two years, she has operated an open air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby.

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Marjana

texts.en:
Marjana is a 42-year-old married mother from the vulnerable ethnic minority of Roma Gypsies in Albania. She’s got two children; 17 and 11 years old, and has been selling new clothes at a low prices for a long time now.

She needs this loan to stock up on such inventory items to resell them. Kindly note that she didn't feel comfortable with the idea of being taken her photograph in public, so she chose to be photographed inside her one-room little family house.

She and her family live in a little town of approximately 40,000 inhabitants, situated near the beautiful lake of Ohrid where the Koran fish is grown and Troft as well. Just across this lake on the other site are two Macedonian cities, Ohrid and Struga, and some villages. 

Along the national road of Tirana-Korca that crosses the town, there are tens of fishermen selling fresh fish to drivers or passengers. Also you can see them fishing in the lake with their old and primitive boats.

loans.use: to buy new clothes and resell them at low cost.

loans.name: Sophiko

texts.en:
Sophiko is 46 years old, from Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia. She lives with her son and daughter, who has an infant child. 

Sophiko works at the shopping mall as a saleswoman and she has a small monthly income. Since she is the only person working in the family, and with income insufficient to cover everyday costs, Sophiko decided to start an additional business. 

Sophiko requested a loan. The start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of USD 1,000. 

With the received credit, she will purchase wooden furniture (chairs and tables) and she will resell them at a higher price. This will increase the income of their family and Sophiko will be able to improve the living conditions for her children. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin to sell wooden furniture.

loans.name: Atiay

texts.en:
Atiay is 33 years old and resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children. Her husband owns a printing shop and has primary responsibility for fulfilling the needs of all family members. Atiay has been running her own beauty salon for the past five years and contributes her income toward managing the household. 
She needs to buy different types of cosmetics, creams, hair brushes and other accessories for her beauty salon but due to financial constraints is unable to. Therefore, Atiay has applied for a Kiva loan in a group with other two members. This loan will help her to buy the necessary items for her business so that she can provide better services to her customers. The loan also will help her earn maximum income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.
For this financial assistance, Atiay is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of cosmetics, creams and hair brushes

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en:
Bashiran is 57 years old and lives with her spouse and seven children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her husband has been running a small shop selling fruits and vegetables for many years in a nearby town and generates a reasonable income. With the passage of time, inflation increases day by day but the sources of income remain constant. To increase income, Bashiran's husband wants to his enterprise to progress. He lacks money to purchase more inventory on a daily basis. He tried to borrow some money from his friends and relatives but nobody helped him. 
Therefore, Bashiran has requested a loan for her husband so that he would be able to buy additional fruits and vegetables to sell. 
Bashiran thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetable to sell.

loans.name: Marybon Group

texts.en:
Nomo is the featured borrower of the Marybon group; she came together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been best friends since they left their home country, the Philippines, to work as housekeepers in Lebanon to improve their beloved families' living conditions.

Nomo is a 37-year-old widowed mother of one child, she works hard as a housekeeper to provide her beloved child with the necessary living needs. This is Nomo's second cycle as a borrower with Al Majmoua, Kiva's field partner. Her previous loan was sent to the Philippines to pay for her child's school fees. 

Today, Nomo's acquired loan will be invested for the same purpose, because she believes that education will provide her child with a brighter future.

Nomo is the first lady from the left. As for the other group members, Zoraida is the second from the left with eyeglasses, Nelia is the second from the right with a white hat, and  Rebecca is the first from the right.

loans.use: To pay for her child's school fees

loans.name: Sanavar

texts.en:
Sanavar is a repeat client of IMON. She is a very responsible woman and has a good credit story. Sanavar is 43 years old. She lives in the small village of north Tajikistan with her children. Her husband died some years ago. Sanavar’s family condition is so poor.

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. She feeds cattle and sells them at a local market. It is hardly enough to provide food for the family. 

She wants to develop her business, but she does not have money to buy more cattle. This loan will help her increase the number of cattle and, from the profit, improve their living condition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to resell.

loans.name: Toafa

texts.en: Toafa is 59 years old and has 10 children. She grows and sells vegetables such as tomatoes, cabbages, and cucumbers in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for a year. Toafa needs a loan to purchase a mist blower, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, and vegetable pots for her vegetable garden. She has just joined SPBD in order to gain access to financial assistance. Toafa will use the profits from her sales to help provide for her family's everyday needs. She will also save some to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: to purchase a mist blower, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, chemicals, and vegetable pots

loans.name: Francisca Aurora

texts.es:
EL grupo de crédito Los Tres Ángeles se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Francisca, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen seis hijos mayores de edad, con ella vive uno de sus hijos y un nieto de 7 años que estudia en escuela y que es como su hijo. Su esposo es discapacitado y no trabaja.
