Doña Francisca es una mujer muy luchadora que para ganar el sustento diario y al ver que su esposo no puede trabajar, ella con lo tenía instalo un pequeño quiosco en el cual vende gaseosas,  golosinas, aguas y otros bocadillos,  trabaja todos los días ya que el negocio lo tiene en su casa, a pesar de que su negocio no es muy grande esto le da para salir adelante gracias a los créditos que ha recibido ha podido salir adelante. Tiene más de 9 años en su negocio el cual les permite salir adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar gaseosas, aguas, papas fritas y varias golosinas más. Esta desde el inicio  en el grupo de crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le han brindado. Sus sueños son que su nieto sea un buen profesional.
texts.en:
The credit group  “Los Tres Ángeles” (The Three Angels) communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are renown both nationally and internationally; it’s where the famous Panama straw hats come from. 

Señora Francisca lives here. She is 55 years old, married, and has six grown children. She lives with one of her children and a 7 year old grandson who is in school and who is like her own son. Her husband is disabled and does not work.

Doña Francisca is a very determined woman. To make a living, as her husband cannot work, she installed a small kiosk to sell sodas, candies, water, and other snacks. She works every day since her business is home-based. Despite it not being a very big business it does produce enough for her to get ahead, and thanks to the loans she’s gotten she’s been able to move forward. She has had her business for over 9 years, which has contributed to her success.

This loan is to buy sodas, water, chips, and various other goodies. She has been in the credit group since its beginning, and likes it because of the help they have always provided. Her dream is for her grandson to become a good professional.

loans.use: to buy sodas, water, chips, and various other goodies.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
To have an additional source of income, Analyn engages in raising hogs within her community. She is 40 years old and has six school-going children. Despite financial hardships, she and her husband aim to continue sending their children to school. In this regard, she aims to improve her hog-raising business in order for her to increase her income. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more stocks of feeds and vitamins, and additional pigs to raise. Being kind and industrious mother, she believes that she will further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of feeds and vitamins, and additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Shafoahat

texts.en:
Shafohat is 61 years old. She is smart woman, who always pursues the well being of her family. She is married and has adult sons. 

Shafohat is going to organize her own business dealing with animal husbandry because she needs to earn money. She took part in a course "To Get Ahead" at a women's organization, and got a certificate. She liked this course, and she is glad about the women's organization and IMON. 

She will feed cows for some months, and then sell them in a local market. She is asking for a loan of 2,500 Somoni to buy cows. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cows for her new business.

loans.name: Pius

texts.en:
Pius is a married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 5 years to 15 years. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a retail business where he sells fruits and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a fast growing area and his primary customers are local residents. 

Pius describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. His business goal is to expand to wholesale within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Benaya

texts.en:
Benaya is a 45-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 10 to 20 years. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he makes bricks for sale. He has been involved in this business for three years. His primary customers are regular customers.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in seasons. He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more equipment for making bricks and hire casual workers. 

His business goal is to be the best within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan of KES 50,000 was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a dairy cow for his family.

loans.use: to buy more equipment for making bricks and hire casual workers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and help her family through her labors. She is requesting a loan to buy maize flour, beans and sugar for her business. 

Dorothy is grateful for the support of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, beans and sugar for her business

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a 40-year-old woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 4 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be innovative. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are general consumers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes to sell. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a good life. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: buy more stocks of clothes to sell

loans.name: Thuc's Group

texts.en:
Thuc is 44 years old and lives with her children and her husband. Her husband helps to support the family by repairing old scooters for people in community. 

For three years, Thuc has cooked food to sell to earn an income to support her family. She is the Group Leader of a five-member loan group that lives in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture she is in the middle wearing a printed T-shirt. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities to be able to better support their families. 

Thuc is requesting a loan to purchase a scooter that will help her to travel to and from the market. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To buy a scooter for her work.

loans.name: Lam's Group

texts.en:
Lam is 32 years old and lives with his children and wife. For the past 10 years he has been running a shop making iron doors in order to support his family. The leader of a seven-member loan group whose members live in Ho Chi Minh City, Lam is shown in the middle of the photo, wearing a white shirt. 

Each of the other group members is requesting loans to fund income-generating activities in order to better support their families. Lam is requesting one to purchase a stronger motorcycle to help him transport his products to his customers. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and attract additional ones. Lam also hopes it will help him to increase his income and save money for any future difficulties facing his family.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to transport his products to customers.

loans.name: Humaira's Group

texts.en:
Humaira is the age of 33; she is the mother of three children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. 

He manages his household necessities from his own store as well. Some of his relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with a monotonous tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up a very good relationship with his customers. 

His general store is very famous in the town; that is the reason his business is running well. Due to good relationships, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Humaira requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soap, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc. 

Humaira hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way; this amount will help him to cope with the demand. 

She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. for the general store.

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is 43 years old and is from a small village in Telavi District, Kakheti Region, East Georgia. She lives with her pensioner mother and two children.  The family lives in poverty, as they have no source of income except the pension, which is not enough even for medicines. 

Lali decided to start her own business and requested a loan. The start up program, which is a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,500 GEL. With the credit, she will purchase fruits and vegetables from wholesalers and then resell them at higher, retail prices. She already has space near her house in the village, where she will start her business. 

The start up program will be great support for the family. Lali awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin a trade in fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Emma Ruth

texts.en:
Emma Ruth is 36 years of age and she manages a small retail store within the local community. Due to problems and unavoidable circumstances, she was separated from her husband. Despite this, she dreams to become successful and financially stable in the future. She aims to improve and strengthen her business in order to generate a higher income. 

Having limited capital, she wants to avail herself of a loan, in the amount of PHP 10,000, to purchase additional stocks of laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings, canned goods, noodles, assorted biscuits, candies, and soft drinks to sell. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted, so she is able to improve the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of laundry soaps, beverages, seasonings, canned goods, noodles, assorted biscuits, candies, and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Maria Glenda

texts.en:
Maria Glenda, 36 years of age, is married to a farm laborer/carpenter, and is blessed with two children. She manages a direct selling business, which sells personal use products. She's been in this business for almost three years, earning a net income of PHP 2,500 a month. Her net income is usually spent on the family's daily expenses.

Due to insufficient capital, she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 to purchase clothes, shoes, lingerie, and cosmetics to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can improve her business and earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, shoes, lingerie, and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Shirmon

texts.en:
Shirmon is 50 years old and she is a hardworking woman with a great desire to get success in life. She is married and has four children. Two of them are non-adults. 

Shirmon is one of the successful business women of her town. For more than 25 years,  she has been busy with selling vegetables. She also grows some kinds of vegetables on rental land and sells them in her store in a local market. Her husband and some of her children help her with the business. She wants to develop her business further but her income is small and she needs your help and mercy.

This is the 17th loan she is requesting from IMON. She has a good credit history because she is a responsible woman. She is asking for a loan of 10,000 TJS to buy tomatoes and cucumbers to increase her working capital. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes and cucumbers to increase her working capital

loans.name: Mutemi

texts.en: Mutemi is a 29-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be humble, focused and God fearing. He operates a business where he sells fruits and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. His business goal is to open other businesses within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a good life.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Huong is 54 years old and lives with her son and her husband. For the past 12 years Huong has been running a store selling home appliances and electrical products from the front of her house to earn an income to support her family. She is the Group Leader of a 6-member loan group of women who live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture she is in the third from left, wearing a sun flower printed blouse. 

Each of the other group members is requesting a loan to fund income-generating activities. Huong is requesting a loan to purchase a better quality and greater variety of electrical products such as electrical wire, light bulbs, and power points to sell at her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: To sell a greater variety of electrical products such as electrical wire, light bulbs, and power points.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 51 years old, married and has nine children. Four of her children are in school.

Daisy is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Daisy requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Daisy has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Daisy would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the loan she is requesting of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for sale.

loans.name: Thuy's Group

texts.en:
Thuy is 41 years old, and lives with her son and her husband. For the past 11 years, Thuy has been running a business selling slippers and shoes to earn an income to support her family. She is the group leader of a five member loan group living in Ho Chi Minh City.  In the picture, she is in the forth from the left, wearing a grey jacket and black pants. 

Each of the other group members is requesting a loan to fund income-generating activities. Thuy is requesting a loan to purchase better quality and a greater variety of shoes to restock her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to buy slippers and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Kinaza

texts.en:
Kinaza is a 47-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her four children. Her husband has been working in a public sector organization for many years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of family. Kinaza is also providing sewing services and earns income to contribute to manage the household.
 
She needs different kinds of goods, e.g., needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc., for her business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also help her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Kinaza is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: buy different kinds of goods, e.g., needles, threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, etc.

loans.name: Martha Ideria

texts.es:
EL grupo de crédito Los Tres Ángeles se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 54 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad e independientes. Su esposo es artesano, el elabora sombreros de paja toquilla.
Doña Martha con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante y ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y  zapatillas, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda o cuando lleva mercadería nueva, ella sale a recorrer tres días por semana, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Tiene más de 20  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se ayudan para salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y zapatillas. Está en el grupo de crédito desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un local.
texts.en:
The Tres Ángeles credit group meets every fortnight in Canton Montecristi, known for its rich culture, internationally recognized pre-colonial crafts, and famous Panama hats. Martha is 54 years old, married, and has three independent, adult children. She lives in Canton Montecristi with her husband, a carpenter who works producing straw hats.

Doña Martha sells clothes and shoes of all kinds on her own to get ahead and help her husband with household expenses. She sells door-to-door three days a week and also in her house, where customers arrive when they need a garment or new merchandise. She offers goods on credit and charges every fortnight. She has more than 20 years experience doing this work which has helped her succeed.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts, and slippers. She has been in this credit group since its inception and she likes it because of the help the loans give her. Her dream is to have a shop.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and slippers.

loans.name: Virginia Margarita

texts.es:
EL grupo de crédito Los Tres Ángeles se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar Vive la señora Virginia, tiene 39 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 18 años que estudia en colegio. Su trabaja en Ciudad Alfaro. 
Doña Virginia es una muy buena ama de casa que para ayudar con los gastos que genera el hogar se dedica a preparar y vender bocadillos y comidas rápida, ella instala un pequeño puesto en el centro de la ciudad en la cual vende carne asada, cueritos acompañados de una rica ensalada y plátano asado, además de  colas, aguas, jugos  entre otras cosas que vende, trabaja todos los días por las tardes, lleva más de 18 años con su negocio el cual le permite salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar carne, plátano, cuero,  sodas, aguas y otros viveres para  la preparación de los alimentos. Es socia fundadora del grupo de crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus sueños son que su hijo sea un profesional.
texts.en:
The Tres Ángeles communal bank meets every 15 days in the Montecristi canton.  It is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts, which are recognized on a national and international level.  It is the place of the famous Panama hats.

Virginia, age 39, lives in this place.  She is in a common-law marriage, and they have an 18 year old son who goes to school.  Her husband works in the city of Alfaro.

Virginia is a very good housewife.  In order to help with the household expenses, she prepares and sells snacks and fast food.  She set up a small stand in the center of the city.  That is where she sells roasted meat, fried pork rinds accompanied by a delicious salad, and roasted bananas.  She also sells colas, water, and juices, among other things.  She works every day in the afternoons.  She has been in this business for 18 years, and it allows her to get ahead.

She will use the loan to buy meat, bananas, pork rinds, soda, water, and other supplies to prepare the food.  

She is a founding member of her communal bank.  She likes it because the loans are a big help.  Her dream is for her son to become a professional.

loans.use: to buy meat, bananas, pork rinds, soda, water, and other supplies.

loans.name: Saada

texts.en:
Saada is a 38-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 4 years to 16 years. She describes herself to be determined. 

She operates a food stall where she cooks food for sale. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a highly populated area and her primary customers are of all ages. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of business premise. 

She will use the KES 35000 loan to buy materials to build a business premise. Her business goal is to have a good business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be independent. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy materials to build a business premise

loans.name: Flocerfida

texts.en:
Flocerfida is 60 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

She has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from poultry.  Flocerfida aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 51 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Fe has been in this business for 14 years, and has previously received funds through Kiva.

She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Margesis

texts.es:
Margésis es una joven emprendedora de 20 años de edad, que se dedica a trabajar en su propio negocio, una venta de comidas, labora en dos turnos, en las mañanas ofrece empanadas, buñuelos, palitos de queso y en las noches vende perros, hamburguesas, arepas con todo, entre otros productos. El oficio lo aprendió de su madre y actualmente se encuentra ubicada en un local arrendado donde labora con 3 empleados directos.
El crédito solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de insumos al por mayor (carnes frías, aceite, verduras, gaseosas), esto le permitirá mantener buen surtido para satisfacer la demanda actual y deleitar a sus comensales con las delicias que ofrece, así logrará beneficio para su economía familiar.
Margésis manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es hacer crecer su negocio para que sea rentable y le permita pagar los estudios universitarios, pues sueña con ser una profesional para así mejorar su calidad de vida y apoyar económicamente a su familia.
texts.en:
Margésis is an enterprising young woman, age 20, who works in her own food sales business. 

She works two shifts: in the morning she offers empanadas, buñuelos (a sweet fritter), and palitos de queso (cheese sticks wrapped in dough and fried); and at night she sells hot dogs, hamburgers, arepas con todo (corn cakes that are folded and stuffed with a variety of meats, vegetables, etc.), and other products. She learned this occupation from her mother. Currently she is located in a rented establishment, where she works with three full-time employees. 

She will invest the loan that she has requested in the purchase of wholesale supplies such as cold cuts, oil, vegetables, and soda pop. This will allow her to stay well-stocked, in order to satisfy the current demand and please her diners with the tasty food that she offers. This way, she will be able to benefit her family’s finances. 

Margésis says that her biggest goal is to grow her business so that it will be profitable and allow her to pay tuition at the university, as she dreams of being a professional in order to improve her quality of life and support her family economically.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale supplies (cold cuts, oil, vegetables, and soda pop).

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma works hard to ensure her family lives well.

The previous loan helped her to grow her business. 

Here again she comes to you requesting another loan of Kshs 20,000 to buy tomatoes, potatoes, vegetables and fruit to sell. 

Fatuma appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, potatoes, vegetables and fruit to sell.

loans.name: Marybon 2 Group

texts.en:
Marili Juanitas is the featured borrower of the Marybon 2 group.  She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua because they are working hard to support their families since they left their hometown in the Philippines to work as housekeepers.

Marili Juanitas is a 45-year-old single mother of one child; she works as a housekeeper to provide her only child with the necessary living needs. 

She is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to send money to her parents back in the Philippines to pay for her child's increased living needs, especially his education.

She is the second lady from the right with the white top. As for the other group members, Luzviminda is the first from the right, Grace is the first from the left, and Catherine is the second from the left.

loans.use: to pay for her child's living needs, especially his education.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: El señor Vicente vive en el municipio de Colomi tiene 24 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador de estado civil soltero, económicamente es independiente, se dedica a la agricultura, siembra en terreno de 5 Has que fue herencia de sus padres, produce locoto y zapallo, con rotación de cultivos y tiene experiencia en el rubro, tambien cuenta con 4 cabezas de ganado vacuno lechero. El señor Vicente requiere el crédito para la compra de productos agroquímicos y abono orgánico, quiere aprovechar la época porque los precios son bajos y le entregan en el mismo lugar, con esta compra ya tiene asegurada la siembra de locoto, zapallo y otros productos para la seguridad alimentaria, ademas de esta forma lograra generar mayores ingresos a futuro para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Vicente, age 24, lives in the Colomi municipality.  He is a very hard-working man.  He is single, and he is financially independent.  He is a farmer.  He plants on five hectares of land that he inherited from his parents.  He produces hot peppers and pumpkins, and he rotates the crops.  He has experience in this line of work.  He also has four head of dairy cows.

Vicente needs the loan to buy agrochemical products and organic fertilizer.  He wants to take advantage of the time of year because the prices are low and they deliver to him in the same place.  With this purchase he is assured of planting hot peppers, pumpkins, and other products for food security.  Also, this way he will generate greater income in the future in order to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy agrochemical products and organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Roy

texts.es: Roy, tiene la edad  de 24 años, está soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de herramientas  que le ayuden y le puedan facilitar el trabajo en las obras de construcción principalmente de casas de habitación y aprovechar el conocimiento adquirido en capacitaciones y la práctica por varios años y poder tener  mejores ingresos económicos para seguir invirtiendo en la compra para la misma actividad y además de lograr algunas metas personales, y  también lograr un mejor acabado a las construcciones, además de aumentar la cantidad y calidad de los trabajos realizados. Con esta compra pretende hacer más casas y con diseños más variados y así cumplir con los pedidos por los clientes. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Roy is 24 years old, single, and lives with his parents and siblings who are his highest priority. He intends to use this loan to buy tools that will help to facilitate his work in the construction sector. He builds primarily houses, a skill that allows him to take advantage of the knowledge he acquired through his training. Roy has been in this line of work for several years and it has allowed him to earn more income that he can use to continue investing in his business activity. He also wants to accomplish a few personal goals and be able to build homes that have better finishes. Roy can also increase the quantity and quality of his work.

With this purchase, he intends to build more houses in various designs so that he can fulfill the requests of his customers. This is his first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. Roy has not received any other loans from the state banks, so FUDECOSUR is offering this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy tools for his construction work.

loans.name: Andres  Felipe

texts.es:
El proyecto de vida de Andrés Felipe  es escoger una carrera que le brindé oportunidades para desarrollarse plenamente en el futuro, el quiere estudiar para ser una persona que le brindé cosas positivas a la sociedad, piensa que es importante tener una base firme y sólida en la carrera en que se desenvuelva. 
Necesita fortalecerse estudiando con responsabilidad para lograr todos los objetivos, está seguro que si logra ubicarse en una carrera que reúna todas las características necesarias que está buscando, lograra cumplir uno de los proyectos más importantes para la vida.


Andrés piensa que una de las carreras que le puede ofrecer lo que busca para lograr el proyecto de vida, es la HOTELERÍA, ya que esta reúne las características que a él le interesan, tales como ofrecer a extranjeros y nacionales las ventajas y delicias que tiene el  país, también ve muy interesante la opción de abrir oportunidades en el extranjero ya que esta carrera tiene muchos campos de acción.


Andrés Felipe  piensa que CAMPO ALTO es una institución que ofrece una gran variedad de programas interesantes para el desarrollo de los estudiantes.
Además brindan oportunidades para que los estudiantes puedan cumplir los deseos de progresar en la vida, el dice que acogen a los muchachos que desean prepararse, con un gran calor humano y apoyo para ayudarlos a cumplir los proyectos. 
Le interesa mucho estudiar en CAMPO ALTO, porque tanto los profesores como todos los integrantes de este instituto son personas muy profesionales y sabe que tiene el futuro en unas excelentes manos.

El convenio con kiva es una alternativa que para él es muy buena  ya que no cuenta con los recursos económicos tan estables para poder pagar el valor de las cuotas normales como lo pide campo alto, con el monto que el pagaría con kiva se puede ahorrar un dinero que le puede servir para los gastos  y necesidades que le piden en la carrera.
texts.en:
Andrés Felipe’s project in life is to choose a degree program that will provide him with opportunities for full development in the future. He wants to study so that he can become a person who can offer positive things to society. Andrés believes that it is important to have a firm and solid foundation with a degree so that one can be adaptable. He needs to strengthen himself in his studies so that he can be responsible as he accomplishes all of his goals. Andrés is positive that if he pursues a career that has all the necessary qualities that he is looking for, then he will be able to accomplish one of his most important goals in life.

Andrés believes that one career path that can offer him what he looking to achieve in life is the hospitality industry. It has all the qualities that interest him, such as the opportunities that are offered to both foreigners and locals, as well as the advantages and delights of working within his own country. He is also very interested in being open to the option of having opportunities abroad in which a degree could lead to different types of fields.

Andrés Felipe believes that CampoAlto is an institution that offers a wide variety of interesting programs in which its students can develop. In addition to the academic opportunities that are provided, he also wants to make progress in life. He says that he mentors other young men who want to prepare themselves, nurtures them with great warmth, and supports them as they accomplish their goals.

Andrés is very interested in studying at CampoAlto because the professors are all members of the institute. They are professional individuals who know that they are placing the future in excellent hands.

The Kiva program is a good alternative for Andrés Felipe since he does not have stable financial resources that would allow him to pay the normal installments that are required by CampoAlto. A Kiva loan would reduce his installments and the money he saves can be designated for other expenses and necessities that are related to his degree.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of tuition.

loans.name: Hytham

texts.en:
Hytham is a 22-year-old single man who lives with his family in Sana'a, Yemen.  He is currently a student in the second semester in Sana'a University. 

Hytham has a taxi transport which he does to cover his educational expenses and to help his parents with the expenses of the family. The money, which he earns from this business is very low because he spends most of his time studying. 

Hytham wants to furnish his house but he doesn't have enough money to do so. He wants to prepare his house for his wedding after finishing the University, so he is requesting a youth loan of 60,000 YER from AMB in order to buy a bedroom suite.

Hytham looks forward to finish his University studies and getting married.  After that, he aspires to save enough money so he can afford to cover all the expenses of his family.

loans.use: To buy a bedroom suite for the house

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es: El señor Hernán es una persona responsable y humilde, tiene 28 años de edad, se dedica a la prestación de servicios de gomería, se encuentra en la ciudad de Monteagudo,  no tiene dependientes económicos y vive en alquiler, sus principal actividad es el parchado vulcanizado de las diferentes movilidades y motocicletas, lo realiza  durante todo el año desde muy temprano, para así poder tener mejores ingresos y condiciones de vida. Trabaja arduamente para cubrir los gastos de alimentación, ropa, servicios básicos y otros gastos en los que incurren en su hogar. Como no tiene muchos recursos económicos, actualmente requiere un crédito para poder invertir en un nuevo negocio, como segunda actividad, ya que es muy necesario para complementar su trabajo y superarse en la vida, así mismo lograra mejorar su calidad de vida y podrá cubrir los gastos que se le presentan.
texts.en:
Hernán, age 28, is a responsible and humble person.  He provides tire services in the city of Monteagudo.  He does not have financial dependents, and he rents where he lives.  His main business activity is volcanized patching for different vehicles and motorcycles.  He starts very early, and he works all year in order to be able to have better earnings and living conditions.  He works arduously in order to cover the expenses for food, clothing, basic services, and those incurred by his household.

He does not have many financial resources.  He currently needs a loan to be able to invest in a new business as a second business activity.  He really needs it to complement his work and succeed in life.  Moreover, he will manage to improve his quality of life, and he will be able to cover the expenses that come up.

loans.use: to invest in a new business.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y galletas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negoco de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita le credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower continues to dedicate herself to her grocery store business. She sells basic staple goods such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies. She works from 8:00 a.m until 7:00 p.m. She has 5 years of experience with this business, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her grocery store. She is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies. 

She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies to stock her store.

loans.name: Luciano Ribeiro

texts.en:
Luciano, 31 is married and has 3 daughters, one 6 years, another 9 and the oldest 11 years. He was a painter from an early age and has worked as a mason, electrician and general helper services. Currently he works with painting in houses.

His family came to the city of Sorocaba 6 years ago. He came from the state of São Paulo in search of better opportunities, because there he was working on the farm and earned very little, it was not enough to sustain the family. He says when he came to Sorocaba young, it was very difficult to find work, and he had difficulty, but today they are much better.

Now he wants to start selling cleaning products because with friend saw a great business opportunity and income increase. Has to support of his wife, because they live in the city are alone with no family.

They need R$ 2,000.00 to buy the products and make the disclosure. He want to go back to school and do a chemistry course and buy their own house in addition to college.

loans.use: To buy floor polisher and cleaner products

loans.name: David Hernani

texts.es:
David, repara y vende celulares, trabaja de todos los días de 8:00 a.m.  a 3:00 p.m., está acompañado, junto a su compañera de vida han procreado un hijo. Por el momento no representa problemas en su negocio.
El préstamo que requiere lo utilizara para comprar una vitrina, celulares, manos libres, protectores, cargadores, chips entre otros accesorios necesarios para tener debidamente surtido el negocio y mejorar sus ventas.
Su deseo es tener un local más amplio para ofrecer más y mejor mercadería.
texts.en:
David repairs and sells cell phones. He works every day from 8:00 a.m.to 3:00 p.m. He has a life partner, with whom he has a child. Currently, he is not facing any problems with his business.

He will use the loan he is requesting to buy a display case, cell phones, hands-free systems, protective cases, chargers and chips, among other accessories. He needs these items in order to have his business well-stocked and to improve his sales. 

His desire is to have a larger shop in order to offer more and better merchandise.

loans.use: to buy a display case, cell phones, hands-free systems, protective cases, chargers, chips and other accessories.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
La socia se dedica al negocio de venta de comida,la socia realiza diferentes paltos como pollo al horno,sopas y saltados de carne,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz,verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member has a business selling food.  She makes a variety of dishes such as baked chicken, soups and salted meats.  She works from 8 am to 6 pm.  She has eight years of experience in this business, and things are going very well.  Her dream is to have her own restaurant.  She is seeking a loan in order to purchase ingredients for cooking, such as rice, vegetables and chicken.

She is grateful for the loan opportunity and promises to comply with her repayment schedule.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for cooking, such as rice, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes greatly appreciates Kiva lenders supporting her financially. She is a hardworking and enterprising tailor.

She is asking for a loan to buy a new tailoring machine for her business. She is grateful for the financial support she has received.

loans.use: to buy a new tailoring machine for her business.

loans.name: Jose Saul

texts.es:
José, opta por un nuevo crédito, por los beneficios que le dan y la facilidad de pago, en esta oportunidad comprara una cámara fotográfica y papel para fotos, mejora su inventario para dar a sus clientes un buen servicio y continuar cumpliendo con sus compromisos económicos.
El capital anterior le permitió mejorar su equipo de trabajo, facilitándole tener clientes nuevos, sus ingresos han mejorado, las condiciones familiares han cambiado positivamente.
texts.en:
José is opting for a new loan, because of the profit they give him and the ease of payments. This time he will buy a camera and photography paper to improve his inventory in order to give his clients better service and to continue fulfilling his financial commitments. 

The previous capital allowed him to improve his work equipment, making it easier for him to have new clients. His income has improved and the conditions at home have changed for the better.

loans.use: to buy a camera and photography paper.

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en:
Yen is 42 years old and lives with her children and her husband. For the past eight years, Yen has been running a food stall from the front of her house to earn an income to support her family. 

Yen is the group leader of an eight-member loan group. The group members live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture, Yen is fifth from the left and wearing a red jacket. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities. 

Yen is requesting a loan to purchase a better quality and greater variety of products, such as food and beverages, to restock her stall. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages for selling at her food stall.

loans.name: Kunduz

texts.en: Kunduz was born in the year 1963. She is married and has five children.  Also, she is a lovely grandmother of six grandchildren. Kunduz is a kind and hardworking woman. She has her own farm. She grows agricultural products. Some of the local women work on her farm. She is the main feeder and keeper of her family as her husband does not have a job. Now, he is going to go to Russia to find a job but he does not have the money to buy an air ticket. Kunduz must help her husband. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy an air ticket for her husband to Russia. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy an air ticket for her husband to Russia

loans.name: Fomu

texts.en: Fomu is a hardworking mother who strives hard to ensure her family lives well.  She appreciates the support of the previous loan that helped her with the business.  Here again she comes to you requesting another loan of KES 30,000 to buy bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat for the business.

loans.use: to buy  bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat for her business.

loans.name: Jennipher

texts.en: Jennipher is a 63-year-old divorced woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest, focused and God fearing. She operates a retail business where she sells curtains.  She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a busy residential area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be fluctuation of prices. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of curtains. Her business goal is to have a shop to sell from within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.  Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of curtains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coffee wholesale

loans.name: Hieu

texts.en: Hieu's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of food and beverages to sell and to further repair her stall.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 45-years-old and widowed with two daughters.  He also takes care of four relatives between the ages of 14 and 22. Richard provides financial services to people in his community by offering mobile money transfers and payments.  Richard is an entrepreneur at heart and is always looking for unique ways to grow and improve his business.  

He operates his primary outlet Monday-Saturday from 8:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. Currently, he employs 12 people at his 10 different locations. This is Richard’s third loan from Kiva. He would like to take this opportunity to thank his lenders for helping him grow the business. The previous loans allowed Richard to grow the number of outlets he currently operates to 10. Furthermore, Richard has been able to grow his working capital and serve more customers sending and receiving money from his shops. He has also been able to employ more young adults to help with the day-to-day transactions. 

Richard has fully repaid his first loan and continues to always pay his second loan on time. He has requested another loan from Kiva in order to pay for the five trading booths he currently uses to serve his customers. He explains that he is still trying to grow his mobile money transfer business so that all his locations can be profitable.

He plans to use the profits from his growing business to continue paying for his daughter's and dependents' school fees.

loans.use: To purchase five trading booths

loans.name: Lucy Mayin

texts.es:
La socia Lucy Mayin se dedica al negocio de venta de tejidos y telares,la socia vende diferentes tejidos,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hatsa las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares.La socia solicita el credito para comprar tejidos y telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The communal bank member Lucy Mayin works in a business of selling knitted items and weavings. She sells different types of knitted items. She works from 8:00 am to 7 pm. She has already had this business for 8 years, and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to expand her business of selling knitted items and weavings. She is applying for the loan to buy knitted items and weavings.

She is happy about the loan, and she promises to make make her payments.

loans.use: to buy knitted items and weavings to sell

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en: Criselda is 35-years-old and single. She lives with her parents in a rural community managing a small retail store. She aims to improve her business and increase her income to satisfy their daily necessities and save some for future emergencies. Having inadequate capital, she is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy additional stock of soft drinks, snack foods, assorted candies, beverages, canned goods, noodles and seasonings to resell. She is hoping to use her loan request to be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of soft drinks, snack foods, assorted candies, beverages, canned goods, noodles and seasonings to resell

loans.name: Judith De Los Angeles

texts.es:
EL grupo de crédito Los Tres Ángeles se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Judith, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 15 y 13 años que estudian en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Judith y su marido tienen una tienda de víveres en el mercado local, allí venden todo tipo de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres y productos de bazar, en su local trabajan todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, llevan seis  años con su tienda y sus ventas son muy buenas.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos, entre otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el grupo de crédito desde hace 4 ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan los créditos. Sus metas es tener un local propio.
texts.en:
The "Los Tres Ángeles" credit group meets every fifteen days in the Montecristi Canton. It is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handmade crafts, which are nationally and internationally recognized. It is the home of the famous Panama hats.

Señora Judith lives here. She is 47 years old and she is married with two children, ages 15 and 13, who are studying in high school. Her husband is a merchant. 

Doña Judith and her husband have a grocery store in the local market where they sell all kinds of products, such as rice, sugar, oil, detergent, pulses, and household products. They work in their store every day from 6:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m., and sometimes later.  They have had their store for six years and their sales are very good. The loan will be used for adding additional stock to their store; she is going to purchase rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cold cuts, and other basic products. 

She has been in the credit group for four cycles, and she likes it for the help that the loans always provide. Her goal is to have her own store.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cold cuts, and other basic products.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai, 54, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her daughter. 

Mai earns money through her business selling meals such as pork noodles and rice for people in her community. She would like to get a loan to buy a larger quantity of rice and furniture to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members will have a better future.

loans.use: To buy rice and furniture for her food stall.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This is Ali and Floreta in the picture and they want to build greenhouses. This loan will help them achieve their goal. Their type of activity is agriculture, planting mostly seasonal veggies and fruits and they have a milk cow as well, as seen in the picture. Their 24-year-old son, who owns a little village store, helps them financially when he can. 

They live in suburbia, yet in a little village with some beautiful and green scenery throughout the year due to the warm climate, outside the city of Elbasan. Due to their location, it makes it easy for them to walk to the city to sell their produce. They believe that planting in the greenhouses will give them that extra cash to do things they must do in the near future, such as making some repairs to their home and building a proper stable for the cow and baby calves when they are born.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en: Raphael is a 43-year-old married man. He has five children with ages ranging from 2 to 17 years old. He describes himself to be honest, focused and God fearing. He operates a restaurant where he cooks food for sale. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be fluctuation of prices. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy ingredients for preparing food to sell. He hopes that in the future, he will have a successful business and family. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of Kes 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing food to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy shop stock such as maize flour, cooking oil, baking flour, rice, etc.

loans.name: Jose Elias

texts.es:
José, es casado, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos de 8 y 12 años de edad, no tiene ayuda del extranjero, su actividad económica es la siembra de granos básicos tanto para consumo familiar como para comercializarlo, trabaja de 4:00 a.m. hasta las 12:00 p.m. 
Con el crédito comprara abono, plaguicidas, herbicidas, semilla e insecticidas, para preparar el terreno en el que efectúa la siembra, espera evitar plagas, aumentar su cosecha y mejorar su economía.
Anhela mejorar su vivienda y comprar un vehiculo.
texts.en:
José is married. He lives with his wife and two children, ages 8 and 12. He doesn't have help from overseas. His economic activity is raising basic grains, as much for family consumption as to sell. He works from 4:00 am to 12:00 pm.

With the loan, he will buy compost, pesticides, herbicides, seeds, and insecticides, in order to prepare the land in which he will do the planting. He hopes to avoid pests, increase his harvest, and improve his economy.

He aspires to improve his home and buy a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy compost, pesticides, herbicides, seeds, and insecticides.

loans.name: Elsi Noemi

texts.es:
Elsi, opta por un nuevo crédito para incluir un nuevo rubro que le permita incrementar sus ingresos, ella invertirá en la compra de gas propano, maíz, bolsas y pago de mano de obra, para elaborar la venta de tortillas.
Con el préstamo anterior incremento el inventario de su negocio, ofreció animales en mejores condiciones por lo que sus ventas son mayores, ha mejorado su situación económica, ofrece a su familia una vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Elsi has chosen to ask for a new loan to be able to include a new item for sale that allows her to increase her income.

She will buy propane gas, corn, bags and pay for labor to develop the sale of tortillas.

With the previous loan, she increased her inventory, and offered animals in better condition so her sales are higher. It has improved her economic situation and offers her family a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase propane gas, corn, bags and pay for labor.

loans.name: Yeny Carmen

texts.es:
La socia  Yeny Carmen se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, la socia realiza diferentes paltos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, verduras y pollo.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower, Yeny Carmen, is in the business of selling food. She makes different dishes such as baked chicken, soups and sautéed meat.

She works from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm. She has been in this business for 8 years and is doing very well.  Her dream is to have a restaurant. She is requesting a loan to buy cooking products such as rice, vegetables and chicken.

The borrower is happy for the loan and agrees to comply with the terms of the payment.

loans.use: to buy cooking products such as rice, vegetables and chicken.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dump truck

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic, 43 years old, has continued to grow his Zoona mobile money transfer business with the help of his wife Majory and their two daughters. His business is located in Luanshya, a town in the Copperbelt province of Zambia.

Dominic would like to take this opportunity to thank the Kiva lenders. With their support, he has been able to open a new outlet in Luanshya and bring new customers on board. Dominic says even though working capital still remains a huge challenge, he is happy with the growth he has seen in his business. He used the proceeds from his loans to purchase a new fridge for his perishable goods, add to his working capital, and make infrastructure improvements to his shop location. He says paying for his children’s school fees has become much easier because of his increased revenue. 

This is the fourth loan that Dominic is taking out from Kiva. He needs the loan to help him increase the working capital at his new location. He explains that the added services have increased the shop's demand and as such, he needs more capital to satisfy his customers' money transfer needs. He thanks the Kiva lenders for their continued support.

loans.use: To increase his working capital to process more money transfers

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 39-year-old married man. He has five children with ages ranging from 6 years to 14 years. He describes himself to be good at work. 

He operates a food stall where he cooks cassava for sale. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a busy area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low capital. 

He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of cassava. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve and make his business big. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of cassava

loans.name: Dúo Salem Group

texts.es: TESTIMONIO DE DUO SALEM  integrado por la señora Crisalida Quien es madre de 3 hijos y la cual se dedica  a ordeñar vacas y vender leche todos los días. Desde hace 12 años la señora se dedica a vender leche ya que es un negocio heredado y con el cual ayuda con aportar en su familia ella no solo quiere quedarse con las vacas y terneritas que tiene, si no que sueña con tener muchas mas a manera de poder heredar a sus hijos para que mas adelante ellos tengan un buen ingreso en sus familias, los hijos de la señora Crisalida aun estudian y ella le pide a Dios poder lograr que cada uno se gradue y se conviertan personas de éxitos y profesionales y por eso que ella acude a FAPE para que le otorgue un crédito para poder comprar 2 terneritas y asi seguir su visión y alcanzar su sueño.
texts.en: Crisalida is a member of the Dúo Salem group. She is the mother of three children, and earns a living by milking cows and selling the milk every day. She has been doing this for 12 years now. It is a business that has been passed down in her family, and it helps her to support her family. She dreams of having many more cows and calves than she has at the moment; she would like to give them to her children so that in the future they can have a decent income for their families. Crisalida's children are still in school, and she prays that they will graduate and become successful professionals. This is why she is seeking a loan from FAPE: she would like to buy 2 calves, and continue working towards achieving her dream.

loans.use: to buy calves to raise.

loans.name: Tsuma

texts.en:
Tsuma is married with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She does farming and sells farm products at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase seven sacks of fertilizer and seeds to plant in this rainy season. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seeds to plant in this rainy season

loans.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es:
Verónica, se le presenta la necesidad de invertir en la venta de ropa, por lo que solicita un nuevo financiamiento para comprar ropa interior, camisas, blusas, faldas, pantalones, vestidos, pantaletas, etc., surtida en estilos, colores, y tallas para complacer las peticiones de sus clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior fortaleció el negocio para mantenerse trabajando sin limitante alguna, sus ventas aumentaron, su grupo familiar se mantiene.
texts.en:
Veronica needs to invest in her clothing sales business, so she is requesting new funding in order to purchase undergarments, shirts, blouses, skirts, pants, dresses, panties, etc., in the styles, colors, and sizes that her customers have requested.

With the previous loan she strengthened her business in order to continue working without any limitations. Her sales have increased and her family is fine.

loans.use: to purchase undergarments, shirts, blouses, skirts, pants, dresses, panties, etc.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with two school-going children. They live at their own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her kids. 

She has operated a khanga (women's wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of khangas for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khanga’s for resale

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Reina, requiere de un nuevo crédito con el que incrementará el inventario de su venta de tortillas, comprara gas propano, maíz, cal, leña y mantas, así contara con clientes más satisfechos y buenos ingresos.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo los materiales necesarios para aumentar la calidad, las ventas y las ganancias de su negocio, su familia vive en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Reina is requesting a new loan in order to increase the inventory for her tortillas business.

She will buy propane gas, corn, lime, firewood and foil wraps so she can count on more satisfied customers and good income.

With the previous loan, she obtained the necessary materials to increase the quality, sales and profits of her business, and her family lives in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy propane gas, corn, lime, firewood and foil wraps.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, assorted drinks, and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Mercedes Maribel

texts.es:
EL grupo de crédito Los Tres Ángeles se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 13, 12, 10 y 4 años de edad, la mayor estudia en colegio y los dos menores en escuela. Su esposo es albañil.
Doña Mercedes con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante en el hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, sabanas y edredones,  su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, ella aprovecha para salir en las mañanas ya que a esa hora sus hijos están en la escuela,  deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días, empezó su negocio con el primer crédito que recibió del banco por lo cual está muy agradecida ya que su marido en ocasiones no tiene trabajo y gracias a sus ganancias salen adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa de todo tipo, sabanas y edredones. Está en el grupo de crédito desde el inicio y le gusta porque gracias al primer crédito empezó su negocio. Sus sueños es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The loan group Los Tres Ángeles (The Three Angels) meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton, which is known for its rich precolonial culture and for its artisan crafts, which are known at a national and an international level. [It is also the place] of the famous hats of toquilla straw.

Señora Mercedes lives in this place. She is 28 years old and is married. From this relationship, she has four children, ages 13, 12, 10, and 4. The oldest is in middle school, and the two younger ones are in primary school. Her husband is a mason.

Doña Mercedes, with the goal of earning something on her own and with this being able to get ahead in her household, sells clothing of all types, sheets, and quilts. Her form of sales is door to door, and she also sells in her house, where her more familiar customers arrive. She makes use of the mornings to go out, since at this hour her children are in school. She leaves products with her customers on credit and collects every two weeks. She began her business with the first loan that she received from the bank, for which she is very grateful, since her husband sometimes doesn't have work, and thanks to her earnings, they can get ahead.

This loan is to buy clothing of all types, sheets, and quilts. She has been in this loan group since its beginning, and she likes it because thanks to the first loan, she began her business. Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy clothing, sheets, and quilts to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 46-year-old married man. He has four children ranging in age from 11 to 19 years. He describes himself to be patient. David operates a food stall where he cooks cassava to sell, and has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a busy area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low capital. 

David will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of cassava. His business goal is to grow the business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his standards of living. This is David’s third loan with SMEP DTM, and previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cassava

loans.name: Vilma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Vilma, solicita un nuevo préstamo para abastecer su tienda con productos que le permitirán satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, comprara jabón, detergente, boquitas, pan, jugos, granos básicos, etc.,
El financiamiento anterior le fue de mucha utilidad para tener más mercadería en su negocio, sus condiciones económicas han mejorado y las circunstancias familiares han cambiado positivamente.
texts.en:
Vilma is requesting a new loan to stock up her shop with goods that will allow her to satisfy her customers' needs. She will buy soap, detergent, snacks, bread, juices, basic grains, etc.

Her previous loan was very beneficial, as she was able to buy more goods for her business, and her financial situation as well as her family's circumstances improved.

loans.use: to buy soap, detergent, snacks, bread, juices, basic grains, etc.

loans.name: Jury

texts.es:
La socia Juri se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de belleza,la socia vende lapiz labiales,cremas y perfumes,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza.La socia solicita le credito para comprar cremas,lapiz labiales y perfumes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The communal bank member Jury sells beauty products. She sells lipsticks, creams, and perfumes. She works from 8:00 am to 7:00 pm. She has been in this business for a number of years. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell beauty products. She is applying for the loan to buy creams, lipsticks, and perfumes.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy creams, lipsticks, and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Cerly María

texts.es: Cerlyn María, tiene la edad  de 28 años, está casada,  vive con su esposo  y su hija, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de ropa para abastecer su tienda de productos nuevos y variados para que los clientes tengan varias alternativas de escoger artículos para comprar, y de esta manera poderle ofreces a los clientes una mayor cantidad de productos para el uso personal y de buena calidad. Con esta compra pretende tener mejores ingresos para invertir más en su negocio y cumplir algunas metas que en el futuro le mejorará su calidad de vida para ella y su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Cerlyn María is 28 years old, married and lives with her husband and her daughter who are her main priorities. With her loan she plans to buy clothing to stock her store selling new products and variety products. Then she can offer her customers a variety of alternatives to choose articles to purchase. She can offer a greater quantity of goods for personal use and of good quality. With this investment she hopes to have more income so she can invest more in her store and achieve a few goals in the future, improving the quality of living for her and her family. this is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR. She has not had previous loans with the state banks and FUDECOSUR has offered a loan with better conditions and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en: Mwanasha appreciates the support of the previous loan that supported her economically. Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to buy more thatching materials made from palm fronds (makuti) to sell.

loans.use: to buy more thatching materials made from palm fronds (makuti) to sell

loans.name: Bashiran

texts.en:
Bashiran is 51 years old and she is the mother of six sons and three daughters living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages his household necessities from his store. As well, some of his relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with a monotonous tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behaviour and tone, he has built up a very good relationship with his customers. His general store is very famous in the town and that is the reason that his business is running well. Due to these good relations, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. 

Therefore, Bashiran has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses (edible seeds), soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc. Bashiran thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan. Bashiran hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way; this amount will help him to cope with the demand.

loans.use: To buy wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soaps, shampoo, detergents, biscuits etc.

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.en:
This is Muhabbat, a resident of Tajikistan. She is married and has three children. Muhabbat, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Muhabbat operates a clothing sales business. She buys clothes and sells to local people. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She has earned a living this way for more than 24 years. 

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting an 8,000 TJS loan. She will be using the loan to buy clothes for the new season. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes for the new season

loans.name: Uhai Group

texts.en:
Sakina is in her early 30s and is single with four kids who are still in school. She has been running two projects, a boutique selling clothes and shoes and a catering business for fifteen years. Sakina works at her businesses from 8 a.m. to 8:30 p.m. per working day and is able to make a fair monthly profit.
 
This is Sakina’s second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to replenish her boutique with clothes, bags, and shoes. She successfully paid back the loan. 

Sakina earned extra income which she used to cover household expenses, school fees, and house rent. She covered part of the house building expenses. She will use this new loan to buy a fridge and to buy clothes to meet her customers' demand. In the coming years, Sakina would like to open a hotel. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, Uhai, which has three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a fridge and to buy clothes to meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 53-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be visionary and focused. 

She operates a farm where she grows tea and vegetables for sale. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a fertile area, and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy seeds and other farm inputs. Her business goal is to be a successful farmer within five years.

loans.use: to buy seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 61-year-old married woman. She has four children ranging in age from nine to 25 years. She describes herself to be determined and focused. 

Rosemary operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows that produce milk to sell. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in an area ideal for farming and her primary customers are hotels. Rosemary describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of adequate capital. 

Rosemary will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy animal feed. Her business goal is to have a big business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM, and her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, comenta que el crédito anterior le ayudo a mejorar su inventario, sus ventas y ganancias aumentaron, con lo que ha cancelado sus deudas, mejorado el estilo de vida familiar y compro un choche para salir a vender tacos.
En esta oportunidad el capital que requiere le facilitara comprar variedad de ropa, maní, tomates, cebollas, chiles, aceite, carne, gas propano, etc., serán muy útiles para que su negocio funcione y en un futuro tener un local para ofrecer más variedad de menús.
texts.en:
Juan says that the previous loan helped him to improve his inventory, and his sales and earnings increased.  He paid off his debts, improved his family’s lifestyle, and purchased a cart in order to go out to sell tacos.

On this occasion the capital that he is requesting will help him to purchase a variety of clothing, and also peanuts, tomatoes, onions, peppers, oil, meat, gas, propane, etc.  This will be very helpful for the functioning of his business; and in the future, for having a stall in order to offer a more varied menu.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing, and peanuts, tomatoes, onions, peppers, oil, meat, propane gas, etc.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 34-year-old married woman and she has two children. She describes herself to be enterprising. She operates a retail business where she sells washing soap, cooking oil, juices, sweets and other items. Alice has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are regular customers. 

Alice will use the loan of KES 40,000 to buy more stock of washing soap, bread, cooking oil and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will sustain her family through the business. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 10,000 was repaid successfully. Alice also operates a food stall, where she cooks food to sell, to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy more stock of washing soap, bread, cooking oil and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fruit for resale.

loans.name: Machimbo Group

texts.en:
Kobelo, who is in his mid 30s, is married with two children who are still going to school.  He has been operating a general store for six years now. He works from 7 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Kobelo's twelfth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy a motorcycle, and to buy items for the general store; he has repaid all of his loans successfully.  He is doing great and he appreciates Kiva for supporting their group.  He used the profits to pay for school fees and cover household expenses. He will use this loan to buy out of stock items for his general store.  His dream is to build his own house.

Kobelo will share this loan with his loan group "Machimbo" consisting of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy out of stock items for his general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sheep in order to raise them and resell.

loans.name: Waefeso Group

texts.en:
Mwamvita is in her early forties and has two sons who are enrolled in school. Mwamvita is married and for five years now she has run two enterprises:  a beauty salon and a poultry business where she raises 600 chicks.
