She runs her businesses from 8 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a very good profit each month. 

This is Mwamvita’s twelfth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Mwamvita used the previous loans (all of which she repaid successfully) to buy cell phones from China that she sold, and to buy handbags and woman shoes to sell in her beauty salon. Mwamvita earned extra income that she put back into her business. She will use this loan to buy hair products and 600 chicks. In the coming years, Mwamvita would like to open a big shop and expand her beauty salon.

Mwamvita will share this loan with her loan group “WAEFESO” which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy hair products and 600 chicks

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en: Oscar is a 32-year-old cafe owner, at Vikwatani Mombasa Kenya. He is a married man who supports three and his spouse is a housewife. He has been in this business for the last four years doing great. This marks his fourth borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business. He will use the loan to purchase charcoal, milk, sugar, wheat flour, and cooking fat. The anticipated profits will be used to service his loan. He hopes to expand his business further in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal, milk, sugar, wheat flour, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Dúo Las Torrelianas Group

texts.es:
DUO TORRELIANAS

Maudelia tiene 40 años de edad, tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos asisten al establecimiento escolar cerca de su domicilio, ella se dedica a la venta de chicharrones los fines de semana y a la venta de colchas y vajillas, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia(colchas vajillas) la venta esperando que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: This is the communal bank "Duo Torrelianas."  Maudelia is 40 years old.  She has 3 children, 2 of whom attend the school near her home.  Maudelia has a business selling pork rinds on the weekends, and she also sells bedspreads and dinnerware.  At this time, she is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise (bedspreads and dinnerware) to sell.  She is hoping that you can help her with the loan that she is requesting.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads and dinnerware to sell

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
Shuhrat is 30 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and 3 children. He has had his own business for 14 years and it is his source of income. He sells sugar, rice, beans, eggs, soft drinks etc. 

Lately, he has not had many customers so that is why he decided to widen the assortment of his goods. He is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS. With it he is going to buy dairy products, meats and cold cuts, as he wishes to satisfy the demand of his customers and always keep his store well stocked. 

His goal is to always keep his goods moving quickly, as it is the source of income for his family.

loans.use: to buy food items to widen the assortment of his goods

loans.name: Anas

texts.en:
Anas runs a small stall selling mobile accessories and mobile phone airtime credits. Anas lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta.  Anas is single and lives with four people in the family house.

Anas began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Onan Hipolito

texts.es:
Onan, se dedica a vender frutas y verduras de manera informal en la calle, sus labores inician a las 6:00 a.m. finalizando a las 5:00 p.m. , oficio lo practica desde hace dos años, también sale a vender panes con pollo y refrescos, como forma de incrementar sus ingresos, sus actividades las organiza durante el día. Don Onan, es  casado, vive junto a su esposa y su hijo de un año.
Con el crédito comprara mangos, mandarinas, jocotes, guayabas, pan, pollo, condimentos, tomates, ejotes, bolsas, entre otros implementos para seguir vendiendo sus productos, espera mejorar su economía para no tener dificultades en los pagos del crédito y ofrecer a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
Su visión es ahorrar para mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Onan has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the street.  He starts work at 6am, and finishes at 5pm.  He's been in this line of work for 2 years.  He also goes out to sell bread with chicken and beverages in order to increase his income.  He organizes his activities during the day.  Onan is married, and he lives with his wife and their one  year-old child.

With this loan, Onan will buy mangos, tangerines, plums, guavas, bread, chicken, condiments, tomatoes, green beans, bags, and other items so that he can continue selling his products.  He hopes to improve his finances so that he won't have difficulties making his loan payments, and so that he can offer his family a better lifestyle.  His plan is to save so that he can make some improvements to his house.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables and other items

loans.name: Mifta

texts.en:
Mifta runs a small stall selling snacks, groceries and mobile phone airtime credits. Mifta lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta.  Mifta is married and lives with five people in the family house.

Mifta began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payments transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, assorted drinks, and fruit to expand her business.

loans.name: Suherman

texts.en:
Suherman runs a small stall selling snacks, groceries and mobile phone airtime credits. Suherman lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta.  Suherman is married and lives with two people in the family house.

Suherman began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Cebu Group

texts.en:
Lucila is the featured borrower of Cebu group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua because they trust each other since they came from the Philippines to work hard for their living.

Lucila is a 44-year-old married mother of one child who works as a housekeeper to provide her beloved family with the necessary standard of living. Today, she is applying for her second loan to send to her family back in the Philippines to pay for her child's education fees, exactly for the same reason she requested the previous loan. She has a pay back history in good standing. 
. 
She is the first lady standing at the far left side of the picture. The other group members are Rhoda, who is at the center and Annabelle, who is the first from the right.

loans.use: To pay for her child's education fees

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a 36-year-old single woman. She has one child who is 7 years old. She describes herself to be humble and determined. 

She operates a M-pesa business where she offers mobile phone-based money transfer services. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are of all types. 

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to add M-pesa float, i.e money for customers to withdraw. 

Her business goal is to have more M-pesa shops within five years. She hopes that in the future she will get additional income. 

This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of kes 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to add M-pesa float, i.e money for customers to withdraw

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a single mother of three children; all her children go to school. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees. 

She has had a dry cleaning business for 5 years. She doesn’t have any other income generating activity. 

Jane works from home seven days out of every week, and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges includes on-and-off electricity, and the rainy season, which hinders her clothes drying. 

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more powdered, liquid and bars of soap, and an electric flat iron. 

Jane aspires to own washing machines, and also to become a prominent dry cleaner. 

She decided to join MCDT SACCO because of the low interest charged.

loans.use: To buy more powdered, liquid and bars of soap, and an electric flat iron.

loans.name: Anani Mesulam

texts.es:
La socia Anani Mesulam se dedica al negocio de venta de boletos turisticos a las diferentes personas del extranjero y tambien perosnas nacionales,la socia vende boletos para diferentes lugares como machupicchu y valle sagrado,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener una agencia de viajes.La socia solicita le credito para comprar boletos turisticos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Anani Mesulam works at her business selling tourist tickets to various foreigners and locals. She sells tickets for different places, like Machu Picchu and Valle Sagrado (The Sacred Valley of the Incas). She works from 8:00 a.m. to 5 p.m. Anani Mesulam has been in this business for 5 years, and it's going very well for her. Her dream is to have a travel agency. She is requesting the loan in order to buy tourist tickets. She is happy for the loan, and is committed to complying with the loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase tourist tickets.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be energetic and hardworking. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using a tuk tuk. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be theft and breakdowns. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy a new motorcycle. His business goal is to be prosperous within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will achieve his business goals. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a new tuk tuk.

loans.use: buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking vegetables, rice and cooking seasons to expand her business.

loans.name: Tito Salvador

texts.es:
Tito, es casado, tiene 38 años de edad y su esposa cuenta con 30 años de edad, son padres de dos hijos de 7 y 2 años de edad, aprendió de una tía a vender ropa, actualmente e lo desempeña por cuenta propia, trabaja de lunes a sábado.
Invertirá en la compra de chores, vestidos, blusas, vestidos, trajes para niños y niñas, ropa interior, etc., con piezas surtidas en nuevos estilos, colores y tallas, su negocio dará respuesta de inmediato a los gustos de los clientes, espera aprovechar la temporada de vacaciones para vender mucho más y tener mejores ganancias.
Su objetivo es fortalecer más su negocio y ofrecer mejora calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Tito is married and is 38 years old. His wife is 30. They are the parents of two children ages 7 and 2 years. He learned about selling clothing from an aunt, and he currently does it on his own. He works from Monday to Saturday.

He will invest in the purchase of shorts, dresses, blouses, outfits for boys and girls, underwear, etc., with pieces stocked in new styles, colors and sizes. His business will respond immediately to his customers' tastes. He hopes to take advantage of the vacation season in order to sell much more and have better earnings. His objective is to strengthen his business and offer a better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to purchase shorts, dresses, blouses, outfits for boys and girls, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Wahyu

texts.en:
Wahyu runs a small stall selling snacks, groceries and mobile phone airtime credits. Wahyu lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta.  Wahyu is married and lives with two people in the family house.

Wahyu began working with Ruma one month ago because he wanted to increase his income.  He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business runs, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a dairy farmer who lives in the Kitale area of North rift and has 1 child of school going age. She has undertaken farming for 4 years with her primary income being milk, eggs, crops, and a retail business. In farming, she enjoys dairy farming as you can see in her photo with her dairy cow. Her biggest challenge is rearing of her sick animals.

Emily chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because of their quick processing of client loans. During the training, she learned about proper dairy farming. With this loan, she will construct a zero grazing unit for her dairy cows so that they will produce more milk which will result to more income and an improved diet for her family.

loans.use: to construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Icah

texts.en:
Icah runs a small stall selling groceries and mobile phone airtime credits. Icah lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Icah is married and living with four people in the family home. 

Icah began working with Ruma one month ago because she wanted to increase her income.  She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends

loans.use: To process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en:
Gulnora is 40 years old and married. She is bringing up two non-adult children. 

Gulnora sells women's clothes to earn a living; she has been in the business for seven months. She sells clothes in a local market. Gulnora dreams of expanding her business and becoming prosperous in the future. 

She needs a loan to of 5,000 TJS to buy clothes for the new season. 

She will look for your help.

loans.use: to buy clothes for the new season

loans.name: Dúo Maná Group

texts.es:
DUO MANA
Es conformado por doña Micaela de 36 años de edad, desde ya hace varios años se ha dedicado a la venta de ropa para señoras de esta localidad, tales como delantales, cortes, blusas, güipiles, suéteres, etc. También ahora logro aprender un nuevo  oficio en la elaboración de blusas casuales para mujeres, gracias a que ella tiene a muchas personas conocidas ellas logra la venta de estas prendas tanto en las que hace como las que solo revende, su mercadería en su mayoría lo trae del municipio de Totonicapán de donde ella es originaria, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de ropa para la venta.
texts.en:
Duo Mana was founded by Ms. Micaela.  She is 36 years of age.  For the past several years, she has been selling clothing for ladies of her town, such as aprons, shorts, shirts, blouses, sweaters, etc..

Also now she has learned a new trade in making casual blouses for women.  Because she has many acquaintances, she is able to sell these clothes as well as those she only resells. The majority of her goods she sells in Totonicapán township where she is from,

The purpose of this loan is to buy clothes for sale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for sale.

location.town: Aldea Cruz Blanca San Juan Sacatepequez

loans.name: Mafanikio Group

texts.en:
Tatu is aged in her late twenties and is still single. For three years now, Tatu has been managing a business of electronic money transfer (M-Pesa). She starts servicing people at 8 am until 9 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her third loan request, which she will use to recharge her vault to service more people. With her previous loans, all of which have been paid back successfully, she recharged her M-Pesa vault. Tatu earned a profit that she used to cover her own welfare. She dreams of opening a shop to sell clothes and CDs. 

She will share this loan with her loan group Mafanikio that totals four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to recharge her vault to service more people.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine is married with six children, five of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a butchery business and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 900,000 UGX from MCDTSACCO to buy more cattle for slaughtering. She generates additional income from selling soft drinks. She works at the market seven days of every week and sells on a retail basis only.  Her major business challenges include transportation and Kampala capital city authority law enforcement officers. She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler of beef, and also to own a delivery van to ease the transportation. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for slaughtering for her butchery business.

loans.name: Morris

texts.en:
Morris is a 48-year-old married man; he has four children. He describes himself to be ambitious. 

Morris operates a tailoring shop where he makes clothes to sell. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are walk in's and permanent customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be seasonal changes. 

He will use the Kes 110,000 loan to buy fabric, thread, and other materials for making clothes. 

His business goal is to have a tailoring school within five years. He hopes that in the future he will educate his children to the highest level.

This is his fifth loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to grow the business and take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and other materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 48-year-old tailor at Barsheba, Mombasa, Kenya. She is a married mother of four whose spouse provides additional income; she has been in this business for the last 15 years.

This marks her third borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. 

She will use the loan to purchase an embroidery machine for her workshop, and the anticipated profits will be used to educate her children and repay her loan. 

She hopes to own a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an embroidery machine

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a 45-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be determined and sincere. 

Thomas operates a retail business where he sells electronics. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of funds to expand business. 

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of electronics. 

His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be happy. This is his sixth loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of electronics.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 42-year-old married woman; she has two children. She describes herself to be determined. 

Rose operates a retail business where she sells milk and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of enough milk to sell. 

This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to purchase more milk to sell. 

Her business goal is to expand within five years. Rose hopes that in the future she will have improved living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more milk to sell

loans.name: Vigilance

texts.en:
Vigilance is 22 years old and resides in Mwenezi District, Zimbabwe with her husband. She is a member of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network and assists other Cama members with their studies. Vigilance is also a Camfed Learner Guide who volunteers in local schools offering life and leadership skills to students. 

In addition, Vigilance runs a take-away food stand where she sells items such as sadza (cooked cornmeal as shown in the picture), drinks, rice, chips and tea. She has been running this business for the past four months, and it has enabled her to support her family.  

With the Kiva loan, Vigilance will purchase bigger pots and more plates to expand her business.  Her hope is that she will one day have more take-away stands that she can use to support her family and vulnerable children in the community. She also wants to continue with her education.

loans.use: to puchase bigger pots and more plates

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods for her shop

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is a Cameroonian. She is 40 years old, and married with five children; the oldest is 14 in secondary school, while the youngest is 4 in nursery school. She has been in this business for over eight years, which makes her very experienced, and her business stable. Her business is likely to succeed, because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will be used to increase her profits by thirty percent.

loans.use: to buy material to sew clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia is a 24-year-old businesswoman, who lives with her grandmother in Mwenezi District, Zimbabwe, where she has been running a poultry business since June 2013. When she is not with her fowl run, she volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, assisting schools with counseling and guidance to keep students in school.  With the Kiva loan, Sophia will buy more broiler chicks so that she can rear 500 broilers per circle. She also wants to pay school fees for her brother, continue with school, and create employment for her community.

loans.use: to buy more broiler chicks.

loans.name: Dúo San Vicente Pacaya Group

texts.es:
Dúo San Vicente Pacaya
Vitalino tiene 43 años de edad, es casado, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales todos tienen su propia familia, el se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan por las mañanas y por la tarde mientras su esposa atiende en el local que alquila, el distribuye el pan ambulantemente en las aldeas cerca de su domicilio, el anhela comprar una motocicleta para que la distribución de su mercadería sea más fácil,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mercaderia para la elaboracion y venta de pan.
texts.en:
Dúo San Vicente Pacaya 

Vitalino is 43 years old and married. He has six children, all of whom have their own families. Vitalino makes and sells bread in the mornings and in the afternoons he goes out to sell the bread in the small villages close to where he lives, while his wife remains at the store they rent. He wants to buy a motorcycle so that he can more easily distribute his merchandise. He is requesting this loan in order to purchase merchandise for making and selling bread.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for making and selling bread

loans.name: Maria Sonia

texts.es: María tiene 45 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su pequeño hijo de 17 años de edad quien se encuentra estudiando. María es una mujer con espíritu emprendedor quien junto a su cuñado han logrado establecer un  pequeño negocio de carpintería en el cual elaboran variedad de muebles tal como se muestra en la fotografía.  Este negocio es muy importante dado que es la única fuente de ingresos con la cuenta por lo que su deseo es mantenerlo activo por mucho más tiempo y así seguir dando a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Por lo anterior a tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su negocio y así comprar la metería prima necesaria como: madera, pegamentos, pinturas, barniz y clavos. Espera poder aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos así como mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su querido hijo.
texts.en:
Maria is 45 years old and lives in her own house with her young 17-year-old son, who is studying. Maria is an enterprising woman who, together with her brother-in-law, has managed to establish a small furniture shop. They make a variety of furniture, as shown in the photograph. This business is very important since it is the only source of income she has, which is why she wishes to keep it going for a long time and thereby continue to give her family better living conditions. For this reason, she made the decision to request this loan from FUSAI in order to invest in her business and buy the necessary raw materials, such as wood, adhesive, paint, varnish, and nails.

She hopes to be able to increase her sales and her earnings so that she can improve her living conditions and those of her beloved son.

loans.use: to buy wood, adhesive, paint, varnish, and nails

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is married with two children, both of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling fried chicken, and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more chickens for frying. She works from home seven days of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to become a wholesaler, and also to start rearing chickens. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more chicken for resale.

loans.name: Dúo Raquel Group

texts.es: Dúo Raquel La señora María Margarita de 33 años de edad quien tiene una tortillería desde hace 3 años, necesita comprar maíz por quintales, también necesita comprar cilindros de gas propano porque uno solo no le alcanza.  Con el préstamo que está pidiendo comprara lo que le falta maíz y gas propano y leña por carga, esperando que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: 33-year-old Maria Margarita has had a tortilla bakery for three years. She needs to buy quintals of maize. She also needs to buy propane gas cylinders because just one is not enough. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy what she needs, such as maize, propane gas, and loads of firewood. She is hoping that you can help her with the loan she has requested.

loans.use: to buy maize, propane gas, and firewood

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
La socia Florencia se dedica al negocio de venta de leche,la socia lleva a diferentes tiendas de abarrotes,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de abarrotes.La socia soliciat el credito para comprar leche al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Florencia makes a living by selling milk. She takes it to different grocery stores. She works from 8am until 7pm. She has had this business for several years and it is going very well for her. Florencia’s dream is to have a grocery store. She is requesting the loan in order to buy milk wholesale. She is happy about getting the loan and is committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy milk wholesale

loans.name: Luis Leonidas

texts.es:
El socio Luis Leonidas se dedica al negocio de venta de boletos turísticos a las diferentes personas del extranjero y tambien personas nacionales, el socio vende boletos para diferentes lugares como machupicchu y valle sagrado,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5 p.m,el socio ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es tener una agencia de viajes.El socio solicita le crédito para comprar boletos turisticos.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Luis Leonidas makes a living by selling tourist passes to people from different countries and also to people from other parts of the country. He sells passes to different places, such as Machu Picchu and Valle Sagrado (Sacred Valley of the Incas). He works from 8am until 5pm. He has been doing this for five years and it is going very well for him. Luis’ dream is to have a travel agency. He is requesting the loan in order to purchase tourist passes.

He is happy about getting the loan and is committed to making his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy tourist passes

loans.name: Linet

texts.en: Linet is a 31-year-old, single woman. She has one child who is four years old. She describes herself to be determined and focused. She operates a retail business where she sells beauty products and hair weaves. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be power blackouts. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy hair weaves and beauty products. Her business goal is to have a bigger shop with more diversification of products within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her child. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy hair weaves and beauty products.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy lives in Kakamega. Kakamega County is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rainforest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas, and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, makes Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping.

Kennedy is married and has five children. He is a retired salesman. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for 25 years now, and they are currently growing horticultural crops, maize, beans, and bananas, as well as keeping dairy cattle, goats, fish and bees on their farm. Kennedy is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn him some income, and provide him with honey for medicine.

This is Kennedy’s first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his children. Kennedy’s hope for the future is to start an agro-vet business.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Salwah Group

texts.en:
Haifa is the featured borrower of Salwah Group. She joined with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends.  Haifa is a    56-year-old, widowed mother of six children, for whom she is the sole breadwinner, since her husband passed away. Haifa has run a small convenience store since 2004.  She is well known in her region with special products, and prices she sets to attract new customers, and fulfill her customers’ needs.  She works hard to increase her business merchandise with special offer products that attract customers’ attention, and increase her income.

Haifa is acquiring her first loan cycle from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, which she will use to increase her business merchandise with special spring and summer beverages, ice cream and soft drinks.
She is the lady at the center of the picture. As for the other group members, Nivine is the lady at the left, and Salwa is the lady at the right.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with special spring and summer beverages, ice cream and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes, bags and shoes.

loans.name: Dúo Tejar2 Group

texts.es:
DUO TEJAR 2
La señora Maria Magdalena de 36 años, casada,  desde hace 6 años posee una Tienda  ubicada en el Socobal Chimaltenango, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella  ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de doña Maria es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a FAPE; con el préstamo quiere comprar productos de consumo diario  para seguir creciendo con su tienda.
texts.en:
"The 2nd Tejar Duo"
Maria Magdalena is 36 years old and married. She has had her own store, located in the Socobal neighborhood of Chimaltenango, for the past 6 years. Through hard work she managed to build and improve her home, and through her business she has also supported her family and helped them get ahead. Her dream is to improve the quality of life for her family, through the loan she is requesting from FAPE. She will use this loan to purchase daily consumables to continue growing her store.

loans.use: to purchase consumables which she will then sell.

loans.name: Dúo Solidaridad Group

texts.es:
Dúo Solidaridad

Formado por Doris Marleny de 28 años de edad se dedica a la crianza de animales de granja como lo son pollos, Gallinas, pavos, patos y vacas. Este el primer crédito que solicita, El sueño de ella es invertir en sus negocio y así obtener más ganancia para poder ayudar a su familia a darle lo que necesitan y confían en que Kiva le pueda ayudar para lograr sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
"Solidarity Duo"
Doris Marleny is a member of "Solidarity Duo". She is 28 years old and she raises farm animals such as roosters, chickens, ducks, turkeys and cows. This is the first loan she has requested. Her dream is to invest in her business and thereby generate higher earnings to be able to help her family and give them what they need. She trusts that Kiva will be able to help her reach her dreams and goals.

loans.use: to purchase animals to raise.

loans.name: Zilola

texts.en: Zilola was born in 1986. She is married and is bringing up a child. Her husband is a master of repairing houses. Zilola began her business of selling raisins. She buys raisins in bulk and sells them in a local market. She runs her business well. Now, Zilola is going to increase her working capital. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 TJS, to buy raisins for increasing working capital of new business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy raisins for her new business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a hair dryer and hair products

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 28 year old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 8 years. She describes herself as patient. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes and shoes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insecurity. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes and shoes. Her business goal is to have 3 more stores within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan of kes 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes and shoes

loans.name: Silethiwe

texts.en:
Silethiwe is a 29-year-old businesswoman from Mwenezi District, Zimbabwe. As a divorced mother of three children, Silethiwe works hard to provide for her family and give back to her community. Over the last year, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing about 180 broiler birds every six weeks and selling them to the local residents. She started the business last year because she wanted to be financially independent and saw that the poultry industry was profitable in her community. 
 
Silethiwe would very much like to increase her sales and become a supplier to major supermarkets. In order to accomplish this goal, she will use the Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production. This will enable Silethiwe to provide an education for her three children, remain financially independent, help those in need, and employ others. To give back to her community, Silethiwe is a Camfed Learner Guide who volunteers her time teaching local students valuable life skills.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy lives close to Kapsabet, in the Kakamega region. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest, and the variety of crops grown in the area, make this an excellent area for beekeeping. 

Sammy is married and has six children. He is a pastor. Both he and his wife practice farming. They have been farming for twenty seven years now and they are currently growing tea and bananas as well as keeping dairy cattle, fish and bees in their farm. Sammy is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income and provide him with honey for medicine.

This is Sammy’s first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to implement zero grazing in his farm. Sammy’s hope for the future is to live a successful life and see his children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is a 23-year-old woman living in the Umzingwane district of Zimbabwe. She is single and a mother of one child. 

She is in the business of buying and selling clothes and shoes. Her business is running very well, although sometimes she faces economic challenges. 

To give back to her community, Sharon also volunteers as a Learner Guide at a nearby school where she teaches students valuable life skills. 

There is little competition at the moment in the business, so there are higher possibilities that she will succeed. If she gets the Kiva loan, she wishes to increase her purchases of clothes and shoes. If her business grows very well, she wishes to help students who face challenges in paying fees.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and more shoes.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben lives in Kapsabet, in the Kakamega region. Kakamega County is located in Western Kenya and is famous for having the only tropical rain forest in the country. Most farmers in Kakamega grow maize, but sugarcane, papaya, bananas, and tea are also popular crops. The variety of crops grown in the region, as well as the abundance of vegetation in the old growth forest, make Kakamega particularly attractive for beekeeping. 

Reuben is married and has two children. Both he and his wife are teachers. They also practice farming where they keep poultry as well as grow maize and vegetables in their farm. They have been farming for five years now. Reuben is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income, provide him with honey for medicine, and also because beekeeping is an enterprise that is easy to manage.

This is Reuben’s first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to buy more beehives. Reuben’s hope for the future is to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Edwin Claros

texts.es: Edwin tiene 37 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus tres hijos de 18 años, 14 años y 12 años de edad. Edwin es un hombre trabajador quien con mucho esfuerzo ha  logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Es un hombre emprendedor quien no teme recorrer las principales zonas de su localidad para ofrecer y promocionar sus productos. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la venta de productos de cocina como: variedad de ollas y cacerolas. Es así como se gana la vida por lo que considera necesario invertir en su negocio con el fin de abarcar un mayor número de clientes y así poder aumentar sus ventas e ingresos que le permitan mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de variedad de artículos de cocina como ollas y cacerolas de acero inoxidable y teflon, y productos de plástico, etc.
texts.en: Edwin is 37 years old and lives in his own house with his three children who are 18, 14 and 12 years old. Edwin is a hard working man who, with a lot of effort, has managed to get his family ahead. He is an enterprising man who is not afraid to walk through the main areas of his town to offer and promote his products. For many years he has been dedicated to selling cooking products like a variety of pots and casseroles. In this way he has earned a living for which he feels it is necessary to invest in his business with the goal of reaching a greater number of customers and thus expanding his sales and income which will allow him to improve his and his family's living conditions. For the above, he is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of a variety of cooking items such as stainless steel and teflon pots and casseroles and plastic products, etc.

loans.use: to buy stainless steel and teflon pots and casseroles and plastic products for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers to tend to his coffee crops.

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres Vencedoras Group

texts.es:
Dúo Mujeres Vencedoras
Dúo conformado por Roselia se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos ella es originaria de san Martin Jilotepeque. Este es el tercer crédito que solicita han sido responsable, Solicita el crédito para invertir más en sus negocios, para comprar materia prima para sus tejidos y tener un mejor ingreso de ganancias.
texts.en: Dúo Mujeres Vencedoras (Conquering Women Duo) is a duo made by Roselia who is dedicated to making typical woven crafts. She is a native of San Martin Jilotepeque. This is the third loan she has requested. She has been responsible. She is requesting this loan to invest more in her businesses to buy raw material for her weaves and have better income.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make and sell typical woven crafts.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant,el socio vende diferentes platos como pollo al horno y sopas,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de restaurant.El socio solicita el credito pra comprar pollo,carne y verduras para el restaurant.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues to be dedicated to his restaurant business. He sells different dishes like baked chicken and soups. He works from 8AM until 6PM. He has had this business for seven years and it is going very well. His dream is to expand the restaurant. He is requesting the loan to buy chicken, meat, and vegetables for the restaurant.

He is happy about the loan and promises to make his repayments.

loans.use: to buy chicken, meat and vegetables for his restaurant.

loans.name: Nora Lilia

texts.es:
Nora es una mujer pujante y trabajadora, que se dedica a atender su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes donde ofrece todo tipo de productos de la canasta familiar. Continuó con el negocio desde hace 15 años, luego del fallecimiento de su padre, quien era el propietario, dejando atrás su vida como religiosa; trabaja sola todos los días desde las primeras horas de la mañana y tiene la ventaja de ser reconocida en la zona por su amplia trayectoria en el mercado.
El crédito solicitado es un apoyo para cancelar las facturas a proveedores y fortalecer su inventario comprando galletería, cigarrillos, entre otros; esto le permitirá mantener su crédito abierto para seguir surtiendo con más productos y ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes y satisfacer los diversos gustos y necesidades; esto se reflejará en el incremento de las ventas y por ende, en los ingresos que percibe por su labor.
Nora manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es darle continuidad al establecimiento, ofreciendo cada día un mejor servicio y nuevos productos a sus clientes, así tendrá mayor estabilidad económica y podrá disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nora is a strong and hard working woman who is dedicated to managing her own business, a grocery store where she offers all types of products from the family basket. She continued with the business for fifteen years after the death of her father who was the owner, leaving behind his religious life. She works every day from the early morning hours and has the advantage of being recognized in the area for her expansive path in the market.

The loan requested is support to pay her suppliers' invoices and strengthen her inventory by buying cookies, cigarettes, among other items. This will allow her to maintain her credit open to keep stocking with more products and offer a great variety and satisfy the different tastes and needs. This will be reflected in the increase in sales and, in the end, in income that she receives from her work.

Nora says that her greatest desire is to continue the business offering better service and new products every day to her customers, and will thus have greater economic stability and will be able to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to pay suppliers's invoices and beef up her inventory by buying cookies, cigarettes, among other items.

loans.name: Maritza De La Concepcion

texts.es: Doña Maritza, con su afan de terminar su vivienda, trabaja muy duro para poder cumplir su sueño, actualmente esta construyendo la parte de la cocina, donde tendra mayor espacio, mejor higiene. el credito lo solicita para comprar, cemento, arena, azulejos, bondex, etc. agradece nueva el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le estan brindando con este Financiamiento
texts.en:
Maritza wants to finish her house and she works very hard to be able to reach her goal.  Currently, she is building part of the kitchen so she will have more space and better hygiene.  The loan she is requesting is to buy cement, sand, tiles, bondex, etc.

She is grateful once again for this show of support from Kiva and Afodenic through new financing.

loans.use: To buy construction materials.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a forty-four-year-old married mother of four children who has been running her own clothes selling business since 2009. She has fifteen years of experience in this domain. Rana used to work as a tailor, with a special talent in this domain which makes things easier for her to develop her current business.

Today she is acquiring her first loan cycle from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. With it, she wishes to grow her merchandise with newly released spring and summer collections that will develop her business and attract customer attention. She is very anxious about this loan and hopes that in the future she will keep on developing and expanding her business in a well-managed way, in order to start a wholesale trade business.

loans.use: To grow her business merchandise with newly released spring and summer collections

loans.name: Edward Rogelio

texts.es:
El socio Edward Rogelio se dedica al negocio de venta de materiales de construccion como cemento,ladrillos y pinturas,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de materiales de construccion.El socio solicita el credito para comprar ladrillos,cementos y pinturas.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Edward Rogelio sells construction materials such as cement, bricks and pain.  He works from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. and has been in business for five years, and it is going very well for him.

His dream is to increase sales of construction materials so he is requesting a loan to buy bricks, cement and paint.  He is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy bricks, cement and paint.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis lives in Kitale. Kitale is located in the Trans-Nzoia district of western Kenya. Originally dominated by English settlers in the early 20th century, the region’s farmland was redistributed after independence. This left Trans-Nzoia, one of Kenya’s most cosmopolitan areas, with individuals from a variety of linguistic and ethnic groups living in close proximity. The lush soil of the region ensures that farmers can grow a variety of crops including maize, sunflower, sugar cane, millet and beans. Kitale is located near Mount Elgon, East Africa's oldest and largest solitary extinct volcano, which with its substantial forest cover makes Kitale a high-potential beekeeping region.

Francis is married and has ten children. He runs a transport business. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for thirty years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, sugarcane, bananas and an orchard. They also rear livestock on their farm. Francis is excited about beekeeping as it will provide him with honey for food and medicine.

This is Francis’ first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to save for his retirement. Francis’ hope for the future is for his family to be stable.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Amam

texts.en: Amam is thirty-five year old lady. She is energetic and has been stitching clothes for many years. Her customers are the people in her community. She uses the income to support her family. However, due to a lack of available funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 with Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues and generating a healthier income. She is in her third loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors, along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel lives close to Kapsabet, in the Kakamega region. Kakamega county is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rainforest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugar cane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest and the variety of crops grown in the area make this an excellent area for beekeeping. 

Joel is married and has one child. He is a civil servant. Both he and his wife practice farming. They have been farming for ten years now and are currently growing tea and maize and rearing dairy cattle in their farm. Joel is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income, provide him with honey for medicine and the bees will help in pollinating his crops.

This is Joel’s first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to buy more beehives and implement zero grazing livestock in his farm. Joel’s hope for the future is to increase his milk production and prosper in his farming.

loans.use: To buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production

loans.name: Ana Cristian

texts.es: Ana habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus tres hijas de 16 años, 11 años y 8 años de edad quienes se encuentran estudiando. Ana es una mujer trabajadora, visionaria y responsable. Ella trabaja como empleada en un colegio cercano a su localidad y además ha logrado poner un pequeño negocio de pasteles en su hogar de habitación el cual le permite ajustar los ingresos necesarios para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia.Con el fin de hacer crecer su negocio y llegar a más clientes ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de utensilios, moldes, una batidora, etc. De esta forma espera mejorar sus ventas así como sus ingresos que le permitan mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana lives in her own house with her husband and three daughters, ages 16, 11 and 8 who attend school.  Ana is a hard worker, a visionary and responsible.  She works as an employee of a school near her town and also runs a small bakery business out of her home.  This allows her to earn income to cover household needs.

In order to grow her business and reach more customers, she has decided to request a loan through FUSAI to buy utensils, molds, a mixer, etc.  This is so she can increase sales and income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy utensils, molds, a mixer, etc.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a forty-three-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from three to nine. She describes herself to be honest and trustworthy. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows which produce milk to sell. She also grows and sells cabbages, tomatoes and onions. She has been involved in this business for nine years. Her business is located in a business-friendly area and her primary customers are old and loyal. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. She will use the KES 95,000 loan to buy animal feeds, seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. Her business goal is to yield high returns within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will open a dairy shop and sell dairy products. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan of KES 80,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy animal feeds, seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm supplies and fertilizers for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is a 32-year-old married woman with six children. She has sold milk for the past six years. She has two milk buffaloes. She sells milk to many of her neighbors along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is doing well enough to enable her to lead a decent life. 

Sajida is very motivated to provide her children with a beautiful life along with a good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the daily expenses of life. 

This is her seventh year with the Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through the support of the foundation. Now she has requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo. Sajida hopes to increase her production capacity for milk, which will ultimately help her generate more income.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Aminah

texts.en:
Aminah is married with three children, all of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members such as her younger sister. She has a business selling used shoes and has been in this business for five years. 

Aminah has applied for a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of shoes. She works at the market six days a week and sells on a retail basis only. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality, fires and high taxes. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to shift from selling in the market to a shop. She resides in the family's house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Nawab

texts.en:
Nawab, age 33, is a married woman. She has a business selling animals. She buys baby goats at low prices,rears them for a year or two, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family's income. 

Nawab needs to improve her business to to meet the cost of her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted the Kashf Foundation and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more baby goats. 

Nawab is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will expand her business and increase her income level. She is in her fourth loan cycle and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats.

loans.name: Leonor De Los Angeles

texts.es: Leonor tiene 20 años de edad y habita en casa alquilada junto a su grupo familiar y su madre depende de ella económicamente. Leonor tiene una tortillería  desde hace 5 años aproximadamente. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y lleva el sustentos a su hogar. Leonor es una joven emprendedora quien tiene muchos deseos de superarse y dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los insumos necesarios para el negocio de tortillas como: maíz, cal, gas propano, etc. Espera  poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder hacer la inversión y llegar a más clientes que le permita mejorar sus ventas e ingresos.
texts.en: Leonor is 20 years old. She lives in a rented house with her family group and her mother depends on her financially. Leonor has had a tortilla business for approximately 5 years. This is how she earns a living and supports her home. Leonor is a young entrepreneur who is very eager to get ahead and give her family better living conditions. To do this she is asking FUSAI for this loan to invest in buying the materials she needs for the business, such as corn, lime, propane gas, etc. She hopes to be able to have this loan and thus be able to make the investment and have more customers that will allow her to improve her sales and her income.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, propane gas. etc.

loans.name: Neftali

texts.es:
Neftalí  tiene   26 años,  él es un joven trabajador que vive con su madre y otras hermanas, no estudio porque sus papas no tenían los medios necesarios para enviarlo a estudiar, su madre y sus hermanas pequeñas dependen  de   él directamente, él trabaja desde que estaba pequeño , ya que su padre le enseño a trabajar, él se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, trabaja todos los días de seis de la mañana a tres de la tarde, solamente se dedica a esta actividad ya que fue lo único que aprendió.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar abono y semilla para seguir trabajando en la tierra, ya que es su única fuente de empleo que tiene, con respecto a sus sueños él quiere un día construir su casa para que vivan bien sus futuros hijos, también seguir dándole una buena estabilidad económica a su madre hasta donde él pueda.
texts.en:
Neftalí is 26 years old. He is a hardworking young man who lives with his mother and sisters. he didn't go to school because his parents didn't have the means to send him there. His mother and his young sisters depend directly on him. He has worked since he was young because his father taught him to work. He grows basic grains and works every day from six in the morning until three in the afternoon. This is the only activity that he has because it is the only thing he learned.

The loan he is asking CREDICAMPO for is to buy fertilizer and seeds to keep working on the land. It is his only source of employment. as for his dreams, he wants to build a house one day so his future children can live there. He also wants to keep giving his mother financial stability as much as he can.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to keep working on his land.

loans.name: Jalmar Geovanni

texts.es:
Jalmar de 33 años de edad, es bachiller, esta casado; su esposa trabaja en oficios domésticos; tienen dos hijos de los cuales uno estudia. Solamente tres personas dependen de él. El cliente es empleado y tiene un negocio de tamales que lo hace desde hace quince años, los tamales los hacen en casa y se trasladan a la ciudad a comercializarlos y lo hace viajando en bus, se involucra la mamá y una hermana. El horario es de 8:00 am a 8:00 pm. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar maíz, condimentos, frijoles, gallinas, verduras,para el negocio de tamales; le mejorara porque puede comprar para dar un mejor servicio a los clientes, y así poder tener mejores ingresos económicos y así una mejor calidad de vida.

 La necesidad satisfecha es darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Sus sueños son poder crecer en el negocio y así ofrecer diferentes clases de tamales y en cuanto a su familia que estudien y se preparen académicamente; esto le ayudara porque puede comprar los productos para su negocio, las ganancias las utiliza para su familia y para ir pagando el préstamo y así quedar bien con Credicampo, para que siga confiando en él como cliente y así seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Jalmar is 33 years old. He is a high school graduate and he is married, His wife takes care of the home and they have two children, one of whom is in school. Only three people depend on him. He is employed and has had a tamale business for fifteen years. He makes the tamales at home and transports them to the city to sell them by bus. His mother and a sister are involved in the business. His schedule is from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. 

The loan he is asking for is to buy corn, seasonings, beans, chicken, and vegetables for the tamale business. This will improve it because he can buy enough to give his customers a better service. This way, he will have better income and a better quality of life.

He needs to give his customers a better service. His dream is for his business to grow and offer different types of tamales. For his family. he wants them to go to school and become educated. This will help him be able to buy products for his business. He will use the income for his family and to pay off the loan and look good to Credicampo so they will continue to put their trust in him as a client and he can continue to work.

loans.use: to buy corn, seasoning, beans, chickens, and vegetables for his tamale business.

loans.name: Ana Alicia

texts.es:
Ana de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta 9º grado, esta acompañada, su pareja trabaja de vendedor en una ferretería; tienen tres hijos de los cuales dos son menores de edad y estudian básica y bachillerato y la tercera hija esta acompañada y tiene su propio hogar. 

Ana posee un negocio de bebidas, se ha dedicado a este negocio por unos cinco años, lo hizo por iniciativa propia y decidió dedicarse a este negocio porque antes vendía verduras en el mercado y debido a su trabajo no les dedicaba el tiempo necesario a sus hijos y es por eso que decidió cambiar de negocio, el negocio lo tiene en su casa, además se involucra su compañero de vida, su horario es de 2:00 pm a 7:00 pm. 

Con el préstamo comprara mas producto para surtir el cafetin y por lo tanto le generara mayor ingreso económico y por consiguiente tendrá una vida mejor. La necesidad satisfecha es que pueda comprar al mayoreo.  Sus sueños son poder tener un cafetin bien surtido con productos y que sus hijos estudien y se preparen; el préstamo le ayudara mucho porque puede comprar por mayoreo y así tener mejores ganancias y las ganancias las utiliza para sus hijos y para ir pagando el préstamo y así responderle muy bien a Credicampo para que le siga prestando para su negocio.
texts.en:
Ana is 41 years old. She went to school through the 9th grade. She is married and her spouse works as a salesman in a hardware store. They have three children. Two are in elementary and high school and the third is married and has her own home. 

Ana has a beverage business. She has worked at this business for about five years. She did this on her own initiative and she decided to work at this business because before she sold vegetables in the market. That work didn't leave her enough time to be with her children, so she decided to change businesses. She has her cafe in her house and her life's companion works there too. Her schedule is from 2:00 p.m. to 7:00 p.m. 

With the loan, she will buy more products to stock her cafe and therefore generate more income and have a better life. This will fulfill her need to buy wholesale. Her dream is to have a well stocked cafe and for her children to go to school and become educated. The loan will really help her because she can buy wholesale and thus have better profits. She will use them for her children and to pay off the loan and thus look good to Credicampo so they will keep lending to her for her business.

loans.use: to buy products for her cafe.

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es: Maria Elsa, mayor de edad, casada con dos hijos mayores de edad, originaria del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial, turística, Maria Elsa es una mujer que ha venido luchando día a día para salir adelante, su negocio consiste en la comercialización al por mayor de especies como: canela, incienso, manzanilla, anelina, azulilo salsas de tomates, vinagres, clavo de olor, anís, pimienta gorda y flaca, entre otros, semanalmente compra al por mayor en otro municipio al contado, lo que posteriormente empaca por docenas y vende al por mayor a pulperias y comidieras de este municipio ya son varios años de dedicarse a este negocio, el cual lo realiza de forma ambulante en las diferentes comarcas de  municipios, inca su jornada diaria desde muy temprano por lo que se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora, responsable, carismática, El objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar especies al por mayor y aprovechar las ventas, y así tener suficientes variedades de productos que  ofrecer a sus clientes. María Elsa agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos  y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Maria Elsa is an adult, married and has two grown children. she is from the municipality of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country. It is an area characterized as commercial and touristy. Maria Elsa is a woman who has fought day to day to get ahead. Her business is selling spices wholesale, such as cinnamon, incense, chamomile, Chilean blue crocus, ketchups, vinegars, cloves, anise, allspice, pepper, and more. Every week, she buys wholesale in another city in the county. Later she packs it into dozens and sells wholesale to stores and eateries in the town. She has been doing this for several years and she does it as a street vendor in the different parts of the municipalities. She starts her day very early and is described as a very entrepreneurial, responsible and charismatic woman. The purpose of this loan is to invest in working capital and buy spices wholesale and take advantage of the sales. This way, she will have enough variety of product to offer her customers. María Elsa is grateful for the help given by the Kiva investors to people of low income and poor countries such as Nicaragua, in order for them to have dignified work.

loans.use: to buy spices such as cinnamon, peppers, sauces, anise, camomile and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilisers, manure and anti-insect chemicals for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Jose Ancelmo

texts.es: Jose de 41 años de edad vive junto a su familia en casa propia, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; el necesita invertir por eso le solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semillas, insecticida, herbicida, etc. Jose tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: José is 41 years old and lives in his own house with his family. José makes a living growing corn and has now been working in farming for a number of years. This has given him a lot of experience, allowing him to grow the best harvests. José sells his products in the areas around his community. He has many customers who prefer José for the high quality, affordable prices and, above all, the good service. José needs to invest in his business and so is applying for a loan that will allow him to buy seeds, anti-insect chemical, weed-killers and more. José has a good credit rating from acquaintances and is very responsible. He assures us that he will be able to pay off his loan within the established time frame and is also confident that he will be able to bring more financial stability to his household.

loans.use: to buy seeds, weed-killers, anti-insect chemicals and other goods.

loans.name: Hector Eduardo

texts.es: Hector de 44 años de edad es muy amable y trabajador, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maíz; sus productos son de muy buena calidad, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia. Hector solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga, fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita y mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografía apara realizar sus siembras, él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Hector is 44 years old and very friendly and hard-working. He lives in his own house with his family. Hector works very hard on his plot of land, where he grows corn. Hector's products are of very high quality. He sells his goods in the different markets near to his home. Hector is applying for this loan from "Apoyo Integral" in order to have the necessary capital to invest in farming supplies such as anti-plague treatments, manure, seeds and other items that he needs to improve the land (shown in the photograph) and to sow his crops. Hector is anxious to increase his slaes in order to earn higher profits and offer his family more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy anti-disease chemical, fertilisers, manure, seeds and to improve his land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, eggs, coffee, sugar, soup, snacks, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. The man shown in the photo is Naseem’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it functioning. For this reason, Naseem has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires with some spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

Naseem is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires with some spare parts.

loans.name: Yanira De La Paz

texts.es:
Yanira de 34 años de edad,  estudio hasta 5º grado, esta soltera, no tiene hijos solamente una sobrina que vive con ella, la mamá de Yanira y una hermana; pero no dependen de ella porque trabajan todas. Yanira tiene ganado de repasto esto lo hace desde hace dos años, lo aprendió de sus padres y decidió hacerlo para ir formando su propio patrimonio, además ella se dedica al trabajo en casa de empleada domestica, ella no había tenido otro negocio antes; el ganado lo tiene en el terreno de su casa y su lugar de trabajo de oficios domésticos esta como a 2 km de su casa y viaja a pie; con el ganado le ayuda la mamá y una hermana. Su horario es variado. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar una ternera; le ayudara a mejorar porque tendrá mas ganado, así también podrá tener un dinero extra para tener una mejor calidad de vida. La necesidad satisfecha será de poder comprar la ternera de una vez. 


Sus sueños son tener mas ganado y en cuanto a su vida poder casarse y tener su propia familia. El préstamo le ayudara a crecer en su negocio. Las ganancias las utiliza para ayudarle a su mamá y para pagar el préstamo al día para que Credicampo le siga prestando y así seguir trabajando con su negocio.
texts.en:
Yanira is 34 years old and completed up to fifth grade at school. She is single and has no children, but one niece, plus one sister and her mother live with Yanira. However, none of these people depends on Yanira as they all work. Yanira has had grazing cattle for two years, having learned her work from her father and deciding to start this work on her own in order to have her own heritage. Yanira also works as a domestic servant. She did not previously have any other business. Yanira has her cattle on the land at her house. She works as a domestic servant two kilometres from her home and arrives there on foot. Yanira's mother and sister help her with the cattle and she has no fixed timetable.

Yanira is applying for a loan from "Credi Campo" in order to buy a calf. This will help her to be better as she will have more cattle. She will also be able to earn a little extra money to enjoy a better quality of life. Yanira wants to buy the calf in one go.

Yanira's dreams are to have more cattle and to marry and have her own family. This loan will help Yanira to expand her business. She will use her profits to help her mother. She will also use it to pay off her loan on time so that "Credi Campo" will continue lending to her and she will be able to keep on working with her business.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Mirna

texts.en:
Mirna is a 26-year-old married mother of two children who is employed as a secretary in a reputable company for the past four years. She has been working to support her husband and family and cover their family's increasing needs.

Mirna is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to pay for her children's increasing school costs, in addition to making necessary maintenance on her car to keep it in good shape to support her family's needs.

This is Mirna's first experience as an Al Majmoua borrower. She hopes that through her future requests, she will make sure that she can keep on working hard on developing and improving her children's educational level. 

She hopes to keep on developing her family's socioeconomic situation and improve her working career.

loans.use: to pay for her children's increasing school  costs, in addition to fixing her car

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is a 30-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. At present she has three cows and a few goats. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business.

Najma is requesting a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase another cow. This will help her to increase her sales, which will ultimately help in generating more income for her.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 32-year-old married lady and has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. 

Irshad makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked, she requested a loan for PKR 40,000 which she will use to buy stocks of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way she would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. 

Irshad wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Kaniz

texts.en:
Kaniz is a married woman. She has a business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her fifth loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Luce

texts.en:
This is Luce in her northern traditional costume; kindly note that women in this part of Albania dress in such similar costumes, and the majority of villagers here pursue their family traditions. For example, parents often want to pitch in to help pay for their children’s weddings. In Luce’s case, her son’s wedding is coming up. This is why she is applying for a loan. 

Luce has been in the agriculture/livestock business for years now. She’s got pigs and two dairy cows, and she sells the raw milk and baby calves and piglets to the local market. In addition to this, she gets paid for making embroideries to traditional costumes that have been designed by someone else. These traditional costumes are completely handmade; their material is made using a primitive loom and is very colorful, mostly red and purple as shown in the picture.

loans.use: to fillfill their tradition's requirements; to pitch in for her son's weeding

loans.name: Massavo 1’ Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MASSAVO 1’ est composé de trois personnes, qui sont des amies et résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe Cathérine (celle dont la main est levée sur la photo) âgée de 38 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Cathérine est mariée à un conducteur du nom de Amos. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Cathérine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges de la maison. C’est pour cette raison que, Catherine vend des produits vivriers (des céréales) et divers produits (sucre, lait, tapioca) à son domicile depuis vingt ans.
