De façon secondaire, Cathérine vend aussi de la bouillie de maïs fermenté et du tapioca. Cathérine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle, Cathérine ensemble avec les membres du groupe MASSAVO 1’ un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Massavo 1 group is made up of three people who are friends and live in the same area. The representative of the group, Catherine (whose hand is raised in the photo) is 38 years old and has never attended school. She is married to a driver named Amos. The couple has four children, who all go to school and are under their parents' care. Catherine lives together with her husband and children. Together, the couple takes care of the various household expenses.

It is for this reason that Catherine has been selling dried goods (cereals) and other products (sugar, milk, tapioca) from her home for the past twenty years. In addition to this work Catherine also sells fermented bouillie [corn porridge] and tapioca. She procures her goods from a market in Benin.

In order to satisfy her customer's needs, Catherine, together with the other members of the Massavo 1 group, are seeking their second loan with Alide. Their first loan was repaid correctly.

loans.use: to buy cereals, sugar, tapioca, and milk

loans.name: Conquistadoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CONQUISTADORAS” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Adela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de café, venta de jugo de quinua, atención de karaoque, venta de huevos, venta de cosméticos, taller mecánico.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Adela es integrante, ella indica que es el tercer ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio fue un negocio lo aprendio de su madre, ya que desde corta edad ayudo en el negocio; al reunir un capital decide emprender el mismo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz y verduras por mayor) que adquirirá en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella esta casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro que le ofrece la institución y que todas las componentes de su grupo son responsables.
texts.en:
The A.C. "CONQUISTADORAS" [communal association] will begin its seventh cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Patacamaya. The Group is composed of eight members and is directed by an executive board of which Adela is the President. The businesses run by the members of the communal association are diverse and include: food sales, coffee sales, quinoa beverage sales, karaoke center, egg sales, cosmetic sales, and a mechanics workshop.

The credit they are taking will help the small group of micro-entrepreneurs of which Adela is a member. She says that it is her third cycle with Pro Mujer, and that she joined the group through the invitation of a loan officer who visited her house. Currently she has a business that sells prepared foods; it is worth knowing that this is a business she learned from her mother, since from a young age she helped with the business. Once she was able to put together the capital, she decided to start her own business.

The loan will be used to increase her capital (purchase of rice and produce at wholesale) which she will acquire in the markets of the city of El Alto. Later after preparing the food she will sell it in her sales space. This form of work helps her generate income to provide for her family, since she is married with five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the savings that the institution offers her and that all of her group members are responsible.

loans.use: to buy rice and produce at wholesale

loans.name: Quiswara Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “QUISWARA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Teresa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción y venta de papa, tienda de barrio, producción de haba, venta de ganado ovino, tejido de mantas, servicio de construcción, productor de quinua.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Teresa es integrante, ella indica que es el primer ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción de papa; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres, ya que desde corta edad ella ayudo a su familia y así aprendió los procesos de producción.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de semilla por mayor) que adquirirá en las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal association "QUISWARA" will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Patacamaya. It is composed of 9 members and is directed by an executive board of which Teresa is the President. The businesses run by the members of the communal association are diverse and include: production and sales of potatoes, neighborhood store, production of beans, sale of sheep, knitting of blankets, construction services and production of quinoa.

The credit will benefit the group of small micro-entrepreneurs of which Teresa is a member. She says that it is her first cycle with Pro Mujer, and that she joined through the invitation of a loan officer who visited her house. Presently she has a business producing potatoes; it is worth knowing that she learned this business from her parents, since from a young age she helped her family and in this way learned the production processes.

The loan will be used to increase her capital (purchase of seeds at wholesale) which she will acquire in the stores of the city of El Alto and later after production, she will commercialize her product in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate income to provide for her family, since hse lives in a common law marriage and has 7 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the trainings offered by the institution.

loans.use: to buy seeds at wholesale

loans.name: Miraflores De Panamericana Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MIRAFLORES DE PANAMERICANA” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maritza es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de paneros, servicio de albañil, servicio de minibuses, venta de chocolates, venta de detergentes, tienda de barrio, venta de chuño, venta de ropa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maritza es integrante, ella indica que es el tercer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un asesor de la institución que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de chocolate; da a conocer que este negocio fue un negocio lo aprendió de su madre, ya que en la actualidad tiene el mismo negocio, con poco capital inicio hace diez años y en la actualidad sigue trabajando en el mismo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de chocolate por cajas) que adquirirá en las tiendas distribuidoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los préstamos fáciles que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Miraflores de Panamerica" communal bank is beginning its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana regional hub. This group is made up of nine members and is run by a board of directors, of which Maritza is the president. The members' businesses are varied and include selling vegetables, selling bread baskets, construction work, a minibus service, selling chocolate, selling detergent, a neighborhood store, selling freeze-dried potatoes, and selling clothing.

This loan will benefit small business owners such as Maritza. This is her third year with Pro Mujer, which she joined by invitation of an advisor of the institution who visited her at home. She has a business selling chocolate. She learned about this business from her mother, and she now continues to work in the same business which she started ten years ago with little capital. 

She will use this loan to increase her working capital by buying boxes of chocolate from distributors in the city of El Alto. After production, she will make sales in her business space. This type of work allows her to earn an income to sustain her family, as she is married with four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the easy loans which the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy boxes of chocolate.

loans.name: Somtinda Group

texts.fr:
Mme  AGUERATOU  représente le  groupe SOMTINDA. Mariée, elle est mère de 02enfants. Le plus âgé a 10ans et le moins âgés à 03ans. 01 va  à l’école et elle a 02 personnes  en charge.
Mme vend de produits de beauté (mèches, pommades, pagnes etc.) depuis 08 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché. 
Elle veut s’acheter  01 douzaine de pommades, 01douzaine de mèches et 01douzaine de layette.
Elle  veut  épargner et aider à la scolarisation de son enfant avec  ses bénéfices. Mme ambitionne ouvrir une grande boutique.
texts.en:
Agueratou represents the Somtinda group. She is married and is the mother of two children. The eldest child is 10 years old and the youngest is three years old. One of the children goes to school and she has two [additional] people under her care.

Agueratou has been selling beauty products (hair extensions, ointments, pagnes [brightly colored fabrics], etc.) for eight years. She procures her goods from the grand market. She would like to buy one dozen ointments, one dozen hair extensions, and one dozen baby clothes. 

She wants to save her earnings and also educate her children. She would like one day to open a large shop.

loans.use: to buy one dozen ointments, one dozen hair extensions, and one dozen baby clothes

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 26-year-old married man; he has two children. He describes himself to be determined. 

He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his bicycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a business-friendly area and his primary customers are of all types. 

David will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more bicycles for hire. 

His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that he will have a bright future. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more bicycles for hire

loans.name: Cadenitas De Oro Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CADENITAS DE ORO” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Vania es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de cerveza, venta de ganado ovino, venta de sombreros, venta de ropa deportivas, venta de refrescos y golosinas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Vania es integrante, ella indica que es el primer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cerveza y refresco; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de hermana, ya que desde corta edad ella ayudo a su familia y así aprendió los procesos de comercio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cerveza y refrescos por mayor) que adquirirá en las comunidades cercanas y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
Cadenitas de Oro will start its fifth loan cycle in Pro Mujer as part of Central Focal de Patacamaya. The group is comprised of eight members and is directed by a board of which Vania is the secretary. The businesses of the communal bank members are varied and among them are: the sale of food, beer, sheep, hats, sports clothes, drinks and candies.

The loan that they are asking for will benefit small micro-business that Vania is involved in as a member. This is Vania’s first year as a member of Pro Mujer, which she joined after a promoter of the institution went to visit her in her home. Now she has a business that sales beer and drinks. She learned this business from her sister because starting at a young age she helped her family and learned the ins and outs of business.

The loan that she is requesting now will be used to increase capital by purchasing beers and drinks at wholesale in the nearby communities and later sell them in her retail space. This form of work allows her to earn income to support her family as she already is married with two children.

When asked what she liked about Pro Mujer, Vania responded that she liked the training sessions that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy beer and drinks at wholesale

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 41-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk with her husband for many years. She has three buffaloes to milk, and sells the milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk.  She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis.  

Razia has become famous for providing good-quality milk, and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. 

Currently she is in her seventh loan cycle, and has applied for a loan of PKR 60,000. This will allow her to purchase one more buffalo. 

She is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Carryon

texts.en:
Carryon is a 23-year-old single businesswoman. She lives in Mwenezi District, Zimbabwe, where she volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide in her community. As a Learner Guide, Carryon teaches life and leadership skills to local students in order to improve their learning environment and well-being. To support herself, she has been running a business selling groceries such as biscuits, sugar, rice, salt, and cooking oil for the past year and it has enabled her to support her family.  

Carryon will purchase more groceries to sell with the Kiva loan. 

Her hope is to grow the business and open her own store. This will bring financial stability to her life and will enable her to provide for her family’s basic needs. 

Carryon wants to further her education and improve her standard of living with the increased profits.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She has been running a business selling cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. 

She requested a loan of PKR 45,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloths for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloths for the summer season .

loans.name: Iragi Group

texts.fr: Madame Vumilia, femme ambitieuse est vice-présidente de l’association d’affaire Iragi. A l’âge de 61 ans, elle est mère de  8 enfants  dont 6 vont  à l’école et est engagée à un homme d’affaire. Elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt pour acheter 4 douzaines de pagne africain.  Son rêve est de prospérer dans ses activités. Ainsi, elle remercie grandement Hekima de soutenir les femmes.
texts.en:
Vumilia is an ambitious woman and vice-president of the business group "Iragi". At the age of 61, she is a mother of eight children, of whom six go to school and one is engaged to a businessman.

Vumilia is seeking this new loan to buy 4 dozen pagne [bright, colorful fabric]. 

Her dream is to prosper in her activities. 

Vumilia strongly thanks Hekima for their supporting women.

loans.use: to buy four dozen african pagne [bright, colorful fabric]

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 36-year old-married man. He has three children with ages ranging from 5 years to 15 years. He describes himself to have self-esteem. 

He operates a retail business where he sells electronics. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a business-friendly area and his primary customers are regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high prices of products. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of electronics. His business goal is to open more business branches within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable income. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stock of electronics

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.fr: Madame Mwavita est une femme dynamique, vice-présidente du groupe de credit Upendo. Elle est âgée de 43 ans, mère de 7 enfants (5 scolarisés)  et mariée à un homme sans travail. Commerçante depuis 2008 dans le  marché central, elle sollicite le nouveau credit pour acheter divers articles (4 cartons des cirages liquides, 4 cartons des teintures dame, 4 douzaines des ceintures et 1 carton de cirage kiwi) .  Elle souhaite prospérer dans ses affaires et devenir grossiste. Ainsi, elle remercie et bénie Hekima.
texts.en:
Mwavita is a dynamic woman and the vice-president of the loan group, 'Upendo'.  She is 43 years old, and mother to seven children (of whom, five currently attend school).  Her husband is out of work at the moment.  

Mwavita has worked as a trader at the central market since 2008.  She has requested this loan in order to buy various products for resale (4 boxes of nail polishes, 4 boxes of hair dye, 4 dozen belts and 1 box of Kiwi wax).  She would like to have a successful business and become a wholesaler in the future.  She is very grateful for the help offered by the field partner, Hekima, and blesses their work.

loans.use: to buy various beauty products for resale.

loans.name: Justice B Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mukahunsi est une  commerçante et membre d’un collectif d’affaires « Justice B », entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 42 ans et mère de 7 enfants qui tous, étudient. La cliente est une vendeuse des pagnes.  Elle installe ses marchandises dans le marché animé de la ville. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 20 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 2 pièces  de pagnes. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire une belle maison, scolariser, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment post conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Mukahunsi is a merchant and a member of the business group "Justice B." She is a dynamic entrepreneur, 42 years old, and a mother of seven children, who all go to school.

Mukahunsi has been selling pagnes [bright, colorful fabric] for 20 years. She displays her goods in the busy town market. Only later did she benefit from a loan through Hekima.

This new loan is going to be used to buy two lengths of pagnes.

Mukahunsi wishes to build a nice house and to educate and feed her children.

Finally, she strongly thanks Hekima for empowering women without access to traditional financial services, especially in this time of conflict in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy two lengths of pagne [bright, colorful fabric]

loans.name: Mulangane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Beatrice est une commerçante et membre  d’un groupe d’affaires « Mulangane », entrepreneur, âgée de 26 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants  dont 1 scolarisé et 3 trois sont encore gosses. La cliente est une vendeuse d’haricots. Elle étale sa marchandise  dans un marché  de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec  de fonds reçu d’un bienfaiteur. Son conjoint est un chauffeur en transport en commun. Il y a 3 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 3 sacs d’haricots.  Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
The client, Beatrice, is a merchant and a member of the Mulangane business group. She is a 26-year-old entrepreneur who is married. Of her four children, one goes to school, but the others are too young. 

The client sells beans. She displays her goods in a market in the city. She started her business three years ago with funds received from a benefactor. Her spouse is a driver for public transit.

This new loan will help her buy three bags of beans. She would like to grow her capital, and educate, clothe, and feed her children. Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for empowerment of female entrepreneurs not served by the banking system - especially during this critical post-conflict time in the east of the country.

loans.use: buy three bags of beans.

loans.name: Sinaï Group

texts.fr: Kahiro est une commerçante depuis 20 ans, présidente et membre d’une association d’affaires « Sinaï», âgée  de 40 ans, mariée et mère des 8 enfants dont, 3 étudient, 4 ont terminé les études et 1 encore gosse. Elle est vendeuse des  denrées alimentaires. Elle étale ses marchandises dans la rue sur un quartier animé de la place. Elle sollicite un crédit  auprès de Hekima. Son conjoint travaille dans une maison de gardiennage. Elle va acheter 2 sacs d’arachides, 10 régimes de bananes et 5 sacs d'oignons pour accroitre son entreprise. Elle commença avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle et la construire, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes  entrepreneurs exclues  du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Kahiro has been a saleswoman for 20 years. She is a member of the "Sinaï" business association. She is 40 years old and married. She has eight children, three of whom go to school, four of whom have finished school, and one who is too young to go to school.

She sells commodities. She displays her goods on a street in a lively local district. She is asking for a loan from Hekima. Her spouse works in a security company. She would like to buy two bags of peanuts, 10 bunches of bananas, and five bags of onions in order to grow her company. She started with funds received from her husband. In the future, she would like to buy a plot of land and build on it. She would also like to educate and feed her children. 

She thanks Hekima for their support of women not served by the standard banking system.

loans.use: buy two bags of peanuts, 10 bunches of bananas, and five onions.

loans.name: Amani Kwetu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Noella est une commerçante et membre d’un collectif d’affaires « Amani Kwetu », entrepreneur, âgée de 46 ans, veuve et mère de 7 enfants  dont 3 étudient et 4 ont abandonné. La cliente est une vendeuse de lait frais et galettes. Elle installe sa marchandise sur la rue dans un quartier animé de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de son frère. Il y a 4 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 20 litres de lait, 2 sacs de farine de format et 10 litres d’huile. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique post conflits dans la région de  l’Est du pays.Il sied de signaler que parmi les clients accroupis, une porte au devant son bébé.
texts.en:
The client, Noella, is a saleswoman and member of the business collective, "Amani Kwetu." She is an entrepreneur who is 46 years old and a widow. She has seven children, three of whom go to school, and four of whom left school. 

The client sells fresh milk and cakes. She displays her goods on a street in a lively local district. She started her business with funds from her brother. She has been working on this business for four years. 

This new loan will help her buy 20 liters of milk, two bags of wheat flour, and 10 liters of oil. She would like to grow her capital, and educate, clothe, and feed her children. 

Finally, she would like to thank Hekima strongly for their empowerment of female entrepreneurs not served by the banking system. She is especially thankful in this critical post-conflict time in the east of the country. 

She would like to point out that among the kneeling clients, one is holding her baby in front of her.

loans.use: buy 20 liters of milk, two bags of wheat flour, and 10 liters of oil.

loans.name: Staff La Frontière Sf Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Masirika est une Couturière depuis 10 ans et membre d’un groupe d’Affaires «Staff la Frontière SF» âgée de 37 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse des matériels de couture et sociétaire d’un atelier. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir  pour acheter des nouveaux matériels (Tissus et 1 machine à coudre)et s’entraide avec son mari. Elle démarra avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite construire un atelier de grande renommé, scolariser, nourrir et assurer les soins médicaux de ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs en leur accordant de crédit sans garantie matérielle.
texts.en:
Masirika has been a seamstress for the past 10 years and is a member of the "Staff la Frontiere SF" business group. She is 37 years old, married and the mother of seven children who are all studying. She sells sewing materials and is shareholder of a workshop.

She is requesting a loan from Hekima to expand her business. This new loan will serve to buy new equipment (fabric and one sewing machine) and provide support to her husband. She started with funds received from her husband.

In the future she wants to build a large, renowned workshop, and educate, feed and provide medical care for her children.

She thanks Hekima for its support to women entrepreneurs by providing credit loans without collateral.

loans.use: buy new equipment (fabric and one sewing machine)

loans.name: Buzigire Group

texts.fr: Madame Nyota, femme ambitieuse et  courage de l’association d’affaire Buzigire ;  est  commerçante depuis plus de 5ans dans le  marché public de la place.  Agée de 32 ans, elle est mère de 6 enfants dont seulement 3etudient et 3 autres n’ont pas encore atteint l’âge de scolarité. La cliente est engagee  à un homme d’affaire. Elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt pour acheter  1 ballot de friperie.  Le plus grand obstacle de sa profession c’est la perte en cas de la mauvaise qualité de la marchandise. Qu’à cela ne tienne, elle souhaite construire une jolie maison, scolariser ses enfants jusqu’au niveau des études universitaires et faire l’élevage. Enfin, elle remercie Hekima de soutenir financièrement les femmes économiquement pauvres.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nyota is an ambitious and courageous woman from the Buzigire business association. She has been a merchant for more than five years in the local market.

Aged 32, she is the mother of six children, of whom only three attend school and the three others have not yet reached school age. She is engaged to a businessman.

She is requesting this loan to buy one bale of used clothing. The biggest obstacle of her profession is the loss in case of poor quality goods.

Nevertheless, she wants to build a nice house, educate her children to university level, and breed livestock.

Finally, she thanks Hekima for its financial support to economically deprived women.

loans.use: buy one bale of used clothing

loans.name: Mapendo Group

texts.fr: Madame Nabintu, femme ambitieuse est vice-présidente de l’association d’affaire Mapendo. A l’âge de 36 ans, elle est mère de  5 enfants  dont seulement 2 vont  à l’école et est engagée à Agronome. Elle commença le commerce à partir de l’argent qu’elle avait bénéficié de la vente de ses récoltes il ya plus de 10ans. Elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt pour acheter une douzaine de bassin, une douzaine de casserole, une douzaine de gobelet, une douzaine d’assiette en métal et une dizaine de thermos.  Son rêve est de prospérer dans ses activités, scolariser ses enfants et améliorer les conditions de vie. Ainsi, elle remercie grandement Hekima et le félicite pour ses services.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nabintu, an ambitious woman, is the vice-president of the Mapendo business association. At age 36, she is the mother of five children of whom only two attend school, and is engaged to an agronomist.

She began trading with the money she earned from selling her crops over 10 years ago.

She is now requesting a new loan to buy a dozen basins, a dozen cooking pots, a dozen cups, a dozen metal plates and a dozen thermos bottles.

Her dream is to prosper in her activity, educate her children and improve her living conditions. She is also grateful to Hekima and congratulates it for the services it provides.

loans.use: buy a dozen basins, a dozen cooking pots, a dozen cups, a dozen metal plates and a dozen thermos bottles.

loans.name: Ushindi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Marie anne est une vaillante commerçante depuis 18 ans et membre d’une banque villageoise  «Ushindi», Senior entrepreneur, âgée de 52 ans, veuve et mère de 7 enfants qui tous, étudient. Elle est vendeuse souliers usagés, chez elle à domicile et au marché de la ville. Elle s’entraide avec ses enfants.  Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 25 paires de souliers. Elle avait débuté avec de fonds reçu de sa famille. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite progresser dans son business,  acheter une parcelle, scolariser, nourrir  ses enfants et assurer leurs soins médicaux. Elle remercie Hekima pour avoir bien choisi sa cible, en apportant un soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, tout en  leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle, surtout, pendant, la période post conflit dans la région de l’Est Pays.
texts.en:
Marie Anne has been a courageous merchant for the past 18 years and a member of the "Ushindi"  village bank. A senior entrepreneur, 52 years of age, she is a widowed mother of seven children who all are studying. She sells used shoes in her home and at the city market. She provides support to her children.

She is requesting a loan from Hekima to increase her activities, and will use it to buy 25 pairs of shoes. She started out with funds received from her family.

In the future, she wants to expand her business, buy a plot of land, and educate, feed her children and ensure their medical care.

She thanks Hekima to have well chosen its target, providing support to women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system, while granting them loans without collateral, especially during the post-conflict period in the Eastern region of the country.

loans.use: buy 25 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana tiene 38 años de edad, estudió hasta quinto grado, está casada desde hace más de un año y su esposo se dedica a la compra y venta de chatarra, ella vive con sus hijos, su esposo y su madre. 

Anteriormente Ana se dedicaba a la compra y venta de chatarras, pero luego encontró trabajo de sirvienta en una casa, y por lo tanto ahora su esposo administra solo el otro negocio, y de esta forma los 2 colaboran con los gatos del hogar.

El préstamo será utilizado como capital de trabajo para la compra de chatarra, para que el negocio siga creciendo ya que el esposo y un hijo le están ayudando en el negocio.

Ella y su esposo planean que el negocio siga creciendo para que sus hijos logren culminar sus estudios académicos y que puedan convertirse en unas personas de bien con buenos valores y responsables.
texts.en:
Ana is 38 years old and studied as far as the fifth grade. She has been married for over a year, and her husband works buying and selling scrap metal. She lives with her children, her husband, and her mother.

Ana used to work buying and selling scrap metal, but then she found a job as a domestic employee in a house.  So now her husband runs the other business by himself, and in this way the two of them work together on the household expenses.

The loan will be used as working capital to buy scrap metal, so that the business can continue to grow, now that her husband and son are helping her with it. 

She and her husband plan for their business to keep growing, so their children will be able to complete their academic studies and become good, responsible people with good values.

loans.use: to buy recyclable scrap metal

loans.name: Zanib

texts.en:
Zanib, age 47, is a married woman. She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 60,000 to purchase more animals. 

She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married with four children, three of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. For the past 10 years, Esther has run a general store and she generates additional income selling cooked food, cassava, and beans. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. Esther lives in the family house without access to electricity or running water and her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

Esther is requesting a 600,000 UGX loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil, and bread. She aspires to own a fully stocked retail shop and also to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, cooking oil, and bread

loans.name: Nimra

texts.en:
Nimra has expertise in embroidery and has been using her skill to provide for her family for over 10 years now. Today, she is proud to be famous in her community as the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. Nimra makes a good amount of money to contribute to her family’s income. 

Nimra is requesting a 40,000 PKR loan to purchase materials such as spools of threads, beads, and sequins in different colors. This will be her sixth loan cycle and she has a good repayment history. Nimra is hopeful to increase her income by targeting more customers.

loans.use: to purchase spools of threads, beads, and sequins in different colors

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en: Shamim is a 41-year-old married lady who has run a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. Shamim makes enough to provide for her family. To make her store fully stocked she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR which she will use to buy stock of rice, sugar, biscuits, tea and flour from the market at lower rates.  This way she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice, sugar, biscuits, tea and flour.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en: Perveen, age 50, is a married woman.  She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Shahida is 40-years-old, married woman and the mother of six children. The man shown in the photo is Shahida’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Shahida has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some tools for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide a better transport service to his passengers. Shahida is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some tools.

loans.name: Plaxedes

texts.en:
Plaxedes is a 21-year-old businesswoman living in Mwenezi District, Zimbabwe. She volunteers her time as a Camfed Learner Guide, offering life skills education to improve the well-being of local students. Plaxedes is also a district committee member of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network. She rents a table at the local flea market where she sells products including bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts. Plaxedes has been running her business for the past year and it has enabled her to support her family.  

Plaxedes is requesting a Kiva loan to purchase more bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts to increase her supplies. She aspires to grow her business and open her own shop. Her loan will help her to provide for her family’s basic needs and assist vulnerable children in her community.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and accessories

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 43 years old. She is from Nyandarua and is married. They have four children who are all in school.

Hannah has a farming business that she has been running for many years. She has applied for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to enable her to buy seedlings and fertilizers to help with the family farm.

She hopes to expand her business in the near future and be able to save more money.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 36-year-old married woman with four children. For the past five years, she has operated a tailoring business where she makes clothing to sell. Jane describes herself as patient. Her business is located in a vibrant place and her primary customers are ladies. Jane’s biggest business challenge is the lack of capital. 

Jane is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to buy fabric, thread, and other tailoring materials. This will be her second loan with SMEP DTM. She successfully repaid her previous loan. Jane’s business goal is to own a tailoring school within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate all her children.

loans.use: buy fabric, thread, and other tailoring materials

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a carpentry where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a good area for business and his primary customers are of all kinds. He describes his biggest business challenge to be tastes and preferences of customers. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy timber, nails and other carpentry materials. He hopes that in the future, he will economically sustain himself. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy timber, nails and other carpentry materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en: Consolata is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be courageous. She operates a retail business where she sells soft drinks and other products. Her business is located in a competitive area and her primary customers are of all kinds. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of soft drinks and other items. Her business goal is to have a reliable business within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soft drinks and other items.

loans.name: José Alejandro

texts.es:
José tiene 74 años de edad, solo estudió primer grado de educación básica, ya que   los recursos de sus padres eran escasos, él vive con su madre, dos hermanas y su sobrino quien trabaja y le apoya en el negocio.

Actualmente José es comerciante de granos básicos, él se dedica a comprar maíz, frijol, maicillo para luego venderlo por cantidades mayores, también tiene una tienda en la que le ayuda su sobrino, gracias a los años de experiencia José ha aprendido a administrar bien sus ingresos y a hacer buena inversión en sus negocios.
 
El crédito lo utilizará para invertir en su negocio, ya que hay algunos productos que no los tiene en su tienda, pero por el momento no cuenta con el capital para poder surtir su tienda, por lo que necesita apoyo económico. 

En un futuro espera poder tener una tienda muy grande en la que no falte ningún producto de los que se necesitan en el hogar, así también espera poder dejarle a su sobrino un negocio surtido del que pueda obtener ingresos que le ayuden a continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
José, age 74, only went to school through the first grade.  This is because his parents had scarce resources.  He lives with his mother, two sisters, and his nephew.  His nephew works and helps him in the business.

José is currently a basic grains merchant.  He buys corn, beans, and sorghum in order to later sell them for more.  He also has a store in which his nephew helps him.  Thanks to the years of experience, José has learned how to manage his earnings and to make a good investment in his businesses.

He will use the loan to invest in his business.  There are some products that he does not have in his store.  However, he does not now have the capital to be able to stock his store.  That is why he needs financial help.

In the future he hopes to be able to have a very large store that has all of the products that are needed in the home.  This way he also hopes to be able to leave his nephew a well-stocked business.  That way he will be able to get earnings that will help him continue his education.

loans.use: to buy more products for his store.

loans.name: Sabire

texts.en:
Sabire is requesting a loan to buy an embroidery/sewing machine. She is a seamstress, and her daughter does embroidery; this machine will be useful to both of them. Sabire is disabled, and her disability doesn’t allow her to do much in the agriculture field; however, her husband and daughter who lives with them takes care of the latest planting and harvesting of veggies and fruits, and the goats they currently have.
 
It is in the tradition in their region that girls in the rural areas make embroideries for their dowry, such as tablecloths, linens, towels and curtains for themselves and their in-laws; hence, this type of profession is always in demand. The same with the stitching — in a nearby city is the largest Roma used clothing market. Due to poverty, the majority of people purchase clothes at this market, and then they have them repaired by seamstresses.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery/sewing machine that will be useful to both her and her daughter

loans.name: Nasaar

texts.en:
Nasaar is 54 years old and a married woman. The man shown in the photo is Nasaar’s husband, who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Nasaar has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and needs to get some repair work done on his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

Nasaar is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and get some repair work done.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 49-year-old woman who lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her husband and five children. Her husband has been working in the public sector for many years and is responsible for fulfilling the needs of family. Farzana also provides sewing services and earns an income to contribute with her husband toward managing the household. She has insufficient financial means to purchase needed materials.

Farzana is requesting a loan through the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase different kinds of goods such as needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, and other items for her sewing. Her loan will enable her to purchase these accessories and also help increase her monthly sales and profit by allowing her to provide better sewing services. Farzana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase needles, thread, pieces of cloth, machine oil, and other items

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en: Kousar is a 45-year-old married woman. She deals in the business selling cloth in her locality. She buys cloth of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. Kousar is requesting a 50,000 PKR loan from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en: Rachael is a 22-year-old business lady who lives in the Umguza district of Zimbabwe. She is married with one child. She is running a small shop in her village selling snacks, sweets, biscuits, eggs, salt and sugar.  She has been in this business for one and half years. Rachel is also a volunteer within her community who works with other CAMA members in assisting needy children in schools with stationery and uniforms. With the requested loan, Rachael intends to purchase sugar, salt and snacks in bulk to boost her sales and profits. She will use the profits to assist the needy in the community and to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, salt and snacks in bulk.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en: Mumtaz is a 54-year-old married woman. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for many years. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed as a sales person and he does not earn enough to support his family well. Mumtaz’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her surroundings. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work. She is in her 5th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Bushra is a 27-year-old married woman. She is a mother of 3 children. Bushra has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last two years. She offers various items for everyday use. She has good communication skills and has a good client list. Her husband works in a factory and earns insufficient income to support his family. Bushra is motivated to provide for her family. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy a stock of detergents and grocery items, such as rice, sugar and oil in large quantities to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She wishes to spend part of the revenues on providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to buy a stock of detergents and grocery items, such as rice, sugar and oil in large quantities.

loans.name: Zvisinei

texts.en:
Zvisinei is 30 years old and married with two children. She resides in Mwenezi District, Zimbabwe where she works hard to provide for her family and give back to her community. To provide for her family, Zvisinei rents a table at the local flea market where she sells products such as Zambia’s bags (bags made locally from recycled materials), jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts. She has been running this business for the past year and a half and is very proud of the progress she has made in such a short time. 

To give back to her community, Zvisinei has been working as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the well-being of students by improving their learning environment. 

With the Kiva loan, Zvisinei will purchase more bags, shoes, jeans, shirts, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts to increase her supplies. Her desire is to grow the business and open her own store. She started the business so that she can sustain her life and uplift her standard of living. She also wants to provide quality education for her two children.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her stock.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is a young lady aged 18 who is from Umguza District. She is still single, and she lives with her parents. Rachel is also known for volunteering to assist orphans in their fields in her community. She is doing a poultry project, selling her chickens to local schools, clinics, mines and police stations. She is aiming at getting more profit so that she will be able to assist needy children at schools by paying fees, and also help the elderly people by providing food for them. Boosting her business is her major aim when she gets the loan, so that she could live a better life when she starts getting more profits.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a 27-year-old businesswoman and single mother of one residing in Mwenezi District, Zimbabwe. For over a year, Violet has been successfully operating a stall at the local flea market where she sells satchels, school uniforms, tracksuits and shirts. She started the business when her husband left her as a way to financially support her family. When she is not at her stall, Violet volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools.  

With the requested Kiva loan, Violet will purchase more clothes, uniforms and tracksuits to increase her supplies. With additional profits she hopes to expand into a larger business, employ people to assist her and provide for her child.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes, uniforms and tracksuits

loans.name: Alight

texts.en:
Alight is a 20-year-old married entrepreneur with no children. She resides in Mwenezi District, Zimbabwe. Alight is a Camfed Learner Guide, offering life skills education in local schools to improve the well-being of students. In addition, Alight rents a shop in her local community where she sells groceries like biscuits, sugar, ice, flour and cooking oil. She has been running this business for one year now and it has enabled her to support her family.  

With the Kiva loan, Alight will purchase more biscuits, sugar, ice, flour and cooking oil to increase her stock. Her desire is to grow the business and open her own store. She will use the profits to help her family members with basic food. She also wants to employ some other young women in her community and serve as a role model.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items.

loans.name: Bibian

texts.en: Bibian is a 30-year-old businesswoman who is married with three children. She has been successfully operating a shop where she sells sugar, salt, soap, flour, cooking oil and rice. Bibian lives in Nyaminyami District of Zimbabwe. She has been assisted by her family members in this business venture as it is their main source of income. With the requested Kiva loan, Bibian intends to make bulk purchases of sugar, salt, soap, flour, cooking oil, rice and other groceries in order to make more profits. With the improved profits, she hopes to expand her business and improve her standard of living. To give back to her community, she volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide in schools teaching students life skills education.

loans.use: to increase her stock.

loans.name: Rem

texts.en: Rem is 51 years old. She is a married woman with four children living in Oudong, Kampong Speu Province. For a living she makes a cake which is shaped like a wheel to sell for profit, her husband does farming, one of her children works as electrician and another works as a laborer. All of them can earn around $21.42 per day combined. Now she would like to apply for a loan of $1300 to buy land for building a house. This loan will help her in obtaining a better living condition.

loans.use: buy land for building a house

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim is 50 years old. She is a married woman with five children living in Oudong, Kampong Speu Province. She is a snack vendor, her husband is a farmer and her three children are garment factory laborers. All of them can earn $20.50 per day combined. Now she would like to apply for a loan of $1000 to pay for her son’s wedding party expenses.

loans.use: pay her son's wedding party expenses

loans.name: Sokhong

texts.en: Sokhong is 34 years old and a widow with one child living in Takeo Province. She is a farmer and she can earn 4 USD per day. Now she would like to apply for a loan of 1,500 USD for buying fertilizer, seeds and insecticides for farming in the dry season. This loan helps her increase her income as well as her family's standard of living. In the future, she hopes that she can do farming both in dry and rainy seasons more than two times per year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and insecticides for farming.

loans.name: Khon

texts.en: Khon is 54 years old. She is a married woman with two children living in Oudong, Kampong Speu Province. For a living Khon and her child work as laborers of copper sculpturing and her husband is motor-taxi driver. All of them can earn approximately $15 per day combined. Now she would like to apply for a loan of $1000 to buy roofing tiles to build her house’s roof. This loan helps her obtain a better living condition.

loans.use: buy roofing tiles to build her house's roof

loans.name: Chreb

texts.en: Chreb is 45 years old. She is a married woman with three children living in Oudong, Kampong Speu Province. She is a farmer, her husband is a vegetable vendor and her child is a factory labor. All of them can earn $12 per day combined. Now she would like to apply for a loan of $1500 to buy timber to build a house. In the future, she hopes that she can buy more farmland to do farming and build a bathroom and a toilet.

loans.use: buy timber to build a house

loans.name: Sinonn

texts.en:
Sinonn is 36 years old. She is a married woman who has two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a grocery retailer and her husband is a teacher. Both of them can earn $8.50 per day. 

Now, she would like to apply for loan of $1,000 to buy more goods for her retail shop. This loan will help her expand her business as well as improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell at her retail shop

loans.name: Samol

texts.en: Samol is 34 years old, a married woman of two children at Kampong Chhnang Province. Samol and her husband are factory labourers. Both of them earn 9 USD per day. Now she would like to apply for loan of 1000 USD for paying the connection fee for electricity and water supply. In the future, she hopes she can open a hairdressing shop.

loans.use: to pay the connection fee for electricity and water supply.

loans.name: Yaing

texts.en:
Yaing is 48 years old. She is a married woman who has five children. She and her family live in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. For a living, she sells Khmer noodle and her husband works as a construction worker. Both of them can earn 7 USD per day. 

Now, she would like to apply for a loan of 1,000 USD to buy motorcycle spare parts to run a motorcycle repair shop for clients. This loan will help her open this new shop as well as make more profit for the family. In the future, Yaing hopes that she can run this shop well, and she is going to apply for a loan to build a house next.

loans.use: To buy motorcycle spare parts to run a motorcycle repair shop for clients.

loans.name: Hen

texts.en:
Hen is a 21-year-old married woman with one child in Siem Reap Province. For a living, she sells roasted meat and breeds pigs to sell for a profit. Her husband is a construction worker. Both of them can earn 9 USD per day. 

Now she would like to apply for a loan of 1,000 USD to buy a motorbike for commuting. This loan helps her reduce her transportation expense and makes it easier for her to go to the market and buy more amounts of meat to sell. She expects that her business can be expanded.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha is 46 years old. She is a married woman with 2 children. She and her family live in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a housewife and her husband is a motor-taxi driver. One of the children is also a driver. All of them can earn 6 USD per day. 

Now, Sokha would like to apply for a loan of 1,000 USD to help her purchase a cow to breed in order to sell its offspring for profit. This loan will help her earn more income as well as get a better standard of living. In the future, Sokha hopes that she can run a grocery retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for breeding in order to sell its offspring for profit.

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Phon is 55 years old, a married woman of three children at Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a housewife and her husband is a motor-taxi driver. He earns 7 USD per day. She would like to apply for loan of 1,400 USD to buying a new motorcycle to provide transportation service to clients. This loan helps her family getting more income as well as getting a better life.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle to provide transportation service to clients.

loans.name: Yoeung

texts.en:
Yoeung is 57 years old. She is a married woman who has two children. She and her family live in Takeo Province, Cambodia. To make a living, she sells motorcycle spare parts at her home, and her husband repairs motorbikes for clients. Both of them can earn 10 USD per day. 

In order to expand her business, she would like to apply for a loan of 1,000 USD for buying more motorbike spare parts to sell for a profit. This loan can help her make more profit as well as achieve a better standard of living. In the future, she expects that she will expand her business and that her children will learn specific skills.

loans.use: To buy more motorbike spare parts to sell for a profit

loans.name: Chet

texts.en: Chet is 22 years old. He is a factory laborer and he earns around $6 per day. Now, he would like to apply for loan of $1,000 to purchase a cow to breed and to resell its offspring. This loan helps him make more income as well as get a better life. In the future, he hopes that he can purchase more and more cows to breed and his house can be renovated.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to breed and to resell its offspring

loans.name: Sarat

texts.en:
Sarat is 54 years old. She is a married woman who has five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. For a living, she sells fish, her husband builds wells and her two children work as garment factory laborers. All of them can earn $15 per day. 

Now, Sarat would like to apply for loan of $1,000 (USD) to buy a well drilling machine and to pay for repairing tools to dig the well for her husband's business. This loan helps her husband make more income for family. In the future, she hopes that she can renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy a well drilling machine and to pay for repairing tools to dig the well

loans.name: Morn

texts.en:
Morn is 55 years old. She is a married woman who has six children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She is a housewife, her husband is a watermelon vendor, and three of her children are employed. All of them earn approximately $38 per day. 

Now, Morn would like to apply for a loan of $1,100 (USD) to buy cows to breed and sell the offspring for profit. This loan will help her family to make more income. In the future, she hopes that she can build a toilet and she can open a grocery retail shop at home.

loans.use: To buy cows to breed and sell the offspring

loans.name: Lat

texts.en:
Lat is 38 years old. She is a married woman who has five children. She and her family live in Oudong, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She is a vegetable and meat vendor. Her husband is a farmer and one of her children is a factory laborer. All of them can earn 10 USD per day. 

Now, she would like to apply for a loan of 1,200 USD for buying a motorbike for commuting. This loan will help her business in transportation, as she will drive this motorbike when carrying her vegetables and meat to sell. In the future, Lat hopes that she can expand her business and build a latrine.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Thea

texts.en: Thea is 65 years old. She is a married woman who has two children. She and her family live in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. For a living, she sells fire wood, her husband is a village leader and one of her childen is a waiter. All of them can earn around 9 USD per day. Now, she would like to apply for a loan of 1,000 USD for buying a motorbike for commuting. This loan helps her reduce her family’s transportation expense.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Saret is 37 years old. She is a married woman who has one child. She and her family live in Oudong, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She is a factory laborer and her husband is a motorbike repairer. Both of them can earn approximately 8 USD per day. 

Now, she would like to apply for a loan of 1,000 USD for buying a wooden wall to renovate her house, and also to buy motorcycle spare parts for her husband’s motorbike repair shop. In the future, Saret hopes that her husband’s business grows and that her child can earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: To buy a wooden wall to renovate her house and to buy motorcycle spare parts for her husband's motorbike repair shop.

loans.name: Ham

texts.en:
Ham is 45 years old. She is a married woman who has four children. She lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a farmer, her husband is a fisherman and two of her children are factory labors. All of them can earn $18 per day. 

Now, she would like to apply for a loan of $1,300 for renovating her house. This loan will help her family live in good conditions. In the future, she hopes that she can buy more cows and more farmland.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Meng

texts.en: Meng is 60 years old. He is a married man who has two children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He is a farmer and his wife who is with him in the photo is an animal raiser and a vegetable planter. Two of his children are employed, one is a staff of Vision Fund and another is a teacher. All of them can earn 35 USD per day. Now, he would like to apply for a loan of 1,200 USD to buy cement and steel to build a kitchen and a toilet and to pay for construction fee. This loan helps his family live in a better condition.

loans.use: To buy cement and steel to build a kitchen and a toilet and to pay for construction fee

loans.name: Sar

texts.en:
Sar is 62 years old. She is a married woman who has three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers and all of her children are employed. All of them can earn $15.52 per day. 

Now, Sar would like to apply for a loan of $1,500 (USD) to buy a wooden wall to renovate her house. In the future, she hopes that she can build a toilet and buy more farmland to do farming.

loans.use: To buy a wooden wall to renovate her house

loans.name: Flor De Rosas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR DE ROSAS”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Remedios es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de fruta, tejido de chompas de alpaca, venta de verduras, ayudante de construcción, servicio de amplificación, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Remedios es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una hermana que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años ayudando a su tía en su negocio con  el pasar del tiempo ella decide emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra lana por mayor) que adquirirá en las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones de pago del crédito, pues se reúne con sus amigas.
texts.en:
The "Flor de Rosas" communal bank will begin its third cycle with "Pro Mujer", through the Santiago II regional office. This communal bank has eight members and is run by a board of directors where Remedios is president. The members have different businesses, including: selling fruits, knitting alpaca wool jumpers, selling vegetables, a builder and a grocery store.

This loan will benefit the micro-businesses run by the members of Remedios' group. Remedios herself joined "Pro Mujer" a year ago, following an invitation from one of her sisters, also a member of the group. Remedios currently has a business knitting blankets. She tells us that she started the business some years ago. First she helped her aunt with her business, and then decided to start her own. 

This loan will be used to increase capital by buying wool in bulk from the El Alto city wholesalers. Remedios will then knit the blankets to sell. This work allows Remedios to earn a living to support her family; she has a partner and three children.

When asked what she likes about "Pro Mujer", Remedios responds that she likes the group meetings as there she can see her friends.

loans.use: to buy wool in bulk.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 49-year-old widowed woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a rental house business. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a good and convenient area and her primary customers are of all kinds. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy materials to repair the rental houses. Her business goal is to build more rental houses within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair rental houses

loans.name: Samneang

texts.en: Samneang is 28 years old. He is a married man who has one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. He is a construction worker and his wife who is with him in the photo is a factory laborer. Both of them can earn $15 per day. Now, he would like to apply for loan of $1,000 to purchase pigs and to renovate his house. This loan helps his family live in good conditions and increase his family’s income through breeding pigs to resell. In the future, he hopes that his child can get diploma.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and to renovate his house

loans.name: Sengkeo

texts.en: Sengkeo is 30 years old. She is a married woman who has two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a fish vendor and her husband is a farmer. Both of them can earn $20 per day. Now, she would like apply for loan of $1,000 to buy a cow to breed and to resell its offspring. This loan helps her get profit as well as get better standard of living. In the future, she hopes that her children can earn bachelor degree.

loans.use: to buy a cow to breed and to resell its offspring

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en: Shahnaz is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Shahnaz’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Shahnaz has applied for a loan of PKR 55,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some tools for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better a transport service to his passengers.  Shahnaz is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to help her husband buy new tires and some tools.

loans.name: Chet

texts.en:
Chet is 50 years old. She is a married woman who has three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. 

She and her husband are farmers. Both of them can earn $6 per day. 

Now, she would like to apply for loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for commuting. This loan helps her family reduce transportation expense.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Sokchea

texts.en:
Sokchea is 34 years old and married with four children. She lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia. Sokchea is a farmer, her husband is a motor-taxi driver, and her oldest child is a factory laborer. Each of them can earn 15 USD per day. 

Sokchea is requesting a 1,200 USD loan to buy farmland to grow rice crops in dry and rainy seasons. Her loan will help increase her income and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy farmland to grow rice in dry and rainy seasons

loans.name: Sokhen

texts.en:
Sokhen is 32 years old and married with three children. She lives in Odong, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. Sokhen provides rice seed to farmers and then collects it back after the harvest to make a profit. Her husband is a farmer. 

Sokhen is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to buy a tuk-tuk to provide transportation service to her new clients. Her loan will help increase her family’s income. In the future, Sokhen hopes to build a new house and she also hopes her children can earn bachelor degrees.

loans.use: to buy a tuk-tuk for a transport service

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy is 45 years old and is a married woman with one child. She lives in Oudong, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. Chanthy works as a laborer at a chicken farm and her husband is a hairdresser. They each can earn 8 USD each day.

Chanthy is requesting a 1,000 USD loan to purchase a cow to use for plowing. Her loan will help reduce her rental fees to rent a cow from others. In the future, Chanthy hopes that she can expand her husband’s hairdresser shop.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to use for plowing

loans.name: Progreso De Chilaya Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PROGRESO DE CHILAYA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Susi es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pescado, venta de queso, venta de comida y taller de costura.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Susi es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por recomendación de sus familiares, quienes realizaban el mismo negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de redes de pesca) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo instalará en su espacio de pesca. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le guata la capacitación y el crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The "Progreso de Chilaya" communal bank is beginning its first loan cycle with "Pro Mujer", through the Copacabana communal bank. This bank has eight members and is run by a board of directors which has Susi as its president. The members have different businesses including: selling fish, cheese, meals, and a dressmaking workshop.

This loan will benefit the small businesses run by the members in Susi's group. Susi herself tells us that she joined "Pro Mujer" a year ago following an invitation from one of the organisation's representatives who went to visit her in her home. Susi currently has a business selling meals, which she tells us she started on the recommendation of her relatives who work in the same sector.

This loan will be used to increase capital by buying fishing nets at the El Alto city markets. The nets will then be used for fishing. This work allows Susi to earn a living to support her family: Susi lives with her partner and has two children.

When asked what she likes about "Pro Mujer", she tells us that she likes the training and the loans offered by the organisation.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 34-year-old businesswoman who is married with three children. She has been successfully operating a grocery shop for more than one year after receiving entrepreneurship training from Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network. Judith sells all basic commodities in her shop such as tea, cooking oil, and sweets and she has managed to employ one person who assists her in the business. 

Judith is requesting a Kiva loan to make bulk purchases of groceries in order to reduce transport costs. With the additional profits from her loan, she hopes to expand her business into a large retail shop, improve her standard of living, and create employment in her community. Judith also serves as a Cama chairperson and volunteers as a community health trainer in schools and within the community.

loans.use: to purchase groceries in bulk

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a man of 36 years, married to Mary, and a father of two children. He runs a retail shop and also sells charcoal in Narariga, on the outskirts of Limuru town. He has been in this business for four years now and gets a monthly income of KES 12,000 (shillings).

This will be John's second loan with VisionFund Kenya. He plans to use the entire loan to buy charcoal to sell. In the future, John wants to educate his children and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand her business by buying items such as milk and biscuits.

loans.name: Fidencio

texts.es:
Fidencio es un hombre uy trabajador, vive en el distrito de Hermilio Valdizan, en el departamento de Huánuco y desde hace 20 años trabaja como agricultor ya que por medio de este humilde trabajo ha podido salir adelante y solventar los gastos de su hogar con mucho esfuerzo, sobre todo porque es padre de 3 hijos y con el fruto de su trabajo pudo apoyarlos; Fidencio actualmente ha sembrado plátano, cultivo al cual le brinda mucho cuidado y e spor ello que Fidencio cree que le va bien.

Fidencio esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá dar mantenimiento a su cultivo, comprar abono, fertilizantes, solventar los gastos de riego, entre otros; lo cual le va permitir tener una buena cosecha y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y seguir esforzándose por hacer realidad su gran sueño:”Ser una gran distribuidor”.
texts.en:
Fidencio is a hardworking man who lives in the District of Hermilio Valdizan, which is located in the Department of Huánuco. He has worked as a farmer for 20 years. Through this modest line of work, he has been able to forge ahead and take care of his household expenses with a great amount of effort. Above all else, he is the father of three children and the income he earns from his work is used to support them. Fidencio currently grow bananas. He cultivates his crops with great care and it is for this reason that he believes that he is doing well.
