Fidencio is grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks the assistance they have provided, he will be able to maintain his crops by purchasing compost and fertilizers. He will also pay for irrigation and other expenses. This will enable him to have a good harvest so that he can improve his earnings. Fidencio continues to strive toward fulfilling his greatest wish of becoming a successful distributor.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, and to pay for irrigation and other expenses.

loans.name: Channy

texts.en: Channy is 30 years old. She is a married woman who has one child in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a factory laborer and her husband is a motor-taxi driver. Both of them can earn approximately $10 per day. Now, she would like to apply for loan of $1,500 to buy cows to breed and to resell. This loan helps her make more income for family. In the future, she hopes that she can buy more farmland to do farming and more animals to breed.

loans.use: To buy cows to breed and to resell

loans.name: Ran

texts.en: Ran is 39 years old. She is a married woman who has three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a grocery retailer, her husband is a construction laborer, and her child is a factory laborer. All of them can earn approximately $16 per day. Now, she would like to apply for loan of $600 to buy more goods for her grocery store. This loans helps her expand her store as well as make more profit. In the future, she hopes she can renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her grocery store

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha Lorena, mayor de edad casada con cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por sus hermosas playas, turismo, y sus deliciosas rosquillas que son muy bien conocidas por todo el país, Martha es una microempresaria propietaria y administradora de un centro de acopio en cual comercializa mariscos como:pescado de exportación (PARGO, CORVINA, ALETA DE TIBURON) y pescado blanco (ROBALO, TIBURON, MACARELA, GUICHO, BARRACUDA, OTROS) y langostas, las cuales compra a pescadores artesanales de la zona,el marisco comprado lo vende a una empresa exportadora y a comerciantes mayoristas y minoristas (paneras), contando ya con treinta y dos años de experiencia en este negocio, el cual lo inicia con fondos propios, uno de sus sueños es poder realizar mejoras en su vivienda y el de mejorar su negocio, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo y aprovechar los buenos precios del verano y de esa manera mejorar sus utilidades.-
texts.en:
Martha Lorena is married and has four children, all of whom are independent adults.  She is originally from one of the towns in Chinandega, located in the western part of the country, an area known for its beautiful beaches, tourism, and delicious donuts that are well known throughout the country.

Martha is the owner of a store that sells seafood such as exported fish (red snapper, corvina, shark fin), white fish (sea bass, shark, mackerel, barracuda, and others), and lobster.  She purchases them from local fisherman and sells them to an export business, wholesale stores, and small businesses.  She has 32 years of experience with this business, which she started with her own money.

One of her dreams is to be able to make improvements to her home and improve her business.  She is requesting this loan to invest in working capital and take advantage of the good prices during the summer and improve her profits.

loans.use: to purchase varieties of seafood.

loans.name: Phal

texts.en: Phal is 47 years old. She is a married woman who has three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a silk weaver, her husband is a construction worker, and her two children are factory laborers. All of them can earn approximately $12 per day. Now, she would like to apply for loan of $1,000 for buying silk to weave and sell for profit. This loan helps her to obtain a better life. In the future, she hopes that she can expand her handicraft.

loans.use: To buy silk to weave and sell for profit

loans.name: Leang

texts.en: Leang is 41 years old. She lives in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a cloth tailor and earns approximately $6 per day. Now, she would like to apply for a loan of $1,100 to purchase farmland to do farming. This loan helps her make more income as well as have a better life. In the future, she hopes she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy farmland to do farming

loans.name: Somnang

texts.en: Somnang is 30 years old. She is a married woman who has two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is a factory laborer and her husband is a construction worker. Both of them can earn approximately $10 per day. Now, she would like to apply for loan of $1,500 for buying farmland to do farming in dry and rainy seasons. This loan helps her make more profit for her family as well as have a better standard of living. In the future, she hopes that both of her children can get high school diplomas.

loans.use: To buy farmland to do farming in dry and rainy seasons

loans.name: Bella Vista Pucarani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BELLA VISTA PUCARANI” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Olga es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche, mecánico, venta de comida, venta de refrescos, venta de leche, venta de juguetes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Olga es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por recomendación de sus familiares, quienes realizaban el mismo negocio, con un poco capital decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de víveres por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le guata la capacitación, el ahorro y el crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Bella Vista Pucarani" will begin its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana regional center. It consists of eight members, and it is led by a board of directors where Señora Olga is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank run are varied; among them are: selling milk, mechanic, selling food, selling beverages, selling milk, and selling toys.

The loan that they will take out will benefit this little group of micro-entrepreneurs, of which Señora Olga is a member. She indicates that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago, entering at the invitation of a recruiter from the institution who came to visit her at home. At this time she has a business of selling food. She lets it be known that she undertook this business on the recommendation of her relatives, who had the same business. With a little capital, she decided to set up an independent business.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital (to purchase groceries wholesale), which she will acquire from the fairs in the city of El Alto, and after preparing the food, she will sell it in her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, since she is married and has a son.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the training, the savings, and the loans that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy food supplies wholesale

loans.name: Marilu Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Marilu tiene como actividad comercial venta de Ropa de Segunda desde hace 12 años, su esposo la apoya incondicionalmente, sus hijoa ya estan mayores pero le colaboran economicamente, el credito lo esta solicitando para la compra de Paca Golden de Zapatos y Ropa ya que desea aprovechar esta tempora para que sus ganancias incrementen un poco mas, Agradece el apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le brindan al otorgarle este credito
texts.en:
Doña Marilu has been in the business of selling secondhand clothes for 12 years. Her husband provides unconditional support. Her children are already grown, but they help out financially.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a bale of shoes and clothes. Marilu wants to take advantage of this season so that she can increase her earnings a little bit more. She is grateful for the support that Kiva and AFODENIC have provided by offering this loan.

loans.use: to buy a bale of shoes and clothes that she can sell.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a 42-year-old married man; he has four children. He describes himself to be honest. 

He operates a retail business where he sells groceries. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive place, and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. 

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of  fruit and vegetables. 

This is his fifth loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 40 years old, married and lives in the town of Nyandarua with her husband and five children, who range in age from 4 to 18 years old. For many years now, she has earned a living by running a retail business. She is requesting this loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy supplies for her business, including sugar, salt and flour. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy salt, flour and sugar.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: Abigail is a 45-year-old single woman who has three children who range in age from 5 to 15 years old. She describes herself as honest and goal-oriented, and operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for the last two years, and works in a busy area where she has many regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds, and will use this Kes 20,000 loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers. Her business goals are to have more outlets within five years and increase her income. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with two children. She describes herself to be honest. 

She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, washing soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy and convenient place, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of sufficient funds. 

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, washing soap and other items. 

Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, washing soap and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and wood to expand her business.

loans.name: Gerson Miguel

texts.es:
Gerson vive en el distrito de los Aquijes, es un joven de 20 años el cual trbaja muy duro cada día como obrero de campo, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para salir adelante; Gerson trabaja alrededor de 9 horas y cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es responsable.

Gerson esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias al apoyo brindado el podrá mejorar la habitación donde vive y también poder comprar enseres para su vivienda, de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida, y seguir trabajando y luchando para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:”Tener su propia empresa”.
texts.en:
Gerson lives in the District of Los Aquijes. He is a young man who is 20 years of age. He works very hard each day as a farm laborer and the income he earns allows him to get ahead. Gerson works approximately nine hours and believes he is doing well because he is responsible in his work.

Gerson is grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the assistance they have provided, he will be able to improve the home where he resides. He also wants to buy basic necessities for his home, which will help to improve his quality of life. Gerson continues to work and strive toward fulfilling his greatest wish of having his own business.

loans.use: to buy basic necessities for his home.

loans.name: Eneng

texts.en:
Eneng runs a small stall where she sells stationery and mobile phone airtime credits. She lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Eneng is married and living with five people in the family home. 

Eneng began working with Ruma three months ago because she wanted to increase her income.  She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. 

As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Komariyah

texts.en:
Komariyah runs a small stall where she sells snacks, groceries and mobile phone airtime credits. She lives in Sukabumi, a semi-urban area about 2.5 hours from Jakarta. Komariyah is married and living with three people in the family home. 

Komariyah began working with Ruma one month ago because she wanted to increase her income. She feels really excited to expand her business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. 

As the business continues to run, she hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more airtime and bill payment transactions on a weekly basis.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 55-year-old married woman with four children. She has been running a business selling milk for many years. She has become famous for providing good quality milk, and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. 

Currently she is in her third loan cycle, and has applied for a loan of PKR 40,000. This will allow her to purchase one more cow. 

Shehnaz is hopeful that she will be able to increase her sales and profits alongside. She dreams of improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Nidaa

texts.en:
This is Nidaa’s second loan cycle from Ryada. Her previous loan helped her to develop her business and had a positive outcome, and she was able to increase her inventory. She is very grateful to everyone helped her.

Today, Nidaa is planning to continue developing her business to make sure that her children will have the best living and education, and, at the same time, to ensure that her customers are satisfied. She decided to obtain this loan to purchase a power generator and a large quantity of fabric and thread because her number of customers continue to increase. This will help her to improve the financial conditions for her family. Her dream is to expand her business more and more in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a power generator and a large quantity of fabric and thread.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan de 49 años de edad, soltera con dos hijos menores de edad, es originario de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal.  En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias as u esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de cerdos en pie. El dedica a su negocio unas ocho horas diarias ofreciendo su producto, en su casa de habitación y por encargo. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de un lote de cerdos, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Juan agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Juan, who is 49 years old, is single with two minor children. He is a native of León, a place that is located in the western zone of the country. He is known for being hard-working and responsible, with a will for personal achievement. In his free time, he likes to enjoy the company of his children. Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources, he was not able to study for a career, and he was forced to work from an early age to help with the household expenses.

Thanks to his effort and his will to advance, he has a business of selling live pigs. He works at his business some eight hours daily, offering his product from his home and by order. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock his business of buying and selling pigs [by buying] a batch of pigs so that in the not-too-distant future he can obtain better income. Juan is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer people of scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have a means of dignified work.

loans.use: to buy a batch of pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 36 years old and he lives in Gaza with his wife and three children. In 2009. he thought to do something to contributing to the family's income, to meet the needs of all of his family members.

From 2009 until now, he has been sewing clothes for many shops. He rented a workshop and he has two employees who distribute the clothes to the shops. His dream is to make his own brand of clothing in large areas.

Ali is asking Ryada for this loan to buy another sewing machine, an electric generator and a laundry steamer. This will help to increase the number of his customers and lead to an increase in his income, which will help him to improve the financial conditions for his family. 

He is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine, an electric generator and a laundry steamer.

loans.name: Raja'

texts.en:
Raja' is 34 years old; she lives in a small house in Gaza with her husband and four children. All of her children attend the public primary school.

For the past four years, Raja' has run a food market, a rented market, and she hopes in the future to buy a grocery. This business has helped the family's income, especially since her husband works in a public institution and earns a low salary, and especially when they are big family and need to ensure their children's needs are met.

Raja' sells different kinds of food items, such as soft drinks, cookies and similar things. She asked Ryada for this loan to buy furniture and shelves for her grocery store.
 
Raja' is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success in her business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy furniture and shelves for her grocery store.

loans.name: Afrah

texts.en:
Afrah is 41-years-old.  She lives in a small house in Gaza with her husband and seven children, five of them attend the public primary school and two of them are in kindergarten.

For the past two years, she has run a food market at a rented market.  She hopes in the future to buy a grocery store.  This business helps the family income, because her husband works in a public institution with a low salary, especially since they are a big family and need to insure their kids.  

Afrah sells different kinds of food stuffs, like soft drinks, cookies and all kinds of stuff.  She asked Ryada for this loan to buy a machine to rip meat,  goods to sale, and shelves. 

Afrah is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success in her business with this loan.  She wants to use part of the profits on her children’s education in the future.

loans.use: to buy a machine to rip meat, goods to sale, and shelves.

loans.name: Yaser

texts.en:
Yaser is 35 years old; he lives in Gaza with his wife and two children. He opened a small coal workshop in 2008, and he delivers coal to the shops in his town. This business is the only source of income for his small family. 

Yaser is satisfied with the income of his business, but he needs this loan to buy a motorcycle in order to distribute the coal faster. He also wants to buy an electronic scale for his workshop, which will allow him to be able to increase his inventory. This will lead to an increase in the number of clients, and increase his income, which will help him to improve his family's financial condition.

Yaser is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle in order to distribute coal faster, and to buy an electronic scale for his workshop.

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is 32 years old; he lives in Ramallah. He sells various kinds of groceries, such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, and many other items in his grocery store. He opened his store two years ago.

Rami is requesting a loan to purchase a refrigerator and shelves. This will allow him to be able to increase his stock of items. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. His dream is to expand his business, and he desires to use part of the profits on his children’s education in the future. Rami is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and shelves.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man. He has 1 child. He describes himself as honest. He operates a carpentry shop where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy and convenient place and his primary customers are all types of people. He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of sufficient funds. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy timber, nails and other carpentry materials. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy timber, nails and other carpentry materials

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 39 years old and is married with four children. She lives with her family in Tulkarem. For more than ten years, she has been farming two kinds of vegetables: peppers and tomatoes. Linda sells her produce to traders and her business has helped increase her family’s income. 

Linda is requesting a loan from Ryada to purchase greenhouses to increase her crop. She is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve her goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur. She dreams of becoming well-known in the city for giving the best service to her clients. Linda is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success in her business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase greenhouses

loans.name: Merina

texts.en:
Merina is a 39-year-old lady from Kakamega County who is married to Bernard. He is a teacher and together they have 3 children aged 12, 9 and 2.

Merina operates a general store where she sells used jericans, brooms and she also sells cereals, a business she has done for the last 3 years. It earns her an income of 25000 KES per month. Merina has now applied for a loan of 10000 KES as her 1st loan with VisionFund Kenya. She intends to use this loan to expand her business. The profits will be used to educate her children and repay the loan.

She has a dream of expanding to be a wholesaler in this sector.

loans.use: to build a permanent structure for her business

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is 35 years old. He lives in Gaza with his wife and four children. He sells various used electronics goods. He has been involved in the retail business for many years, and he still needs a lot of improvements, so he is requesting this loan to purchase more goods and shelves, and to make decorations so that he will be able to increase his stock.

Mustafa is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase more goods and shelves, and to make decorations.

loans.name: Jose Oswaldo

texts.es:
José, se ha decidido por solicitar un nuevo crédito ya que el inventario de la venta de ropa no está lo suficientemente surtido comprara camisetas, chores, faldas, pantalones, camisas, blusas y collares, ya que se acerca la temporada de vacaciones y las ventas mejoran.
El financiamiento anterior ha sido de mucha ayuda para variar la mercadería y complacer los gustos de sus clientes, su familia cuenta con el mismo número de miembros y las ganancias han incrementado un poco.
texts.en:
José has decided to request a new loan since his inventory of clothing is not sufficiently stocked.  He will purchase t-shirts, shorts, skirts, pants, shirts, blouses, and necklaces since vacation season is approaching and his sales improve.

His last loan has been a lot of help in varying his merchandise and meeting the needs of his customers.  His family has the same number of members and his profits have increased a little.

loans.use: to purchase t-shirts, shorts, skirts, pants, shirts, blouses, and necklaces.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the filing fees for obtaining bar codes and a food safety permit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, assorted drinks, and bags of rice to expand her business.

loans.name: Achmad

texts.en:
Achmad runs a small stall where he sells mobile phone airtime credits and mobile accessories. He has been running this stall for one year. Achmad lives in Indramayu, a semi-urban area about six hours from Jakarta. Achmad is married.

To increase the family income, Achmad also works as a dealer. He joined Ruma one year ago to increase his income. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments for customers. As seen in the picture, Achmad is with his customer.

Achmad is starting to process electricity bill payments for his customers, which is a much-needed service in the area and will increase his income. To provide this new service, Achmad is required to print out receipts for customers. A Kiva loan will help him purchase this printer and be able to offer the new service.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone credit sales and bill payment transactions using a printer.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James lives in Kakamega. Kakamega County is located in Western Kenya and is famous for its rain forest. Many farmers in the area grow maize, sugarcane and bananas, with maize being the primary crop. The density of the old growth trees in the Kakamega forest and the variety of crops grown in the area make this an excellent area for beekeeping.

James is married and has three children. He is a building constructor, and his wife runs her own business. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for five years now, and they are currently growing maize and vegetables and rearing cows and goats on their farm. James is excited about beekeeping, as it will earn him income and provide him with honey for medicine, and the bees will help in pollinating his crops.

This is James’ first loan with Honey Care, and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to expand his farming projects. James’ hope for the future is to become a successful farmer.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: De Confianza Los Cerritos Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal de Confianza los Cerritos, está conformado por once integrantes, diez mujeres y un hombre, madres y padres responsables con veinte hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron  cursar una carrera y se vieron obligados a trabaja desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad lucha día a día para bríndales un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Ana y  tiene por actividad económica  una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, sal, fósforos, jugos, gaseosas, queso, verduras, jugos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. De confianza los Cerritos agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “De Confianza Los Cerritos” consists of 11 members, 10 women and 1 man. They are responsible parents who are responsible for 20 children among them. The members are originally from El Sauce, a place that is located in the northern part of the region. They are known for being hardworking, responsible, and having the drive to succeed on a personal level. Unfortunately, they lacked the financial resources required to pursue a degree, so they were obligated to work at a young age in order to help with the household expenses. At the moment, they strive each day to provide a better future for their children.

Thanks to her effort and her desire to move forward, Ana was appointed the group coordinator. Her business is a small store where she sells products in small quantities including rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, salt, matches, juices, sodas, cheese, and vegetables. Ana devotes about 12 hours to her business by offering her products. The purpose of her loan is to invest it as operating capital so that she can restock her business of buying and selling products. In the near future, she would like to generate more income.

The group “De Confianza Los Cerritos” appreciates the assistance that the Kiva lenders provide to people who have limited resources and come from poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that they can earn a decent living.

loans.use: to buy various products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Nohad

texts.en: Nohad is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of five children who attend school. She has been running her bakery since 2006 to help her beloved husband, who works as a taxi driver, cover their family needs. She is a hard worker and has a good reputation in her region because she insists on always providing her clients with the best services. She is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to buy flour for her business with the aim of increasing her productivity, attracting new customers and therefore increasing her revenues. Nohad is very excited to receive those funds as she is sure that this loan will help her to remarkably improve her business.

loans.use: to buy flour for her bakery business

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 33-year-old Lebanese single man. Four years ago, he started his business, which consists of owning a huge saw by which he cuts hard bricks and pavers. He worked very hard over the years and faced good and bad circumstances. 

Today, with his intention of improving his work furthermore, he is seeking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l., so he can perform needed maintenance on his saw to be able to carry on with his work properly. Youssef is very optimistic and hopes that this loan will help him meet his expectations. He believes that one day he will be asking for a new loan where he will be capable of buying more goods and stuff.

loans.use: to perform needed maintenance on his saw.

loans.name: Sa'eb

texts.en:
Sa'ebis is 25 years old and lives with his family in Gaza.  He completed his education at the secondary stage.

This year, he started his own Internet coffee shop business for customers to access games and the internet  in his town. It was an impressive step forward, and he works hard to improve it.

Sa'eb still needs to improve his business and asks for a youth loan to buy additional computers and tables.  He believes that this will increase his customer base and therefore increase his income.

Sa'eb hopes that someday his shop will be the most well-known shop in his town.

loans.use: to buy computers, and  tables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a Mincer machin, and electronic generator.

loans.name: Idda

texts.en: Idda is a 37-year-old married woman. She has four children between the ages of 10 and 19. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be operating in an open air space. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy ingredients for preparing the food she sells. She hopes that in the future, she will have a five-star hotel. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of 40,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 26 years old and lives in Ramallah with his family. 

He sells  cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, and many other items in his grocery store. He opened it four years ago.

Mohammad requests this youth loan from Ryada to purchase a refrigerator and shelves. This will allow him to be able to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and become a successful entrepreneur. His dream is to expand his business, use part of the profits on his children’s education, and  improve his family conditions. 

Mohammad is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator and shelves.

loans.name: Fares

texts.en:
Fares is 38 years old and lives in Gaza city with his small family.

Two yeasr ago, Fares began raising goats and selling milk, cheese, and meat in the local market. It is a good business but still needs a lot of improvement. 

He asked Ryada for this loan to expand his business by building a barn for his animals.  He believes that this will increase his stock,and increase his income, which will help him to improve the financial conditions for his family. 

Fares is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to build a barn for his animals.

loans.name: Ramadhan

texts.en:
Ramadhan is a single man who lives in his own house that has no electricity or piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food. 

He has operated a poultry selling business for over a year. He mentioned disease outbreak, which causes losses, as a challenge in the business. He dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the KES 10,000 loan, he wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. He joined Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman who has five children, ages 10 to 20 years. She describes herself as hard-working. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows which produce milk for sale. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are local residents, hotels, schools, etc. She describes her biggest business challenge to be animal diseases and theft. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more dairy cows. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will achieve her business desires. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more dairy cows

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is married and has eight children, four of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a motorcycle transport business from door to door. In addition, she also operates a poultry farming business, which earns her another source of income. 

With the KES 50,000, she wants to add to her savings and purchase another motorcycle. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to add to her savings and purchase another motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Mackenzie

texts.en: Mackenzie is a 27-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a farm where he keeps poultry. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive place, and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more poultry and feed. His business goal is to have a large number of chickens within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy more poultry and feed

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy goods and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Priviledge

texts.en:
Privilege is a 24-year-old single lady and a mother of two. She resides in the Gokwe South district of Zimbabwe where she started a business selling clothing to supplement her family’s income. She sells assorted clothes including skirts, dresses, ladies' tracksuits, and children’s footwear. Privilege has been running this business for nine months and is very proud of her progress. 

With the requested Kiva loan she intends to make bulk purchases of clothes and footwear. Privilege hopes to pay school fees for her young brothers and sisters with the profit she makes. She also hopes to expand her business into a bigger shop. Privilege is also very dedicated to bettering her community as she is a Camfed Learner Guide who volunteers at the local school disseminating life skills education to students.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of clothes and footwear

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids who attend school. She lives in her own house that has no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her kids. 

She has operated a poultry-selling business for over three years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. 

With the KES 25,000 loan, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed for her business. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a pig, piglets and forage

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a married man with 1 child. He describes himself as honest. 

He operates a retail business to sell cooking fat, wheat flour, drinks and other items. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in a profitable place and his primary customers are all types. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of capital. He will use 100,000 KES to buy  cooking fat, drinks and other items. His business goal is to be successful within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, his income will be stable. 

This his third loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of 50,000 KES was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his child.

loans.use: to buy cooking fat, drinks and other items.

loans.name: Anar

texts.en:
Anar and his wife have been married for 8 years and have two children. The oldest is 6 years old and attends the first class of school. His 4 year-old daughter goes to  kindergarten.  

Anar is an IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) from Fuzuli  and now lives in Baku region with his family. Anar’s wife is a housewife and therefore all needs of the family are provided by Anar.

 Anar is a master construction worker. He hangs wallpaper, plasters, and completes other construction tasks. He has 9 years experience and does quality work.  Anar has a lot of customers. 

He wants to support his business with a 1,300 AZN loan to buy construction materials. He is thankful to Kiva organization and all lenders for their help. In the future, he wants to hire an assistant.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is a 36-year-old married man. He has two children, ages 5 and 8 years. 

He operates a transport business where he transports customers using a motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for six years. His primary customers are daily commuters. He describes his biggest business challenge to be bad weather conditions. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy spare parts to service the motorcycle. 

His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his business and acquire land. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Nato

texts.en:
Nato is a 25-year-old married woman who lives in Telavi  with her husband Giorgi. 

Giorgi is a sergeant and earns a monthly salary. Nato is unemployed at the moment despite having a higher education. She is very motivated to have a job and decided to start her own business. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $ 600 to start a clothing business. 

She will purchase linens and clothes from the wholesalers and then resell them at higher prices. She has no experience in this field, but is very motivated and thinks that the business will be profitable. Nato awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Tuungane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nsimire est présidente dans le  groupe de credit  Tuungane. Agée de 54 ans, elle est mariée à un homme sans emploi et mère de 5 enfants  dont 4 vont à l’école. Vendeuse ambulante (dans la rue) depuis plus de 20 ans , elle sollicite ce nouveau prêt pour acheter 10 sacs de braises. Le grand danger de son métier c’est la vente à credit. Son objectif est d’avoir son propre dépôt et renforcer ses épargnes. Elle remercie Hekima de promouvoir les femmes pauvres économiquement actives.
texts.en:
Nsimire is the president of the Tuungane loan group.  She is 54 years old and married to a man who is currently out of work.  The couple have five children, of whom four attend school.  

Nsimire has been a small trader for more than 20 years, selling her goods in the streets.  She has requested this loan in order to buy ten sacks of charcoal for resale.  The biggest problem with her method of selling is selling goods on credit.  Nsimire's objective is to have her own storage facility and improve her savings level.  

She is very grateful to the field partner, Hekima for supporting poor, economically active women.

loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline is a married woman who has four children. She describes herself as optimistic. She operates a stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a semi-urban area and her primary customers are local consumers. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy ingredients for preparing the food she sells. Her business goal is to open a hotel within five years. She hopes that in the future, her business will grow. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing food she sells

loans.name: File

texts.en:
File is a 32-year-old married woman who wants to buy a milk cow and expand the existing stable. She has a cow but wants to increase her income by selling more raw milk to  nearby dairy farms. 

In addition to livestock, she plants and sells corn, wheat, oats, rye, potatoes and seasonal vegetables. She also owns some grapevines and makes red wine.  Her husband works in construction.  All in all, they’ve been making an okay income for their family, which  includes their elderly parents who according to tradition, live with the youngsters.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and expand the existing stable.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase her stock of clothing and shoes.

loans.name: George William

texts.en: George William is a 63-year-old tomato farmer who also sells milk from cows. He began this business to sustain his family. He will use the loan to buy pesticides and mulches. His clientele includes public markets. He is hard working and honest. His challenge is changes in climate.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and mulches for his farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more drinks, charcoal, cold water, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Sandra Eduardo

texts.pt:
A Sra Sandra de 33 anos de idade, solteira e mae de uma filha que esta a frequentar a escola no ensino primario, sustenta sua mae e seu irmao. Ela è chefe da sala de empacotamento na empresa de producao de banana.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (cimento, blocos, chapas de zinco,barrotes, pedra  e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a consrucao da sua casa.
seu maior desafio é encontrar recursos para mais cedo concluir sua casa.
texts.en:
Sandra is 33 years old and single. She has a daughter who attends elementary school. She supports her mother and her brother. She's the head of packaging for a banana company.
The current loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (cement, bricks, zinc plates, beams and rocks) and to pay for labor so she can continue building her house.
Her biggest challenge is finding the resources to finish her house sooner.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, bricks, zinc plates, beams and rocks) and to pay for labor so she can continue building her house.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman and she has 7 children. She describes herself to be determined.

She operates a farm where she grows carrots. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are hotels. Jane describes her biggest business challenge to be weather changes.

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy seeds and other farm inputs. She hopes that, in the future, she will be economically stable. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy seeds and other farm inputs

loans.name: Cristhian Jose

texts.es:
Cristhian de 28 años de edad, casado con tres hijos menores de edad, es originario del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región, se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergente,  jugos. El dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestible. Cristhian agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Cristhian, who is 28 years old, is married and has three young children. He is from El Sauce, which is located in the northern area of the region. He is known to be hardworking, responsible, and driven to improve himself. Unfortunately, he wasn't able to get a higher education because he lacked the financial resources and had to start working at a young age to help with household expenses. Currently he fights every day in order to give his children a better future.

His effort and drive enabled him to start his own business, a small grocery store where he sells retail amounts of basic goods like rice, beans, milk, bread, eggs, juice, and detergent. He dedicates about twelve hours a day to his business, so that he can obtain higher income in the near future. The purpose of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock up on groceries for his business. 

Cristhian appreciates the help that Kiva lenders offer people with limited financial resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can earn a decent living.

loans.use: to stock up on groceries for his business.

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is a 27-year-old single man. He describes himself as business oriented. 

He operates a construction business to build houses. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a local area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of building materials. He will use 20,000 KES to buy tools. 

His business goal is to expand within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be future oriented. She operates a retail business where she cooks fish for selling. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are local consumers. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fish, cooking oil, and cooking pans. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy fish, cooking oil, and cooking pans

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 25-year-old married woman with 1 child. She describes herself as focused. 

She operates a retail business to sell cooking oil, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a local area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be theft and poor weather conditions. 

She will use 20,000 KES to buy cooking oil, flour and other items. Her business goal is to own a big retail shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a wholesale shop. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, flour and other items.

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es: Luis Manuel, 26 años de edad casado con un hijo menor aun bajo su responsabilidad, originario de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que es reproductivamente comercial y turística por sus hermosas playas, Luis es un microempresario propietario y administrador de una barbería unisex, ubicada cerca de su casa de habitación, en el cual ofrece el servicio de cortes de cabellos tanto para caballeros como para damas, cejas, peinados, tintes, alisados, planchados, corte de barba, entre otros cuenta con una empleada, quien le paga, para realizar los otros tipos de servicios para damas, inicia su negocio con fondos propios, buscando un medio digno de vivir y sacar adelante a su familia, también ofrece golosinas gaseosas, jugos mientras esperan los clientes su turno, uno de sus sueños es poder mejorar su negocio y ver convertido en todo un profesional a su pequeño hijo, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en la compra de un activo fijo(sillón de barbero) y de esa manera brindarles un mejor servicios a sus clientes.
texts.en: Luis Manuel is 26 years old, he has a young son he is responsible for, and he is originally from the municipality of Chinandega located in the western part of the country. This area is good for business and tourism because of its beautiful beaches. Luis is a small business owner and runs a unisex barbershop. It is located in his home and he offers hair cuts for men and women. He also offers brow-work, hair styling, hair dying, straightening, shaving and other services. He has one employee who he pays to take care of other services for women. He began his business with his own money, looking for a more dignified way to earn a living and to support his family. He also offers snacks, sodas and juices while his customers wait. One of his dreams is to be able to improve his business and to see his son have a professional career. The loan will be used to invest in fixed assets, like a barber's seat, and to offer a better service to his customers.

loans.use: purchase fixed assets like a barber's chair.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

For the past five years, Josephine has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge in her business and she dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 40,000 loan, Josephine wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel is a married woman and has 8 children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting of 10,000 KES, she wants to purchase stock of wheat, maize and beans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat, maize and beans

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 28-year-old single man. He describes himself to be well established. He operates a quarry where he sells building stones. He has been involved in this business for three years. His primary customers are house builders. He describes his biggest business challenge to be hard labor and lack of safety equipment. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a quarry. His business goal is to own a major quarry within five years.

loans.use: to buy a quarry

loans.name: Chubaka Group

texts.fr: Madame Mapendo, conseillère dans le  groupe de credit Chubaka ; est  mariée à l’âge de 39 ans. Mère de 5 enfants  dont seulement 3 sont scolarisés et 2 autres ont moins de 5 ans.  Elle est vendeuse d’huile de palme au marché du village depuis 2004.  Ce nouveau prêt va l’aider à acheter 4 bidons d’huile de palme pour le renforcement de son activité.  Les plus grands obstacles pour son entreprise sont: la mauvaise conservation de la marchandise et le vol. Son objectif est de devenir une grande commerçante dans les jours à venir. Elle remercie Hekima pour l’encadrement des femmes pauvres économiquement actives.
texts.en:
Mapendo is the leader of the Chubaka loan group.  She is 39 years old, married and has five children.  Three of her children attend school and the other two are under five years old.  

Mapendo has been selling palm oil at the village market since 2004.  This new loan will enable her to buy four drums of palm oil for resale to improve her trading figures.  The biggest challenges in her business are theft and poor storage of merchandise.  Her aim is to become a large trader in the years to come.

Mapendo is very grateful to the field partner, Hekima for the support which they offer to poor, economically active women.

loans.use: to buy 4 drums of palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shrimp, fresh fish, and dried fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap, toothpaste, paper tissue, etc., to attract more customers

loans.name: Maen 2 Group

texts.en:
This group is  Maen 2 and is composed of three women and one man.  They applied for a loan of 130,000 YER from AMB. 

The president of the group is Mrwa. She is 24 years old, married, and has  one son. She lives in Hodeidah, Yemen.

She rents  wedding dresses.  She will use the loan to buy more dresses in order to rent them for  weddings ceremonies.  She will increase her working capital and improve her business. Her reason for applying for this loan is lack of capital. She faces many challenges in her business, including increasing her client base, and she will use the profits to improve the quality of life for her family.

 Mrwa looks forward to providing better life conditions for her family.  In the future, Mrwa hopes to open a special store to rent  weddings dresses.

loans.use: to buy  weddings dresses  to rent them for  weddings.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a 26-year-old married entrepreneur living in Gokwe South, Zimbabwe. 

For the past ten months, she has run a successful poultry business selling chickens to people in her community. The business has been so successful that she employs two family members to assist her in the work. Constance’s two children motivated her to start her business since she wants to give them a good quality of life. 

With the requested Kiva loan, Constance will purchase chicks, vaccines and feed to boost her sales volume and profits. With the additional profits, she hopes to expand her project to supply the local shops with eggs. With a growing business, she hopes to create more employment for community members and buy food for her family. When she is not at her business, Constance is participating as a chairperson for the local Cama chapter. Cama is Camfed’s alumnae network for women who work to improve the communities in which they live.

loans.use: to  purchase chicks, vaccines and feed.

loans.name: Rozina

texts.en:
Rozina and Fran  are in their late thirties and parents of two teenagers who are 17 and 13 years old. The loan that they are requesting from Kiva lenders will help them to repair their family home. They have begun to demolish part of it as seen in the picture. Rozina works as a waitress and her husband is a prison guard. 

They live in a little town in northern Albania that, under the communist era, was considered an industrial town because of its paper, flour and glass factories and  agricultural and chemical plants. Out of all these, only the flour plant still operates.  The other business,  like so many others in Albania, were closed down as soon as the regime collapsed. Unfortunately, this town has become a poor town during the past years.

loans.use: to make repairs to their rundown family home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a 22-year-old woman who is single and lives in the Gokwe South district of Zimbabwe. For the past year, Yolanda has run a business buying and selling carrier bags. She usually waits for customers at the entrance of the big supermarket and now has a few people she supplies with the carrier bags. 

With the requested Kiva loan, Yolanda intends to make a wholesale purchase of carrier bags, and she would like to venture into small plastic carrier bags to cater to shoppers who are buying fewer items. Yolanda wants to meet her basic needs with the profits she makes.

When she is not at her business, she is participating as a volunteer member of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network of women who work to better the communities in which they live. As a part of the Cama network, Yolanda is a Learner Guide who teaches students valuable life skills at the local school.

loans.use: to make a wholesale purchase of carrier bags

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis is a 27-year-old businesswoman who is married with two children and living in the Gokwe South district of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully operating a poultry project in her local area for over 18 months. Family members assist her in the project as well. 

With the requested Kiva loan Mavis will make bulk purchases of chicks, feed, and vaccines. She will buy food for her family with the additional profits and hopes to expand her project to sell eggs as well as chickens. When she is not working at her business, Mavis serves as a volunteer peer educator at schools in her community.

loans.use: to make bulk purchases of chicks, feed, and vaccines

loans.name: Orlando

texts.pt:
O Sr Orlando de de 54 anos de idade, casado e pai de 5 filhos dos quais 3 sao independente e 2 estao a frequentar a ecola no ensino primario e secundario, sustenta 2 netos e a sua mae. Ele è carpinteiro das obras na empresa de produçao de banana e è tambem pescador artezanal a mais de 12 anos seus peixes vende em diversos mercado e sustenta os seus filhos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (cimento, barrotes, blocos, varoes, pedra e pagamento de mao-de-obra ) para dar continuidade com a sua casa. seu maior desafio é terminara sua obra para garantir comodidade a sua familia
texts.en:
Orlando is 54 years old and married. He has five children, three of whom are independent and two attend primary and secondary school. He supports two grandchildren and his mother. He does carpentry work for a banana company and he's also been an artisan fisherman for over 12 years. He sells his fish in various markets and supports his children.
The loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (cement, beams, bricks, rods and rocks) and to pay for labor so he can continue building his house. His biggest challenge is finishing the construction work in order to ensure comfort for his family.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (cement, beams, bricks, rods and rocks) and to pay for labor so he can continue building his house.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 27-year-old single woman with 1 child. She describes herself as ambitious and patient. 

She operates a M-pesa business where she offers mobile phone based money transfer services. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a busy place and her primary customers are walk-in and permanent customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds and M-pesa delays due to network challenges.

She will use 20,000 KES to add money for customers to withdraw. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand business and take care of her child. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to expand her money transfer services.
